placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
We had the most wonderful experience staying at Dream Cliff Mountain Resort. From the day we arrived until the day we left, the staff and management looked after us so well, it really felt like home.

The location of the resort is beautiful. It’s up in the mountains, and we had the most amazing views from our Beehive Room, the swimming pool, and even the dining area. Everywhere you looked, there were stunning mountain views.

One thing that really stood out to us was how well they looked after our food needs. We don’t eat onion or garlic, and every day the chef made us special meals off the menu. It meant a lot to us and made our stay even more comfortable.

What we loved the most was their attitude. It felt like the word “no” didn’t exist for them. Every request we had, big or small, was taken care of with a smile.

Since we stayed there for 6 nights, the resort even surprised us with a small going-away gift. It was such a thoughtful gesture and made us feel really special.

We left with lovely memories and so much appreciation for the whole team.
title: The best Stay at Dream Cliff Mountain Resort

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for the beautiful review of our resort. 
We appreciate people like you coming and staying with us.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is a perfect example of when nature meets luxury. Neither is it too rural, nor too commercial.
The rooms are an experience in themselves. The dorm shape is unique and beautiful. Sounds and voices echo inside the rooms and is actually quite enjoyable. Due to its shape, the room is very spacious (especially worth it for the money). The furnishing is also unique and natural.
The food is truly delicious. We ordered lunch from the restaurant and the portions were much bigger than expected.
And the view off the balconies were amazing; a perfect spot to have an afternoon tea.
The staff was very friendly and helpful.

It is a must stay at laste once in a lifetime.
title: Perfect Combination of Nature and Luxury

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for the fantastic review. Your words say its all.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a truly invigorating two night stay at Dream Cliff with its silence and ideal weather. Sweeping views looking towards the south eastern part of the country with rolling hills sloping toward the planes dotted with ancient tanks, paddy fields and jungles. The backdrop was the majestic cliffs of the Haputale Range. Very well kept dome shaped rooms, two pools including one infinity pool merging with the rolling hills and the planes. All the staff, service and the food were excellent.  The manager Mr Raphael Dias had his feet firmly on the ground and took good care of us. Steward Athula went out of his way assisted by Pradeep, to mention only a few.  Reminded us of     Rev Walter Stanley Senior, that English poet with a Sri Lankan heart, who was in love with this area and whose  ashes are interred at the most picturesque St. Andrew's Church, Haputale, nearby.
"Here I stand in spirit
as in body once I stood
Long years ago, in love with all the land
This peerless land of Beauty's plenitude"
title: A Cool Hillside Haven with Sweeping Views of the Planes

ownerResponse/text: Thank you Ishanthi for the beautiful review. Hope to see you again with your family.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
We had the most glorious time at Dream Cliff Mountain resort! The beehive cabanas are all overlooking the beautiful and breathtaking Beragala gap, with the udawalawe reservoir in the back ground. We spent hours on our balcony as the view seemed to change every few minutes based on the sun! When it was behind a cloud the mist slowly crept in between the mountains creating shadows on land below, and when the sun came out the mist disappeared illuminating the hills and valleys. We were even able to experience the early morning sunrise and evening sunset from the comfort of our balcony.
The resort is above a panoramic view of mountain ranges with an infinity pool that allows us to soak in the sun while enjoying the view.

The restaurant is very spacious and the food was delicious! The staff were very accommodating and went over and beyond to make our stay comfortable and memorable.
We went on a hike and the hotel arranged transport and a guide to take us which was very helpful. The village trek ends at a beautiful waterfall which was a thrill for all of us.
Highly recommend this resort as a hill country getaway!
Heaven is a place on earth, and it’s definitely Dream Cliff Mountain!
title: Paradise found - at Dream Cliff Mountain Resort

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for the beautiful review. Kindly spread the message amongst your friends and family and recommend us to them so that they can have the best of Sri Lanka during their holiday.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Está perdido en medio de la naturaleza, pero nosotros hicimos parada entre Nuwara Eliya y yala y valío la pena.
text:
Es un hotel con una localización y vistas únicas. Es una experiencia para hacer una noche, y descansar en medio de la naturaleza. 
La piscina es preciosa con todas las vistas a la naturaleza desde el agua... El restaurante está detrás y tomar algo al atardecer es una gran experiencia. 
La cena y desayuno muy correcto y siempre intentando agradar y hacer lo que mejor te convenga. Nosotros desayunamos el "continental" y estaba lleno de comida, diferentes panes, confituras, croissants, zumos, cafés, y huevos del tipo que quieras que te cocinan y te traen a la mesa. 
Las habitaciones son cabañas muy auténticas en medio de la naturaleza. Yo estaba dentro de la habitación y por mi terraza cruzaron varias veces diferentes animales, mamíferos, con toda tranquilidad pensando que no había nada. La habitación es una única pieza como una cabaña que se comunica baño y habitación por arriba y la acústica es diferente (con eco) por la forma de la cabaña pero es una experiencia única. Las habitaciones (cogimos 2 cabañas porque íbamos con niños) muy limpias, el aire acondicionado funcionaba perfectamente, el baño y la ducha super agradables (suelo de piedras, jabones todo lo que necesitábamos estaba) y las camas muy cómodas. 
El personal en todo momento nos ayudó con maletas, con los niños y estuvo pendiente de que pasaramos una velada fantástica y así fue. 
Vale la pena la experiencia!!
title: Cabañas muy auténticas, en medio de la naturaleza. Vistas increíbles! Vale la pena

ownerResponse/text: Thank you Oliver for the great review. You said it all and hope to see you soon in Sri Lanka.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
Nous avons été très surpris par les derniers avis postés sur cet hôtel.
Une affaire de goût, en effet…
Pour notre part, nous avons à peu près tout apprécié ici: l’accueil bien sûr, la vue époustouflante sur la vallée et les collines environnantes mais aussi la décoration de l’hôtel et du bungalow (on peut ne pas aimer le Bleu de Klein),  et l’originalité de cette salle de bain. Alors, c’est vrai qu’il y a un petit problème d’intimité et que la cloison séparant chambre et salle de bain gagnerait à être étendue jusqu’au plafond car en plus, les sons sont amplifiés par la configuration bungalow. La cuisine, loin d’être infecte, est goûteuse, surtout les spécialités sri-lankaises.
La bouteille d’eau pétillante de 37 cl est facturée 350 Rs soit environ 1,2 €, les cocktails environ 8€, les petits pain (qu’il faut réclamer car ils ne les portent pas spontanément) sont délicieux, servis chaud avec du beurre salé.
Le repas d’hier soir était un grand moment, agrémenté en outre d’un accompagnement musical sous la forme d’un joueur de flûte dispensant une musique très zen.
Le petit-déjeuner sri-lankais est excellent, généreux et équilibré. Si vous préférez, un petit déjeuner continental est proposé, qui est très correct.
La piscine à débordement est superbe, exposée plein sud et s’ouvrant sur le paysage grandiose de la vallée, et suffisamment grande pour qu’on puisse nager sans atteindre le bord opposé au bout de 10 ou 12 brasses.
N.B: À notre arrivée à hier, notre guide et notre chauffeur ont eu droit comme nous à une serviette et une boisson rafraîchissantes.
title: Une affaire de goût ? Certainement !

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ravi,Thank you for your lovely review and for sharing your experience at Tamarind Hill. We’re delighted that you enjoyed the heritage charm, our warm hospitality, and the traditional cuisine—especially the string hoppers and curries!
We truly appreciate your understanding of the unique character and upkeep that historic properties require It was a pleasure hosting you, and we look forward to welcoming you back again soon.Regards,Tamarind hill Team.
placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Led by it's very hospitable General Manager Suranjith and his warm & welcoming team, Tamarind Hill is a beautiful heritage property with peacocks, mongoose and other creatures around. The delicious food they served, especially the string hoppams with various curries including daal, pumpkin, jackfruit, fish and chicken were heart warming. Their admiral suite had a huge washroom with a rather luxurious feel to it. May to July is off session and so a good time  to get good deals on room rates. If you enjoy living on heritage properties like this one you will know that they require huge maintenance and special permissions from local municipalities... everywhere in the world. If you're willing to ignore minor glitches like squeeky grand old floorboards or slightly leaky faucets, you will love soaking in the rather glorious (yet the unfortunate slavery bit...as with all such colonized countries/ properties) history of the place.
title: A touch of history and tradition

text: Très bel hôtel historique dont le bâtiment principal récemment restauré a plus de 250 ans. placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
The hotel is happy to arrange tuk tuks as it's a 3 kilometres distance to Galle Fort 
Take your own alcohol if you need it, there is a fridge in the room.
text: We really enjoyed our time here in such a beautiful and historic building. The rooms are spacious with lovely furniture and giant beds. The hotel is in the middle of a longer term refurbishment programme and they are upgrading each room at a time so some facilities are a little more old fashioned than others and they are currently awaiting their drinks licence so you are allowed to bring in your own alcohol free of charges   it is a training hotel so there are young, enthusiastic staff trying their best, always welcoming you with big smiles. The pool is very large and at night surrounded by wild peacocks..they are in the process of adding a screen to block of their unsightly neighbour but it didn't bother us. Breakfasts are tailored to your needs and they are happy to prepare anything you need for supper  it's 3 kilometres from town but we liked the peace this afforded
title: A peaceful haven full of charm and atmosphere

placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Eigentlich schreibe ich kaum noch Bewertungen, aber das Tamarind ist ein Lob wert.

Ein schönes, kleines, (12 Zimmer), stilvolles hideaway 10 TukTuk-Minuten vom Fort entfernt, sehr ruhig, man hört nur die Vögel, die Affen und die Frösche. Alle Räume im Tamarind sind liebevoll eingerichtet mit dunklen Holzböden und Holzmöbeln (das Haupthaus ist 250 Jahre alt). Überall gibt es überdachte Sitzplätze.  Alles ist frisch renoviert und sauber. Das Personal ist  freundlich und hilfsbereit. Es waren wenig Gäste da, also gab es serviertes Frühstück und Abendessen nach Wunsch, westlich und asiatisch. Wir hatten das Zimmer 4 mit kleiner Terrasse und Blick in den Dschungel und zum Pool. Also wirklich empfehlenswert wenn man dem Touristentrubel vom Galle Fort entgehen will.
title: Wunderschönes, ruhiges hideaway

text:
This was our first time at Tamarind Hill and definitely won’t be our last. What a gorgeous hotel! Has a very old world charm and the decor of the hotel was simply delightful. But what was just out of this world was the service! Everyone from the manager to the chef to all the hotel staff we encountered, it was  Sri Lankan hospitality at its finest. 

And the food, oh my goodness we had the most delicious Sri Lankan breakfast and I could just sit there all day eating that! Every dish that we ate was truly a piece of heaven and the service that went along with it made this experience so memorable. The breakfast was soo good that we skipped lunch and dinner and savored every morsel of the breakfast! 

Hotels can be great, the food can be delicious but what makes the place that much more appealing is the service and Tamarind Hill has all of that plus a fabulous staff who will make sure your every need is met and the experience is one to remember!
title: Exceptional Service!

roomTip: It’s a $3 tuk tuk dive to Galle centre … and a 5 minute walk to the beach near the Jetwing lighthouse hotel.
text:
A hidden gem , an exquisite colonial home with grand proportions,  beautiful furniture and discreet areas to relax in . Staff are well meaning and in abundance , they may not speak much English- but I didn’t even try to communicate in Singhalese. There are only 12 rooms - all are very spacious and decorated with individual mahogany furniture . It’s NOT the Hilton or Radisson … thank goodness…. So don’t expect mini bar and extensive menu . The dinner from the limited menu was delicious , I would like to have seen more local dishes on offer . No wine license - but take your own.
A peaceful retreat , very serene , no piped music, and a feeling that you are staying in a friend’s home.
There is a resident turtle in the pond , peacocks grace the courtyard in the morning, monkeys can be seen in the jungle behind , a mongoose crossed the drive this morning.
I hope no one spoils this little haven .
The pool was clean and we had it to ourselves . 
Thank you Tamarind Hill .
title: Hidden Jewel

text: The location is very much colonial built and beautiful. I will start by saying that they have one of the best “welcome drinks”, Tamarindo. That was refreshing. placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: Ein echtes Juwel direkt ausserhalb von Kandy. Hier wohnt man in absoluter Ruhe in einem herrschaftlichen Landsitz mit persönlichem Butler. Sehr geschmackvoll eingerichtet mit einem grossen Garten und Pool. Super Essen und Service und seit acht Generationen im Familienbesitz.
title: Ein echtes Juwel ausserhalb von Kandy

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: It was wonderful to stay in this  old property, so well maintained giving an insight into its history. Sitting on the veranda with. G&T whilst watching the tropical rains envelop us was so relaxing. Helpful yet discreet staff. Superb breakfast and evening menu changed on a daily basis, although limited to a few choices the dishes were outstanding. Costly, but an unforgettable experience, a small hotel with only 9 rooms but this made it more special and intimate, ideal for couples.
title: Charming period house

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: A charming hotel of understated beauty sitting comfortably within a luscious natural setting. My breath was taken away as I walked into a space which was at the same time welcoming and calming. Light flooding in from the garden..beautiful furniture designed by Geoffrey Bawa who also designed the alterations to this house and subtly turned it into an unforgettable place to stay and savour the moment.
title: Charming hotel of understated beauty

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: Two nights here and we wished we were staying longer.  The house and gardens are beautiful.  Our room was large as was the bathroom and had its own private terrace where we chose to have breakfast and could have had dinner.  The staff seemed to be always on hand for whatever we wanted and the food was excellent - particularly their 10 curry night.
title: Stunning Hotel

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Make the most of relaxing by the tranquil pool abd having pre dinner drinks in sitting area.
text: A fabulous hotel where you feel as if you are getting a personalised experience. Our butler Argenta couldn't do enough for us and looked after us perfectly during our two day stay. Rooms are spacious and well furnished, the only downside there being no tea making facilities which we found odd as every other hotel we've stayed in in Sri Lanka has them. Food here is superb and there is a lovely seating area for pre dinner drinks. Dinner is taken on the terrace with views of the gardens and tranquil pool area. A really delightful place to stay and unwind after sightseeing in Kandy. Highly recommend and thank you to all staff.
title: An excellent small hotel with first class service

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful colonial  house with original features.   The staff was very friendly and helpful.  However, we felt it was a little bit mean to charge for a cup of tea in the afternoon especially as our room (Ultra room) did not have any facilities for us to make one.
title: Beautiful colonial house

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: A wonderful experience. Very special. Lovely room. Also our butler was a delight. Food was wonderful as was the service. My wife said it was the best shower in the world and I thought it was the fastest Wifi in Sri Lanka. Brilliant. Lifetime memories.
title: Wonderful Experience

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Small hotel with a big heart. Enjoy.
text: Kandy House Hotel is a great place to start a Sri Lanka holiday. The hotel has good rooms with all that you need. The food is exceptional. From Breakfast to Dinner. Top choice and served with a smile. Secure and safe environment with pleasant gardens and a welcoming swimming pool.
title: Kandy House Hotel

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: We were here for only 1 night, it’s a 200 year old Manor House with 9 bedrooms and everyone was given a butler. The staff were clearly very proud to work there and were so lovely. We were in the Black Rajah room which was on the ground floor by an open air courtyard, it rained a lot the night we were there and we were woken up by how loud it was. Also due to the weather we weren’t able to enjoy the terrace or pool but it was such a lovely setting. The bathroom was quite small and the water from the shower went everywhere. The door to the room didn’t close without being locked with the key. Otherwise a wonderful experience.
title: Quaint manor house

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
When considering this property, you have to take into account it’s an old Manor House built in 1804 - if you like everything bright & shiny & new, this may not be the place for you. We stayed in the Black Rajah ultra room and yes, the very old, arched louvre doors may not fit like plastic double glazed doors but it’s not, as in a previous review, below the restaurant - the restaurant is further along the corridor on the same level, and is outside. One thing I will mention about Black Raja - there is a lovely open courtyard enroute to the restaurant with comfy seating, bang opposite the room- and we could clearly hear the torrential rain in the night through the opening.
 Our butler, Neemal, looked after us very well, always at the front door to open the car door with an umbrella (we had rain everyday), get us drinks, take our menu order & then serve at the table - lovely man. We only had dinner one night but thoroughly enjoyed it - choice of 2 starters, 3 mains & several desserts, all well cooked & tasty. Breakfast was plentiful. One thing I would mention is that wherever your room is, there are about 10 steps down to the lower floor for the restaurant, without a handrail - I’m not great at going downstairs but found I could put a steadying hand on the side - I know Neemal would have helped had I not been comfortable.
One thing I would mention, again because of the rain, we couldn’t use our outdoor space, whereas some suites on the ground floor were under cover, with sun beds, so could be utilised regardless of the weather.
We would definitely recommend a stay here - it’s quiet, with beautiful grounds & pool & a good proximity to Kandy.
title: Ultra room - Black Raja

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: This was undoubtedly the best hotel we stayed in whilst touring Sri Lanka. Chummy, our Butler, took exceptional care of us. The room had a stunning view across the gardens. The furnishings are exquisite & the food gorgeous. I just wish we could have stayed longer.
title: Stunning 220 year old manor house

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka

text:

The property is a boutique hotel with only about nine rooms, set in lush gardens and with a beautiful, if brisk, swimming pool looking down the valley over rice paddies. We would definitely go back.

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka

Close to Victoria Golf resort for phenomenal golfing
title: Colonial charm with excellent butler service

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Food and drink cost match the room charge so be prepared to pay. The quality is great.
text: Colonial style hotel that offers very traditional rooms in a lovely setting. Pool, rooms, common areas, grounds etc all excellent. Exactly what we feel most comfortable with. We were lucky to get an upgrade to a slightly larger room with separate seating area on the upper floor which was a lovely gesture. Service excellent. The allocated butler was very friendly, professional and was very accommodating. I saw other reviews commenting on the food menu and cost. Lovely lunch menu. Very tasty with good portion size. Dinner menu had two starter options and three main to choose from. We had no issue in selecting and found the quality to be truly excellent. Very high standard. I saw other reviewers commenting on the price of food and drink. I agree it is high but should not come as a surprise given the cost of the rooms. If you are prepared to pay the room rate for this unique offering then you need to come ready to spend on the food and drink. Take on the whole experience, that is what holidays are for. One area for improvement which is very minor. The pool is amazing but needs a little love. Walls need a clean. The algae does come off, I tried. Also get the infinity working!! The pool is an asset so milk it.
title: Amazing stay. Would recommend but read reviews to ensure it is for you

placeInfo/address: Coconut Cultivation Board Road Pasikuda, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Отдыхали с 13.03.2025 г. по 01.04.2025 г. семьёй: 4 взрослых и 3 ребенка (1, 4 и 8 лет).

1. Питание: 3,6 (3,5).
1.1. Завтрак: 3,5
Завтраки однообразные - несколько видов яиц, два вида сосисок, один вид сыра, несколько видов выпечки, вафли, один вид каши и супа. Чай пакетированный и заварной. Кофе - вообще сложно его назвать таковым, как и почти во всех отношениях на Шри-Ланке. Соки натуральные , но разбавленные водой.
1.2. Обед: 4,0.
Обеды не плохие, иногда даже по ассортименту преобладают над ужином.
Два вида супа, один вид мяса, курица, два вида рыбы,3-4 салатов, 4-5 гарниров, чай/кофе, 3-4 вида фруктов, 4-5 видов выпечки, мороженое. Минус - не всегда полноценные обеды, т.к. большинство туристов на концепции завтрак-ужин.
1.3. Ужин: 4,0.
Ужины также не плохие.
Два вида супа, один вид мяса (но оно всегда резиновое), курица, два вида рыбы,3-4 салатов, 4-5 гарниров, чай/кофе, 3-4 вида фруктов, 4-5 видов выпечки, мороженое.
1.4. Напитки: 4,0.
Здесь оценка по напиткам в барах. На всё включено:
- Местный крепкий алкоголь (ром - Rockland "советую", джин, виски, водка, содовая, имбирное безалкогольное пиво, алкогольное пиво в бутылке "Lion", молочные коктейли, фруктовые фреши.
1.5. Закуски (между основными приемами пищи): 1,5.
В первый день пришли в основной ресторан на закуски с сыном, спрашиваем: где закуски?
Они на нас смотрят и молчат. Через 3 минуты, смотрим забегали. Через 10-15 минут принесли сэндвичи, кексы и печенье с чаем. Больше мы на перекус не ходили. Короче можно сказать, что закусок - нет.

2. Пляж и его инфраструктура: 3,8 (4,0).
2.1. Размер: 4,0.
Хороший размер пляжа. Есть простор для прогулок по побережью бухты.
2.2. Чистота пляжа: 4,0.
Убирают, но можно и лучше. В данной бухте около 10 отелей, наш отель и ещё 2-3 отеля, где убирают мусор, на остальных просто свалка...
2.3. Чистота моря: 3,5.
Через день в море плавает мусор. Когда мусора нет, море - хорошее.
2.3. Насекомые: 3,0.
Много насекомых, в т.ч. пляжных блох. Мы все были покусанные. Это очень большой минус отеля. За 20 дней отдыха травили насекомых только один раз.
2.4. Заход: 4,5.
Заход пологий, очень подходндля купания с детьми.
2.5. Картинка: 4,5.
Пляж красивый, как и большинство на Шри-Ланке.
2.6. Пляжный бар: 2,5.
Его в принципе пока нет, идёт строительство.
Действующий бар - это как деревянный киоск. Бармена постоянно нет на месте. Играешь в рулетку, идёшь на пляж и не знаешь будет бармен или нет.
Наливают только напитки. Если хочешь коктейль или сок, нужно идти в основной бар.
2.7. Зонты, лежаки и полотенца: 3,5
Зонтов очень мало, наверное 5-6 шт, поэтому все туристы лежат под пальмами и деревьями. Лежаков много, полотенца - безлимит.

3. Уровень обслуживания: 4,3 (4,5).
3.1. Заселение: 4,0.
Приехали в отель около 10 часов утра. Как и во всех отелях на Шри-Ланке предложили фрэши из натуральных фруктов и теплые полотенчики, для лица. Заселили довольно быстро - через 1 час.
3.2. Уборка номера: 5,0.
Лучшие.
3.3. Персонал бара: 3,5.
Персонал преимущественно низкоквалифицированный. Один и тот же напиток могут приготовить совершенно по разному, некоторые стараются. Если бы не они поставил бы 2,0.
3.4. Персонал ресторана: 3,0.
Очень медлительные, также как и работники бара преимущественно низкоквалифицированный персонал. Некоторые неплохо работают, стараются. Только из-за них 3,0.
3.5. Персонал ресепшн: 5,0.
Одни из лучших, которых я встречал в жизни.
3.6. Время реагирования на запросы: 5,0.
Абсолютная обратная связь от персонала. Звонишь на ресепшн, очень быстро решают любой вопрос.

4. Номера: 3,9 (4,0).
4.1. Размер: 5,0.
4.2. Душ/туалет (качество сантехнического оборудования): 4,0.
Душ (ванная) отдельно от туалета. Размер хороший. Единственный минус - текла лейка. Поэтому 4 бала.
4.3. Ванные принадлежности: 3,0.
С этим к сожелению посадка. Из принадлежностей только универсальный гель для мытья всего (как говорится от головы до пяток).
4.4. Кровать: 4,0.
Хороший матрас, неплохие подушки.
4.5. Чистота и порядок: 5,0
Уборку происходят очень качественно (с полной заменой белья, протиркой мебели, подметанием и мойкой полов), за это большой респект. Я думаю здесь лучший пример , как нужно убирать номера.
4.6. Балкон: 3,5.
Неплохой вид.
Два стула, столик и множество насекомых (в основном муравьи).
Сушка для белья отсутствует.
4.7. Звукозащищенность: 3,0.
В ванной и туалете очень хорошо слышно, что происходит на улице. В комнате прекрасно слышна жизнедеятельность соседних номеров.
3,0 т.к. эта программа абсолютно почти всех отелей в мире.
4.8. Пополнение холодильника: -.
Холодильник ни разу не пополнялся. Но это общая практика здесь. Оценку не буду учитывать в расчете.

5. Бассейн: 2,8 (3,0).
5.1. Размер: 3,0.
Для Шри-Ланки средний бассейн.
5.2. Безопасность: 1,0.
Бассейн состоит из основной и детской части. Плитка на дне бассейна сильно изношена, а в детской части бассейна сколота. Мои двое маленьких детей 1 и 4 года, порезали все подушечки пальцев ног и рук (фото приложу). Детский бассейн вообще не безопасный, купаться в нем детям не рекомендую.
После инцидента с порезом ног и рук, обратился на ресепшн. В ответ на обращение, поставили табличку, что купаться запрещено. Но убеждён, что после нашего отъезда они её убрали и открыли опасную детскую часть бассейна.
5.3. Ночная подсветка: 3,5.
Подсветка есть, но её включают не всегда!?
5.4. Чистота: 3,5.
Средний по чистоте бассейн.

6. Развлечения: 1,8 (2,0).
6.1. Анимация: -.
Её нет. Для Шри-Ланка это норма, поэтому не буду учитывать эту оценку при расчете.
6.2. Вечерние шоу (концерт): 3,0.
Дни чередуются: живая музыка, пара "кабальеро" с гитарой и барабаном и просто без развлечений. Но для Шри-Ланки, это нормально.
6.3. Водные горки: -
Их нет, но т.к. это не Турция или Египет, а Шри-Ланка, не буду учитывать эту оценку при расчете.
6.4. Детская комната: 0,5.
Не детская комната, просто "позор".
Телевизор и несколько мягких элементов и игрушек. Но из-за плохого запаха туда не хочется заходить. Вечером на мягких элементах спят работники и официанты бара и ресторана. Возможно этим и обусловлен плохой запах.
6.5. Фитнес зал: 3,0.
Для Шри-Ланки средненький зал. Свободные веса, один неплохой многофункциональный тренажёр, велотренажёры и беговые дорожки.
Кондиционер, велотренажёры и беговые дорожки выключены. Скорее всего из-за экономии.
6.6. Детские площадки: -
Их просто нет.
6.7. Игры (в т.ч. спортивные): 2,5.
Из игровых развлечений: прокат велосипедов и пинпонг.
Но в комнате, где расположен стол для пинпонга не возможно находиться, в связи с тем, что кондиционер постоянно выключают. Они здесь постоянно экономят на работе кондиционеров.

7. Территория: 3,6 (3,5).
7.1. Размер: 3,0.
Небольшая компактная территория. Погулять особо не получится.
7.2. Растения: 3,5.
Т.к. эта поездка для меня четвертая на Шри-Ланку, есть с чем сравнить. Поэтому только 3,5. Объективно, растений для Шри-Ланки не очень много.
7.3. Картинка: 5,0.
Территория очень фотогигиенична, из любой точки получаются превосходные фото.
7.4. Газон и озеленение: 3,0.
Газон в начале отдыха был зелёный, но во второй половине местные садовники, перестали его качественно поливать. В результате чего он стал с желтыми фрагментами.

8. Качество и скорость интернета: 4,0 (4,0).
18 из 20 дней интернет был стабильный, хотел поставить 5 балов, но в последние два дня почему-то происходили сбои.

9. Прочее: 3,3 (3,5).
9.1. Отсутствие строек (ремонтов): 1,0.
Во время нашего отдыха, ежедневно была стройка нового бара и проводили текущий ремонт зданий и сооружений.
9.2. Ланч-боксы при отъезде: 4,5
Добротные Ланч-боксы, в составе варёных яиц, круасанов, бананов, йогуртов, и т.д.
9.3. Сейф: 4,5.
Хороший сейф, за 20 дней хорошо работал.

10. Удаленность от моря: 5,0 (5,0).
Отель расположен на первой линии. С учётом, что территория не очень большая, время до моря из любой точки отеля не более 3 минут.

Итоговая оценка: 3,7.
title: Нормальный отель на 3+, здесь оценки сильно завышены.

text:
Overlooking a beautiful part of Sri Lanka’s eastern coastline, the hotel lives up to its name. The pool area is ideal for cooling off after sun bathing, whilst the beach is only minutes from the hotel and is superb.
The rooms are equipped with good A/c, tea/coffee making facilities, mini fridge and satellite tv.
The restaurant serves buffet style food suiting a wide variety of tastes in air con comfort.
There is a beach bar, ideal for relaxing in of an evening.
Also just a short walk from the hotel is the coconut cultural park, which offers tours, but most importantly serves an amazing coconut ice cream.

placeInfo/address: Coconut Cultivation Board Road Pasikuda, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
A Haven of Tranquility: A Review of The Calm Resort & Spa, Pasikuda
Nestled on the serene and incredibly calm shores of Pasikuda, Sri Lanka, The Calm Resort & Spa lives up to its name, offering a truly tranquil escape for those seeking relaxation and rejuvenation. From the moment you arrive, the resort's commitment to creating a peaceful atmosphere is evident, making it an ideal destination for a quiet getaway.
Location and Ambiance:
The resort boasts an enviable beachfront location, directly on the famously placid waters of Pasikuda Bay. The clean, white sands and clear blue waters are nothing short of idyllic, perfect for gentle swims or simply unwinding by the sea. The property itself is beautifully designed, with lush gardens and spacious layouts that contribute to the overall sense of calm. While it feels secluded, it's also conveniently located just 1.5 km from the city center, allowing for easy access to local attractions if you wish to explore.
Accommodation:
The 70 elegantly designed rooms and suites offer a comfortable and luxurious retreat. Guests can choose from various categories, including Deluxe Rooms, Premium Rooms, Garden Collection rooms (closer to the pool and ocean), and more spacious suites like the Calm Suite and Passi Bay Suite. Reviewers consistently praise the comfortable beds, high ceilings, and balconies or terraces that often provide captivating ocean, garden, or pool views. Rooms are well-equipped with modern amenities such as air conditioning, flat-screen TVs with satellite channels, mini-fridges, tea/coffee making facilities, and safety deposit boxes. Some suites even feature private plunge pools and whirlpool tubs, adding an extra touch of indulgence.
Dining:
The resort offers a variety of dining options, including the Sea Grass Restaurant, Herms Lounge Bar, and Vandalouse Bar. The breakfast buffet often receives high praise for its extensive selection and tasty food, though some guests have noted that the overall buffet spread might be slightly smaller compared to other resorts in the area. However, the quality of the food generally seems to be a highlight, with some guests even mentioning chefs going the extra mile to prepare special meals upon request.
Facilities and Experiences:
The Calm Resort & Spa excels in providing a range of facilities to enhance your stay. The large, clean outdoor swimming pool is a central feature and a popular spot for relaxation. For those seeking rejuvenation, the Aayu Spa by Browns offers a selection of Indonesian therapies and healing treatments.
Beyond relaxation, the resort provides opportunities for active pursuits. Guests can enjoy outdoor games, a fitness center, and a kids' club for families. The beachfront location is perfect for water sports, with options like snorkeling around Passi Reef or Elephant Rock, boating, and fishing. The resort also facilitates excursions to nearby attractions, including cycling around the village, visiting historical sites like the Batticaloa Lighthouse and Fort, or experiencing the unique "singing fish" at Kallady Bridge.
Service:
A recurring theme in reviews is the exceptional friendliness and attentiveness of the staff. Many guests highlight the staff as going "above and beyond" to ensure a comfortable and memorable stay, from the reception team to the restaurant and room service staff. This warm hospitality significantly contributes to the overall positive experience at The Calm Resort & Spa.
The Calm Resort & Spa Pasikuda truly delivers on its promise of a serene and enjoyable beachfront getaway. With its stunning location, comfortable and well-appointed rooms, excellent facilities, and a dedicated staff, it's an ideal choice for couples, families, or anyone seeking a peaceful and rejuvenating holiday in Sri Lanka's beautiful east coast. If you're looking to unwind amidst breathtaking scenery and experience warm hospitality, The Calm Resort & Spa is a highly recommended destination.
title: Wonderful Visit

placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text: The place the food the tents the amenities and the entire experience was nothing short of world class. The chef outdid himself at every meal and the staff went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. Solomon is a fantastic and passionate naturalist who took great pride in sharing his knowledge on the safari. We thoroughly enjoyed our 2 days there and have no hesitation recommending the camp to international travelers. Keep up the good work team Mahoora!
title: Absolutely 5 star class tented safari experience in Udawalawe Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: It gets damp, so you need to have bags to pack things, also away from bugs. It's bags in bags in bags! And take a tropical anti-bug spray.
text: Mahoora Tented Safari Camp Udawalawe was an experience, and a very good one! I was there with my 7 y.o. daughter and she said "I feel in my element". It's a bit adventurous, but very premium. The service is top, the staff very caring and helpful, Prince Solomons is the naturalist leading the camp's safaris and wildlife stories, a very nice old chap filled with experience, wisdom, and kindness. The tents are cozy, albeit the few bugs - but if you book there, that is part of the thrill! We've relished in staying in during the afternoon downpour, as the sound of the forest and rain was highly soothing. At night, the camp becomes kind of magical, with all lanterns alight against bugs and reptiles, and the bonfire during dinner time. My daughter wandered around the grounds feeling safe and happy in the nature. We enjoyed the beautiful meals, generous and tasty, with fresh veggies and local dishes. The half-day morning safari was a must, and with Prince Solomons as our guide, we had a fabulous time, spotting birds and elephants and having nice conversations. We were also lucky to have booked at the end of April, when the wet season nears, and when it becomes more quite on the tourists' front. Also, rain brings the animals out. One half-day safari in Uda Walawe is sufficient, and 2 nights is recommended, as you need to settle into the glamping lifestyle.
title: Glamping & Safari at Mahoora / Udawalawe

placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
We were doing a road trip via Balangoda - Kalthota- Thanamalvila to Hambanthota and were just looking for a place to break for a day. We've stayed at the Echo team's Ahaspokuna location and had a lovely time there, so decided to choose this place which was right along our route. We booked without much expectations but had a perfect experience!

Location - Google map directions are accurate, but you might miss the turn - off which is a tiny dirt road in between two houses. The road condition is perfect up to the turn - off, which is a dirt road but still in good condition. It's quite a sizeable, lovely looking property right next to a lake/ tank and the grounds were very well maintained. They had mowed the grass and there was no undergrowth which made it look very safe and airy. It may look a bit dark in the night, but they have an army of staff constantly checking the grounds with flashlights and also two doggies who kept us company so we felt quite comfortable even in the dark.

Accommodation took the form of tents. Compared to their Ahaspokuna property, the tents were more "camping" than "glamping". I am not sure whether there were different categories of tents. But our tent had a bed which more or less filled the front part, and the commode and shower were only partitioned off from a curtain. Probably due to the shower plumbing being inside the tent, we found two geckos and a tiny frog in our tent (which we didn't mind though). There was a fan in the room which was perfectly fine with us and the weather was quite cool due to heavy rains. 

Before we checked in, the manager had a small chat with us. He told us that we may find the mattress a bit thin and water pressure of the shower and commode would be low. We didn't find any problem with the mattress and slept perfectly fine! The water pressure of the commode was also perfectly fine but we did find the water pressure of the shower to be a bit of a nuisance, but wrote it down as an authentic camping experience;). Can't recall about WiFi though as our own connections worked just fine. 

What really elevated this property was their service!. We arrived at 2 pm, while we were checking in, the manager had a small chat with us explaining about the property, once that was done, we were told our tent was ready. The bags came right after. We said we'll come for lunch in 10 mts and they were ready and waiting for us. Dinner was ready exactly at 7 pm. Both the lunch and dinner service was fast and worked like clockwork. We were told that morning snacks would be ready by 5.45 am and we would be leaving at 6 am for the safari. Snacks were there at 5.40 am and they left exactly at 6 am! We returned at 10 am as planned and check - out didn't even take 10 minutes. Considering that we tropical islanders are not known for their punctuality, we were blown away by how well they managed all the tasks on time. And all the staff we met were friendly, courteous, enthusiastic and very efficient.

The food was very good and was quite unexpected for a camping experience. The lunch was rice & curry and the dinner was a four course set menu. The portions were large. We had a packed breakfast for the safari and we were pleasantly surprised to find that they had packed everything they would have offered for a full course breakfast! When my husband informed them he was a vegetarian, they also came up with quite a lot of vegetarian options. 

We also had a lovely safari experience with them. The driver was safe and reliable, our guide was knowledgeable and enthusiastic. The packed breakfast was lovely. And they left exactly on time, so that we arrived as early as possible which ensured that we had enough elephant sightings to make the trip worthwhile. [The property is actually situated about 30 minutes away from the park entrance and there was quite a hurried drive to get there as early as possible. One suggestion would be to give the guests the option to leave earlier if they are willing to do so. ] I have written a separate review on the Udawalawe National Park which covers our experience there. 

The price charged under local resident rates was extremely reasonable. We were quite happy to pay that price with or without the safari. The booking mail mentioned that we would have to pay separately for the naturalist on the safari, but they didn't charge  us in the end. The mail also mentioned a nature walk which obviously was not possible due to heavy rains. 

All in all, we loved our experience there, the service, the staff, the very well organised safari making it one of those rare occasions where we had already planned for a return trip, hopefully during July-August since, according to our naturalist, that is the best time a do a safari in Udawalwe.
title: Camping done right...

placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Request Prince Solomon as your naturalist
Make sure you go all the way to the Lake once inside the park.
text:
The tent was a nice set us. Dinner under the stars was a memorable night but the hands down best experience - and reason we were there - was the morning safari. 

We booked in advance & requested Prince Solomon as our guide. Lovely man, softly spoken, decades of experience in the park. A true naturalist! Great English. Respected by the other guides. We had a private jeep with a driver. My husband likes to photograph, so this was perfect. 

The park is busy & when all the jeeps take off together, it’s not great. But once we got away & deeper in the park was where the magic was. Wild elephants, hundreds of migrating birds. Also enjoyed driving from Mahoora to the entrance in the dark as the sun rose. 

Photos on my I G wild_growth if you are interested in more details, photos or what else we did in Sri Lanka.
title: Safari with Prince Solomon - request in advance.

placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Morning are great for bird watching and wildlife in the afternoon.
text:
If you are looking for an amazing wildlife experience, look no further. Mahoora Udawalawe camp went above and beyond to cater to all our needs and no request was too big or too small for them.
We were met by Santosh who checked us in efficiently and was always contactable throughout our stay. All members of staff were so friendly and delightful. Always greeted us with a lovely smile.
Our tend was amazing. We had everything we needed and more. We enjoyed the accommodation very much. These tents are far superior to a majority of similar camps we have stayed in other countries during our game drives.
Dinner was served around a campfire which was a great experience. Meals were plated and brought to us straight from the kitchen. Food was of a high standard and very well presented. Most of all, a big thank you to the young man who served us and compliments to the chef for a great dining experience under the stars.
We were accompanied on our game drives by Mr Solomons the naturalist. It was an exciting and a great experience. We were delighted to see so many elephants, a wide variety of birds and reptiles not forgetting a few large crocodiles. Mr Solomons knew exactly where to find them and parted with a great deal of information presenting it in fascinating detail. There was so much to see and thanks to Mr Solomons we were able to understand and appreciate the jungle and its ecosystems. He has a vast wealth of knowledge and experience which was very apparent. A true gentleman and an absolute genius.
Great value for money and an experience delivered to a very high standard.
title: Wildlife experience par excellence.

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you so much for sharing your detailed review of your stay at Mahoora Camp! It sounds like you had an amazing time exploring Udawalawe National Park, and we're so glad to hear that Solomons and the rest of the team helped make your experience even more special. It's great to hear that the food, safaris, and service met your expectations. We're also happy that you enjoyed the visit to the Elephant Rescue Center—it’s a wonderful addition to the experience.

We appreciate your feedback regarding the tent setup and the Wi-Fi issue. We’re sure the team will continue to improve in those areas.

Thank you again for your kind recommendation, and we’d love to welcome you back on your next adventure!
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
In February 2025, we spent three nights at the Mahoora Camp by Eco Team to visit Udawalawe National Park. We organized our safari and transfer to Colombo with Mahoora and chose the half-board option.

Our breakfast was packed for our safaris, and be aware that lunch is included even with the half-board option if you decide to go on a full-day safari. All the packed food is tasty, well-prepared, and provided in generous portions (perhaps even a bit too much!).

For our safaris, we decided to have a Naturalist escort, which was absolutely fantastic as it greatly helps in identifying the many bird species you can see. We want to thank Solomons for his sharp eye, extensive knowledge, and passion for sharing his expertise. On our last morning, we decided to switch our morning safari session for a visit to the Elephant Rescue Center, which is a nice add-on to consider during your trip. Once again, Mahoora was great in helping us arrange this. The resort also offers day and night walks, but after a long safari, you might just prefer to rest.

Dinners were tasty, the service was excellent, and the food was once again served in generous portions. As stated on the website, be aware that beverages are not included (except for water).

Lastly, the tent was very nicely set up. Of course, you can't expect the same level of comfort as in a hotel, but our stay was lovely. Each tent is equipped with a fan and a private bathroom. Be aware that insects and small animals may enter the tent. There is a protective net, but you have to use it properly.

The only downside was that the Wi-Fi was out of service.

We would definitely recommend this place and would love to come back!
title: 3 Nights in Udawalawe

ownerResponse/text: Vielen Dank für Ihr wundervolles Feedback! Es freut uns sehr, dass Sie eine perfekte Safari-Erfahrung hatten und die Wanderung sowie das Dinner genossen haben. ownerResponse/text: Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We're thrilled to hear that your stay at Mahoora Tented Safari Camp exceeded your expectations and that you felt at ease from the moment you arrived. It's fantastic that Solomon and the team were able to create such a memorable experience, with everything from the starry nights to the birdwatching and nature walk. We’re glad you enjoyed the intimate atmosphere and the opportunity to connect with nature. We'll be sure to pass along your special thanks to Solomon and the team! We hope to welcome you back for a longer stay next time to enjoy even more of what the beautiful Udawalawe area has to offer.
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for one night at the Camp and regret for not booking two nights! We were a bit worried about sleeping in a tent but when we arrived at the camp and were met by Solomon and the lovely staff, all our worries disappeared. We had a super comfy bed and a lovely tent which was slightly old but very clean. We had all we could have wished for a romantic night with lovely three course barbecue dinner and a camp fire! The entire camp felt very secure and we felt that all staff were efficient, professional and friendly. The best part was the romantic atmosphere gazing at the stars, listening in the night, being surrounded by stunning nature, birds and wildlife. The next morning, after a tasty freshly cooked breakfast, Solomon gave us a walking tour of nature surrounding the camp and the gorgeous lake nearby.He is an experienced and personable guide who is very passionate about nature and can spot birds and small animals from 500 meters. His story telling and knowledge about Sri Lanka flora and fauna is very extensive. He showed us native birds and a chameleon that we could not see without the binoculars. We encountered the famous red back woodpecker, the giant squirrels, monitor lizards, wild rabbit and numerous beautiful water birds at the lake. We came across the traces of the elephants who pass around the camp during the night to get to the water in the lake. We learnt so much from Solomon and are so grateful for his informative tour and friendly service. 
We strongly recommend the Mahoora Tented Safari Camp to those visiting the Udawalawe National Park and would like to express our special thanks to Solomon and the team.
title: Adventurous Stay at the Mahoora tented Safari Camp Udawalawe

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
We (myself, my husband and our 3 year-old) had 2 nights at Mahoora. The tent was well-equipped, with strong fans to beat the heat, and was clean and tidy. The team worked hard to ensure we maximized our safari time and we had a fun visit to the Udawalawe elephant transit centre, where we saw lots of adorable baby elephants. The safari itself (5.30am departure) was a great experience, with loads of elephants seen up close, countless peacocks and lots of native birds. Our guide, Solomon, spoke excellent English, was very friendly and patient with our toddler and was hugely knowledgeable about the animals and area. 
We opted for full board and the meals were multiple courses with delicious local flavours and produce. 
A few things to note: the location is fairly remote, so having full board is the most sensible option. There were also no specific kids meals, although my son ate a lot of what was on offer. There is obviously no AC, so at times the heat can be hard to manage. Pack light and wear comfortable durable clothing to maximize comfort during your stay.
title: Awesome safari experience with a friendly and accommodating team

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your thoughtful review! We're glad to hear that you had a great time overall and appreciated the service from the staff, particularly Santoosh and Heshan. It's wonderful to know that Heshan's knowledge and company made the safaris memorable. We're also pleased that the food and campgrounds met your expectations.

We do appreciate your insight on the accommodation, and we understand that expectations can vary depending on previous experiences. We strive to offer a unique "wild" experience with all the comforts of nature, but we’ll take your feedback on the ambiance into consideration as we continue to improve.

Thank you once again for sharing your experience, and we hope to welcome you back in the future for more memorable moments with us!
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
This is not as “glamping” as other glamping experiences we’ve been to. Yes there are beds etc - but the rooms are dark and it just doesn’t feel fancy if that’s what you’re looking for.

Still - the staff was absolutely superb. Santoosh in particular - our point person and host and especially our absolutely fantastic naturalist guide for all three safaris we took during our three night stay - Heshan. We had been looking forward to Solomon- who has been called out here on Trip Advisor as being an excellent guide - but we happened to arrive while he was away on holiday. Santoosh assured us that we would be well taken care of and we were. Heshan was incredibly knowledgeable, friendly, tuned in, and organized. He made every safari unique with his awareness of all the nooks and crannies of the park. He was great company. We saw more elephants and birds than we can count and learned so much about their habits.

After a mediocre first meal upon arrival, the food was excellent and so was service. The campgrounds are lovely and waking up to birdsong is a special special thing.
title: Superb with a slight need to adjust expectations.

ownerResponse/text: Thank you so much for your kind and thoughtful review! We're thrilled that you had such an enriching experience on your full-day safari with Heshan and the team. We’re glad that you enjoyed the accommodation and food as well. Your appreciation of the wildlife and nature really shines through, and we are grateful for your recognition of our dedicated team, including Mr. Solomon. Thank you for making us a part of your memorable adventure, and we hope to welcome you back soon!
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Excellent and even better. Best was the full-day safari with Heshan, the very kind and knowledgeable tour guide who worked perfectly together with our driver. We saw many elefants even one with tusks (only 4 in the park) we saw an elefant father with his daughter and a herd with a 10 days old baby elefant. We spotted many birds, buffaloes, monkeys, deers crocodiles and I assure the list was longer. The day went by not quickly but with lots of pleasure to see amnimals in their habitat and watching them respectfully and I learnt a lot.
I shouldn’t forget the excellent accomodation including best food. Mr Solomon educates and guides the very friendly stuff very well. Thank you for the adventure and pleasure.
title: See wild animals in their habitat, learn a lot about them and being overwhelmed by their beauty/smartness of nature

placeInfo/address: Hambantota, Hambantota, Tangalle 82000 Sri Lanka
text:
For us, the staff make this resort a must stay! This was our second time staying at the Birds Resort and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The front desk staff, Sakuni, Chamaya, Shenali, and Nizam, has more than excellent customer service. From our first booking phone call until our last goodbye, we were treated as family and welcomed us with open arms. Plus, they used technology very well to confirm our reservation. 

The restaurant area is beautifully designed and feels open, not crowded. The kitchen takes a bit longer to prepare the food, but it is absolutely delicious, fresh, and the chefs use care to plate the food in an appealing way. When enough guests are staying, there is an opportunity for a buffet. There are many varieties of food, both Sri Lankan and Western options. My husband had the best Sri Lankan style omelet from the live food station and wants to compliment the chef! Again, the restaurant staff make everything wonderful. Rashini is working so hard and her customer care makes you feel right at home. Dislshan is running a great team and he makes sure that his customers are well taken care of. 

The rooms are big, open, and so incredibly comfortable. You feel so luxurious with a  huge bathroom and all the amenities that you need. Mr. Sameera, the housekeeping manager made sure our room was perfect before we arrived and provided individualized care for our family. He and his team really know how to take care of their guests. 

Overall, we love this resort because it feels so relaxing and you don't feel like you have to worry about anything, the staff really takes care of you, and it's not crowded. A big thank you to the staff for welcoming our family back again.
title: The staff make this resort a must stay!

text:
We have been to Birds Resort twice now and would be happy to go again! We absolutely love the wide expansive grounds, with many species of birds roaming around freely. They have basketball, tennis, cricket and badminton courts on the properly wit the equipment available for the use of guests, perfect for family groups! The pool is absolutely gorgeous, superbly warm water and very long with a kids pool built in. The rooms are spacious, and you can drive your vehicle to park right beside your room. Room decor is a bit dated and could use an update. The treehouse was a big attraction for the kids but not suitable to be climbed due to being too high and the steps being too far apart. 

The food choices are a bit limited, and restaurant staff seem to be freshers in need of a lot of training. Absolutely love the decor and layout of the dining area though, it is truly a masterpiece! 

Special thanks to the best girls Ishara, Dulanji and the rest of the front office staff for going out of the way to make our stay comfortable! I had a terrible headache the night we checked in and Ishara went out of the way to get me the painkillers I requested, very late in the night. Was so very grateful, I was able to enjoy the rest of my trip because of her!

Thank you for this lovely resort, we will definitely be visiting agin.
title: Refreshing stay surrounded by birds, great for families with kids

Dear Mr, Klcblc

Birds Resort Management Team.
placeInfo/address: Hambantota, Hambantota, Tangalle 82000 Sri Lanka
text:
My husband and I were on a second honeymoon to Sri Lanka, eager to try out the South and what wildlife it had to offer. The Birds Resort seemed a perfect location from which to visit Bundala and Udawalawe National Parks. It's situated in the peaceful countryside with large and comfortable modern rooms fronting a lake. The adjacent Bird Park is an added attraction (free to hotel guests), but there was plenty of birdlife in the gardens. For me the main draw was the chance to feed their tame elephants every evening on the reception steps! 
The food in the restaurant is mainly geared up for Sri Lankan or other Asian guests, but they offered both Eastern and Western menus. Choice was limited and you had to order your dinner at breakfast due to low occupancy at the time of our visit. But we did experience one buffet which had plenty of choice of both kinds. The standard of both types of food was excellent. One snag we hit was that the hotel currently has no liquor licence, despite the fact that it has a large bar area, and indeed advertised sundowners on its own website. They could sell beer (and provide to the room mini bar). We brought in and consumed wine from outside, with their permission, to overcome this, but it was unexpected and hopefully only temporary.
Special mention must go to the lovely reception and wait staff, the former being as helpful and informative as any I've ever come across (including picking up on the fact that we were celebrating our silver wedding anniversary); the latter being cheerful and super-efficient despite there being a bit of a language problem. 
We had a restful and very pleasant time here, getting away from it all and relaxing around the pool after our early morning starts. You would definitely need your own driver like us, or other transport, as it is quite isolated. Our travel agent took a bit of a risk in booking this for us as they had not used it before, and they weren't really geared up to accommodate our driver as in the other hotels we visited, but we think that if you want a relaxing and peaceful base without all the usual luxury trimmings, the room, pool and grounds are perfectly good enough. Pity about the alcohol licence though!
title: Nature at its best

placeInfo/address: Hambantota, Hambantota, Tangalle 82000 Sri Lanka
text:
We recently stayed at Birds Resort in Hambantota and had a truly calming and refreshing experience. The hotel is nestled in nature, with beautiful greenery all around and an open layout that makes it easy to unwind. It’s the perfect place if you’re looking for a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle.

The rooms are incredibly spacious, well-designed, and offer stunning views of the surrounding environment. We loved waking up to the sight of nature right outside our window. The open areas around the resort are great for activities, whether you're into walking, relaxing, or simply enjoying the fresh air.

The pool was another highlight for us—clean, well-maintained, and a lovely spot to cool off and relax after a warm day.

What made our stay even more special were some unique experiences the resort offers. There are several Harley Davidson bikes on-site, perfect for capturing cool photos. Plus, there’s a friendly elephant you can feed and take pictures with, which made for a memorable experience!

While the food may not be five-star level, it’s still delicious and offers great value for money. It’s clear they put care into the meals, and we enjoyed what was served.

The staff was incredibly friendly, flexible, and always willing to go the extra mile to ensure we had a pleasant stay.

Overall, Birds Resort is a perfect getaway for nature lovers, offering a serene, spacious, and comfortable environment with a few fun, unique touches. It may not have all the luxury bells and whistles, but it's fantastic for anyone seeking relaxation, peace, and value for money. Highly recommend
title: A Peaceful Nature Retreat with Unique Experiences – Perfect for a Relaxing Getaway!

placeInfo/address: Hambantota, Hambantota, Tangalle 82000 Sri Lanka
text:
We recently stayed at Bird Resort Hambantota and overall, we had a great experience. The room was spacious, clean, and extremely comfortable, perfect for a family stay. The environment is serene, surrounded by lush greenery, which adds to the peaceful and quiet atmosphere. One of the highlights was waking up to the sight of lovely hens, peacocks, and various birds around the resort, especially during the morning and evening hours. The large pool was a big hit with the kids, offering plenty of space to relax and have fun.

The staff were friendly and accommodating, and the waiters at the restaurant were particularly attentive, doing their best to meet all our requests. However, it seemed that the restaurant was a bit understaffed during the long weekend, leading to some hiccups. Unfortunately, the dessert options were depleted an hour before the buffet ended, and despite requesting a refill, only a couple of frozen cake slices were replenished. This was a disappointment, especially for our children, who were looking forward to dessert. As a result, we made sure to arrive at the buffet as soon as it started on subsequent days.

Another small issue was the lack of complimentary water bottles upon request. Most hotels we've visited offer this service, and it would have been appreciated here as well. Additionally, there was a broken tile in the swimming pool, which caused a minor cut on my husband's foot. Although the lifeguard was aware of the issue, there was no warning sign or visible mark to alert guests, which should be addressed promptly.

While the staff, including chefs, waiters, housekeeping, and receptionists, were helpful, we didn't notice anyone in a managerial role during our stay. We also visited the bird park, which was easily accessible from the resort. However, the buggy cart rental for 5,000 LKR felt unnecessary, as the park is small enough to explore on foot.

Despite these minor issues, we enjoyed our time at Bird Resort Hambantota and would recommend it for families looking for a peaceful getaway. The friendly staff, beautiful environment, and comfortable accommodations made it a memorable stay.
title: Peaceful Stay with a Few Minor Hiccups

Dear Mrs. Shalome,

It was an absolute pleasure to host your Sri Lankan-Scottish wedding at The Villa Bentota! From the very beginning, working with you to bring your vision to life was such a wonderful experience. placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
We held our two day wedding at the villa bentota in february 2025. it was everything we ever dreamed. whilst the venue is obviously stunning and had enough rooms for our immediate family as well as different landscapes for different events (lawn, mangroves, beach), the standouts were the staff - everyone was so friendly, warm, welcoming and approachable from the planning stage through to the clean up and aftermath. they really looked after us and we were a considerable crowd of 140 people! kalpa in particular was our point of contact throughout and he along with chamodh, the new food and beverage lead and chef were excellent. 
i should also mention the food and drink - we wanted a completely sri lankan menu and sent them a proposed menu which included buffet, sit down meal, canapes and cocktails - they blew us out the water regarding our requests (including my mum who is hard to impress!). the food was delicious as well as authentic for our international guests and interesting and different for our sri lankan guests. the chef and his team are truly talented and we are so so so happy we chose kk for our wedding venue. they - along with Hemant Dadlani wedding planners - helped to bring our dream wedding to life and showcase the best of Sri Lanka - people, food, drink, music. thankyou!
title: Sri Lankan Scottish Wedding

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
roomTip: Perfect place to do nothing.
text:
A beautiful oasis!  This was our stay at the end of 3 weeks in Sri Lanka.  What a wonderful way to wind down before the long trip back to the states.  The staff was excellent - and fun to chat with.  The room ideal - large, balcony, great shower, and comfortable.  The air conditioning had a mind of its own - probably some settings that kicked in during the night  - but worked well otherwise.  Internet was spotty, but worked for our needs ( why be online when in this place?).  
There is a train that goes by regularly, but mostly during rush hours and not during the night.  Food was very good; nice variety.  Breakfast buffet was smaller than some other places, but there is a menu to order eggs, pancakes. French toast, etc  so no one went hungry.  Sri Lankan breakfast available as preorder - same as other places.  The grounds are beautiful - great pool big enough to do laps.  Then you also cross the RR tracked to go down to a stunning private beach.  We basically used this as our R&R to wind down and didn’t participate in the activities.   You’re about 1 km from town - easily
Tuk tuk ride - with decent shopping and some restaurants.  There are many activities in the area - water sports, hiking, whale watching, fishing - if you’re interested.   Loved this place.
title: A beautiful oasis off the main road.

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
Our family of three stayed in a (stunning!) ground floor suite for four nights. The property and gardens are beautiful; especially interesting if you are a fan of Geoffrey Bawa. We loved the railway line; just so charming and almost from another time. The highlight was the restaurant staff. I wish I could remember all of their names but nothing was too much trouble; they were just so lovely. and the food superb!! If I had to give any feedback it may be that the reception staff could do a little bit more to explain possible daily tours & activities, outside the hotel and in the Bentota area. Suggest doing this research beforehand independently. Lunuganga garden tour is another must for Bawa fans.

Thank you to Ruwan and team, for a wonderful stay. We hope to return soon!
title: Stunning Heritage Property with Amazing Staff

text: The setting for this hotel is stunning  - right next to the beautiful beach. Having the railway line running at the back of the grounds was a positive to us although it can be a little noisy if you are a light sleeper. Great fun watching the trains chug past. Our room was lovely  - we chose the extended standard room and it was spacious and comfortable. The staff are really friendly and helpful. We were especially impressed with the reception staff who were very kind and approachable. Breakfast was very tasty and plentiful. We didn't eat dinner there as we preferred to go to one of the many family-run, traditional Sri Lankan restaurants near by. The Villa was a fantastic place to finish our trip around beautiful Sri Lanka.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Amar.

Wow, thank you so much for such an incredible review! 

We’re absolutely thrilled that your two-day wedding at The Villa Bentota was everything you dreamed of and more.

It’s wonderful to hear that you enjoyed the versatility of our spaces – from the gardens to the beach – and how they made each moment of your celebration unique and memorable. We’re so glad you loved our clean, comfortable rooms, delicious menu options, and, of course, our peaceful beach, which made for a stunning ceremony backdrop.

Our team is overjoyed by your kind words, especially Mr. Ruwan, who always strives to make every experience perfect, and myself – it was truly a pleasure working with you throughout the planning process. As I mentioned to you at the end of the event, this was truly one of the best destination weddings we’ve ever hosted, and we were honored to be part of it. Handling surprises like the pool party and last-minute changes is what we love to do to make your day even more special.

Thank you for recommending us so highly. We’d be delighted to welcome you back in the future – whether it’s for another celebration or a relaxing getaway!

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
We had our 2 day wedding at Villa Bentota by KK collection.

We cannot put into words how perfect this venue was for our wedding. 
We used different parts of the complex for different parts of the wedding which gave each part a different unique experience. The outdoor space was spacious and very well kept. To walk over the train tracks to get to the beach gave an authentic feel to the whole thing. 

All the rooms very amazing. They were constantly kept clean, water bottles and filtered water available throughout the property. Great menu options from Sri Lankan dishes to western dishes. 

The beach is also very beautiful and generally quiet. It’s perfect for our beach ceremony. 
 
Staff were so attentive and went the extra mile for us and every guest. Everything they did was with a smile which just made everyone feel so welcome. Big shout out to Mr Ruwan, any questions regarding food and drinks he will resolve. Always available and will do his best to make everything perfect for you. 

Mr Kalpa has been fantastic during the planning process, no question was too small and no question went unanswered. Nothing was a problem and he catered to unexpected situations on the day such as changing last minute meals to allowing us to have an unexpected pool party. 

In short if you’re deciding to stay here, have an event here or even a wedding. Don’t hesitate, just book and trust they will do everything in their control to make your stay/wedding the best.
title: Wedding/Event @ KK Villa Bentota

La piscina è bella, circondata dal giardino tropicale, perfetta per rinfrescarsi dopo una giornata di escursioni.

Colazione e cena a buffet molto buone, con piatti locali e internazionali. Il personale è stato gentilissimo, sempre sorridente e disponibile.

Ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo e atmosfera piacevole. Consigliato a chi cerca un po’ di comfort e relax nel verde, a pochi passi dal Parco Nazionale di Yala.
title: Un rifugio immerso nella natura, perfetto prima del safari! 🌴🐆

text: My spouse and I spent two delightful nights at The Kandy House in Kandy, Sri Lanka, where the blend of beautifully maintained colonial architecture and luxurious grounds immediately caught our attention. Pradeep's attentive service stood out, ensuring our stay was comfortable and memorable.
