text: An absolutely lovely hotel packed with old world charm. In the colonial style and old but every comfort and care taken. Staff and restaurant marvellous. The room and bed were comfortable the gardens and pool charming. So peaceful and carefully managed. Absolutely loved the Kandy house.
title: Charming!

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: Very attractive colonial-era house, airy and charmingly furnished, with an open atrium in the middle.  Large and comfortable room, excellent dinners and breakfasts.  Staff extremely obliging and helpful.  We were allocated one member of staff to look after us particularly.  Very nice garden for pre-dinner drinks and a little further down, a large pool and loungers, mostly shaded by trees.
title: Loved this hotel

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: On the outskirts of this crowded hectic city, Kandy House is a small boutique hotel that caters to guests with warmth, kindness, and an extraordinary level of service. From the moment we arrived – and even after we had left, we felt pampered and cared for by our wonderful personnel butler Chamee as well as the hotel’s experienced and charming manager. Our trip was last minute and the only room available for our dates turned out to be the hotel’s largest suite - Red Spot– named after a butterfly so we had no idea when we reserved that this meant our room included a huge wrap around terrace for our exlusive use – complete with couch, enormous floor space and a dining table which Chamee set up for private candlelit dinners overlooking a garden. Need a yoga mat? No problem. Drinks on the terrace at sunset? Of course. With the expert advice of the hotel’s manager, we hired an excellent tuk tuk driver to drive us to the Temple of the Tooth about 20 minutes away. The driver protected us from the touts and made sure we did not get lost. The hotel’s manager also helped us hire the perfect driver to take us on our long drive from Polannawaru to Kandy. We liked the driver so much, we hired him to stay with us for the rest of our trip!  Kandy House is not inexpensive. But for the attention, care, wisdom, and service it offers, it is worth every penny – particularly if Chamee takes care of you.
title: A Quiet Haven of Elegance and Privilege

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Demander une chambre à l étage
text:
Très belle demeure à l extérieur de Kandy
Les jardins sont très beaux et la piscine magnifique 
Les repas sont bons et copieux 
Le service efficace mais  parfois un peu brouillon 
Nous avions une chambre au rdc avec un petit extérieur 
La chambre était très sombre avec un plafond très bas, on rentre pars la salle de bain et toilettes qui ne sont pas séparés de la chambre 
Vraiment très déçue car on décrit des chambres avec un lit à  baldaquin, spacieuse … la rien de tout cela.. beaucoup de moustiques aussi et pas d eau chaude pour prendre une douche 
Nous ne sommes restés qu une nuit, certainement le moins bel hôtel de tout notre séjour mais certainement avec une autre chambre le sentiment aurait été très différent
title: Bel endroit mais déçue par la chambre

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your feedback ,and it certainly was a shame the weather turned, albeit briefly, and unusually for this time of year.It was very heavy rain, and two rooms were affected as you say (although the other room had one leak, not six).The roof tiles can move over time, and it would not be a problem in the typical dry season and easily fixed if discovered in the monsoon time.In these cases both were fixed as soon as the rain stopped the next day (you cannot do it when the tiles are wet unfortunately) and all without any problem from the next day onwards

We are very sorry about the trouble, but the two gentlemen(as part of your booking) in the affected room told our staff they did not want to move to another room, I hope there was not a misunderstanding, and we are sorry you feel we did not handle the situation well.

Thank you for your comments about the food, views and ambience.It's worth also mentioning that the bottom of the pool is and was not dirty - it is a cement finish, and aesthetically intended to have a more mottled appearance.As you say, the water was clean, the pool is consistently maintained daily.

Again we apologise for the inconvenience, and want to thank you very much for booking The Kandy House
placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
This is a peaceful colonial house away from the hustle and bustle of Kandy. 
The rooms are spacious and you have a veranda for each room to relax on. You have your own butler (very pleasant) who was sometimes a little too attentive for our liking. 
We were also surprised that other than the shampoo/shower gel in the bathroom we didn’t have any of the usual sundries like shower cap etc. 

We were there in a torrential downpour which lasted most of the late afternoon and evening. The roof over our son’s bed leaked quite badly and they had to move the bed to prevent it totally saturating the it. Another room had 6 different leaks and that couple eventually were given another room. We felt they didn’t handle our situation particularly well. It took a while for them to check the room and maybe we should have been offered another room given the leak. The place wasn’t full. 

The food is delicious and it’s served outside on the covered veranda in a pleasant environment. Because of the rain we had to have drinks inside which again is in a lovely setting. We did think the food was slightly more expensive here than other places we stayed in. 

The deep swimming pool is set in the  gardens overlooking a paddy field and has in beautiful views. However although the water seemed clean, the bottom of the pool did look dirty. Also, beware, because it had rained there were leeches in the grass and my son had one attach on his hand and we found others on our feet. 

We did enjoy our stay but compared to the rest of our hotels we stayed at in Sri Lanka we felt It just seemed a bit tired.
title: Colonial style hotel in quiet grounds away from hustle and bustle of the  city

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: Great hotel in a historic colonial villa. The property itself is very beautiful and the staff was amazing. Pradeep, our butler, treated us very well, and the food was delicious. I would definitely recommend as it is also a short distance from Kandy.
title: Historical villa

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
Wonderful to be back at The Kandy House! Blessed with the upgrade 🙏
Slept so beautifully with the peace, perfection, excellent food and drinks. Love the way the gardens are lusher than the botanic gardens and the pool so refreshing!✨❤️🙏
title: Lush!

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
Ignore bad reviews from pre-covid.
The hotel is conveniently located for the things you want to see in and around Kandy. It is a beautiful boutique hotel with wonderful gardens and pool. The staff were very friendly and helpful on all occasions and were very adaptable to suit our timetable.
It is true that the set menu was more expensive than eating a la carte in other hotels, but the food was excellent and plentiful. 
We were upgraded on arrival and our room was exceptionally spacious with an outside verandah, but it was lacking in drawer space if you plan to stay for more than a couple of nights.
We would have happily spent more time there and would recommend it if you want peace and quiet away from the busy town.
title: A wonderful oasis

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Get the suite or a junior suite with a balcony / terrace if you can.
text:
Incredibly beautiful and romantic boutique hotel (villa) in the hills about candy. This place is an authentic colonial house from the 19th century. Both the house and the gardens are truly stunning. The service was absolutely impaccable and the food super good (although on the expensive side for Sri Lanka - but you're paying for both the quality and the experience.) The views from the pool were astounding. We only staid for 2 nights but once we got there, we were wishing we had booked it for longer. 

Finally, the photos on their website totally don't do justice to this place - it's so much more beautiful in reality, especially their garden which really does feel as a tropical mountain jungle paradise.
title: The place to stay in Kandy if you're looking for the ultimately authentic and beautiful place.

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
Perfect location of an charming old house with beautiful garden and a big pool 
Food selection is not big but the quality is brilliant 
Great breakfast
And a very attentive and nice team was looking after us very well 
Highly recommend to relax there after visiting the impressive Kandy palace
title: Cosy atmosphere in a beautiful old house with a superb friendly team

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
The set menu is not the cheapest we ate from on our trip but the quality was excellent, as was the service.
Some rooms are better than other
text:
A stunning colonial building with the most willing, friendly and hospitable staff. The setting is great (note not walkable from Kandy)
Very good food if the menu choice quite limited but there are only 9 rooms
title: Re-live the colonial days!

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Try the delicious egg hoppers for breakfast
text: A tranquil 2 night stop here was the ideal venue for exploring Kandy. A beautiful boutique hotel with 9 rooms and surrounding gardens with a pool. We stayed in the Peacock Royal suite and were attended to like royalty by our superb Butler Sura. All the staff were charming and the food was of course delicious.
title: If your heading to Kandy this is the place to stay

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: A fabulous oasis of calm close to Kandy. The old manor house is tucked away, surrounded by nature and gardens teeming with wildlife.  The food was amazing and the service perfect. Thank you so much to Samira who looked after us for our stay.. We did not want to leave!
title: An oasis of calm!

ownerResponse/text:
Obviously very pleased to hear that The Kandy House was one of your favourite stays in Sri Lanka

We do typically offer complimentary canapés with dinner.For anything additional there is a snack menu and prices for items such as cashew nuts and various others - it should have been brought to you in the normal way.We are sorry for that oversight and any misunderstandings caused, it should not have happened
placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Already said, but ask for prices before adding anything to the bill.
text:
This hotel was one of our favourites on our tour of Sri Lanka, we stayed for 2 nights. The room was beautiful with its own veranda we ate breakfast on. The four poster bed in the colonial setting was such a nice environment and were the gardens and pool. 

Huge fruit bats fly around the garden as you have a drink and it’s all so lovely.

We do have one criticism and that is the surprise of the bill at the end. We booked Bed and Breakfast and took advantage of the set dinner menu, with drinks on top of that and then extras the bill was the same cost as one night B&B. When we looked closer at the bill it turned out what we thought were complimentary items (for example cashew nuts in a bowl that came with drinks) were in fact $8, they were brought to us with drinks and without asking so we assumed like with most places they were complimentary and when asked if we wanted some more said yes…there is nowhere it states a price for them and the staff didn’t mention a cost so $16 for nuts was frankly a shock! 

It’s a beautiful place to stay, just be careful what you agree to!
title: Beautiful…But always ask the price of extras!

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed at The Kandy House Hotel for one night.  The 200 year old hotel was beautiful and the staff couldn’t do enough for us.  It really is a piece of paradise and I’d highly recommend it.  Our evening meal and breakfast were also first class.  My husband and I are celebrating our 30th Wedding Anniversary and they kindly upgraded us.
title: Absolutely fabulous

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: The Kandy House was our favourite hotel in Sri Lanka aesthetically and for service and in our opinion should be the model for for all manor houses in Sri Lanka in terms of interiors, grounds and operations. The house has been kept in impeccable condition, preserving the beautiful heritage while flawlessly balancing more modern Sri Lankan artists and textiles. We were only in Kandy briefly, and the hotel manager who personally greeted us on arrival, organized a quick tuk tuk tour of the highlights, a beautiful meal, packed lunches for the train journey the next day while also making sure we had time to enjoy the beautiful pool and grounds. The manager was exceptional at his job. Everything ran like clockwork.The staff were attentive, courteous and discreet. The food was amazing. We arrived exhausted and departed less than 24 hours later with a new vibrancy after delicious food and deep rest. This is the kind of hotel you want to live in and I would have spent an extra day in Kandy just to have one more night at this property. This is the experience one always hopes for. I cannot recommend it highly enough.
title: Just perfect!

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: Excellent staff, attentive and helpful in organising quick tour of the sights of Kandy- and in preparing an amazing meal and place to relax in green jungle gardens with tranquil pool afterwards. Very special place to stay away from the night-time noise of celebrations in central Kandy, and enjoyed learning more about the history of the town from the very knowledgeable staff themselves. We felt completely at ease and secure in both Kandy town - and able to fully relax at the hotel. Definitely worth it.
title: Stunning historical house - luxurious hideout to relax after exploring Kandy

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: This is amazing place. The staff will bend over backwards to make sure that everything is perfect. The food was incredible, and it is a great setting to relax in. Even though it is close to the city, it still feels like it’s surrounded by nature, and we saw a few deer and plenty of birds. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The place itself is elegant and still feels inviting.
title: Definitely worth a stay

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: Had an amazing stay at Kandy house! The staff was lovely and very attentive. Had lunch and supper there during my stay and all the food was Delicious, especially the curry!! Would highly recommend this beautiful boutique hotel in the amazing city of Kandy!
title: Great hotel

text: A good place to go with a large group so you occupy the whole villa. There are 10 rooms on the ground floor around the courtyard and 2 suits upstairs. The rooms are clean and comfortable, large washrooms with fans inside! The staff are very helpful and quality of food was excellent. There also a nice sitting area to accommodate a crowd for a games night  and fellowship. The only downside was the mosquitos - we felt they were breeding in close prolixity to the outdoor sitting area as there were bowls of water left on the corridors for decor (you could see the larvae in them). Be prepared with plenty of repellent and a zapper and you’re good to go!
title: Good place for a group trip

placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I had an excellent two day stay at Tamarind Hill Hotel in Galle. No words to really explain how helpful EACH and EVERY staff member in this hotel is. Such warm and soft spoken people who ensure they deliver on the customer promise.  I wish them very best. 

Pro Tips for fellow travellers :
1. This hotel is not situated in the center of the town so please be mindful of the requests that you make to the staff. It may not be easy for them to cater to any on-demand requests like specific food choices/preferences. Please inform them before hand instead so they can let you know on the possibility. 

2. Food is cooked well so a full meal package or one with breakfast should work well. 

3. Sri-Lanka is going through a turbulent time this year so please do not waste food or resources like electricity or water as these are extremely precious for the country.
title: Excellent two day stay at Tamarind Hill! thank you!

text:
First I must thank to Sanjaya and Team who maintain this Colonial place nicely.

Location Galle City Limits
Walking distance to Galle Road

Welcome
The Tamarind staff welcomed us nicely with "Ayubowan" ( Wishing with Long Life ) , and offered fresh Tamarind juice, it was tasty, enjoyed

Suite

Based with Wooden floor and wooden accessories.
This Luxuries suite contains Living Room, Dining Room , Meeting Room, Large scale Veranda, Large Bathroom and Amazing Bedroom. 

Swimming Pool
Amazing Swimming pool with peaceful environment

Food
All food were provided based on selection by the guests.

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for writing highly of our resort, and infect the resort is built for people like you.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights on a tour around Sri Lanka. There are interesting cultural sites within a 1-2 hour drive. We did a great hike through the tea plantations and there is also a train ride from Haputale towards Colombo that I would recommend, providing amazing views of the plantations. 
In the hotel, the rooms are lovely with breathtaking views. From your room you see a huge vista with mountains in the backdrop. It is a stunning view. The staff are lovely and made us feel very welcome. The food is good with a wide menu. The pool area is good, with attentive staff and an infinity pool looking out over the view.
title: Great hotel with breathtaking view

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for the review. For your information we maintain the entire property as one and do not neglect any area.  We will investigate the points you mentioned and try and improve our services.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you are sensitive to bathroom cleaning materials ask them  to use less. The smell was very strong and didn’t dissipate.
text:
The hotel is currently expanding, which makes the older sections feel neglected while the newer areas remain unfinished.

We stayed for three nights in one of the modern electric blue beehive rooms. The views from the balcony were spectacular, but the room’s design had some frustrating flaws. For example, the bedside reading light switch was inconveniently placed, requiring you to get out of bed to turn it off. Similarly, reaching the toilet paper from the seat was awkwardly difficult.

I had expected scenic hill paths for pre-dinner strolls, but unfortunately, the surroundings don’t offer much in that regard. Additionally, be prepared for long drives—most tourist attractions are at least one to two hours away by car each way.

That said, as with all six hotels we stayed at in southern Sri Lanka, the staff were warm, gentle, and often proactive in their service.
title: A hotel in midst of expansion

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for the beautiful review. Our resort is only one of the few resorts in Sri Lanka that one can enjoy both sun rise and sun set. It is truly an amazing place.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
The staff are what make this place outstanding! 

From our arrival and initial greeting, until departure, our entire stay was made so special by the Sri Lankan charm held by all those working at this resort. They couldn’t have done enough for us. 

The resort itself is set in a stunning landscape, and the Beehive rooms are totally unique. You feel completely connected to the abundance of nature surrounding you in this idyllic setting. Not to mention the infinity pool which will take your breath away.  

The views are unrivalled - watch sunrise and sunset from your personal balcony and drink in the beauty of where you are.
title: True Sri Lankan charm

placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
Vi havde et dejligt ophold med en god service og mad. Udsigten er fantastisk og personalet er venligt og omsorgsfuldt.
Der er lækre værelser i hytterne og en flot udsigt.
Vi slappede af ved poolen og nød udsigten. Der er gode drinks i baren.
Kan virkelig anbefales.
title: Fantastisk hotel

placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Der Weg ist Sri Lanka typisch etwas wild. Hier sollte man auf ortskundige Fahrer setzen.
text: Wir waren auf Hochzeitsreise in diesem Hotel und waren super zufrieden. Es hat alles gepasst – das Essen, das Personal, die Organisation, die Freundlichkeit. Besonders das freundliche und sehr hilfsbereite Personal ist uns aufgefallen. Uns wurden Ausflüge für uns gebucht und organisiert (inklusive kleiner Frühstücksbox bei Abfahrt früh um 5 Uhr). Das Zimmer war toll – sauber, groß und gemütlich. Das Bad war der Hammer. Jedem der Sri Lanka in den Bergen erleben möchte und auch zwischendrin gern ein paar mildere Temperaturen genießen möchte, sollte hier übernachten.
title: Traumhaftes Hotel

placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Be prepared for variable weather due to the altitude and position on the Cliffside.
text:
We recently stayed 4 nights after having seen the Resort advertised on Social Media and asking our Travel company to include it in our itinerary.

From the first reveal from reception to our last sunrise vista from our Bee Hive, we were wowed by the breathtaking views which reach beyond the Lake in Udawalawa, from where I am now writing this review. We experienced almost every type of weather over the four days and even when it was pouring with rain the view was stunning.

We really enjoyed the traditional welcome, and the Bee Hive cabanas with our private views. As I’d expected from the advert they are a bit querky  but very comfortable with everything you need & the views are amazing.

Service and food at the restaurant, where we ate a lot were very high and all of the staff were very friendly. We enjoyed our local gin & tonics at the bar before dinner.

Our four nights allowed us some downtime after a busy trip but there are interesting places to visit like the Dambatenne Tea Factory, Lipton’s Seat and Bambarakanda waterfall.
title: The Widest Views of Sri Lanka from a Bee Hive.

text:
Wat een droom plekje is dit! Alles is tot in de puntjes geregeld. En het uitzicht is adembenemend mooi.

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for the wonderful review. Our resort is high end customer base than Ella which caters mainly for budget travellers. Our resort has sufficient activities around which are naturally intact where as Ella can be a bit more crowded. Speak to our staff at checkin if you want to know about things to do in the area. 
We would agree with you about the Sri Lanka breakfast where there will be a selction of freshly cooked Sri Lanka cousines which should be experinced by all foreign travellers.
The high wind happens sometimes on somedays (7-10 days a year) during Dec to Feb and its a natural activity in the area. you can enjoy the wind.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
roomTip: As the hotel is on a cliff edge if it is windy the bee hives/rooms can be very noisy.
text: The hotel has breathtaking views, a stunning swimming pool which has just been built, pleasant and helpful staff who can’t do enough for you and reasonably priced food. I was told that the Sri Lankan breakfast was delicious, but I didn’t actually try it myself. We were a bit disappointed that the hotel was so far from, Ella, but by the end of our stay this didn’t matter at all, because the views made up for it. Be aware that the hotel is on a cliff edge and when it is windy, it can be very noisy in the bee hives/rooms.
title: Breathtaking views with stunning swimming pool.

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for the excellent review. Kindly be informed that most of our construction is complete.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay minimum 2 days. Enjoy the great food at the restaurant. No other place nearby. I recommend the King Beehives. New lodging and best view
text:
Amazing views and tranquility from this mind blowing resort. We lived in one of the new King Beehives and it was a dream sitting at the porch absorbing nature at its best. The pool and restaurant were beautifully designed and we enjoyed great food at the place. If you like to hike then you find a lot of routes nearby and you can even walk directly from the resort to Kirawanagama nature falls. A little local place where you can swim under the waterfall without meeting any other tourists.
Be aware that the resort is expanding the restaurant area, but it was not interfering with our stay and they are only working at the level above the restaurant.
title: Mind blowing views from the private porch.

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review. The expansion of our resort is nearly complete and we managed to open the brand new restaurant for the new year. The restaurant and the swimming pool has the best views in the island. Hope to see you soon.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text: We enjoyed our stay here - it was very peaceful and beautiful view.  The service was great, the food was great too.  We spent our time just relaxing and enjoying the view.  They will arrange taxi service if you need it.  The room was clean and quiet (there is construction going on --in January I believe there will be a bigger pool and gym, right now there is no gym) but we had a room off to the side.  Main room a little bit musty, maybe because of the shower.
title: Peaceful getaway

placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka

text:
What a surprise! The new infinity pool, restaurant and bar had opened 3 days earlier ( Jan 2025) and what a treat! Staff as usual for Sri Lanka very welcoming and excellent hospitality. 
Full bar with wine list ( tip - you could stock some more expensive wines and people would enjoy if wanted something more special  )
Beehive room very well set out with private patio and incredible views over the mountains towards the South coast. 
Live entertainment for dinner and really good beef curry. Highly recommend and sad only booked on night.
title: Beautiful new extension with new infinity pool and restaurant. Beehive hut rooms very tasteful set into the hillside

text:
I don’t know if words are enough to describe my stay at Dream Cliff Mountain Resort.

It was 100% a wonderful stay!

From service, to location, to food everything was on point. I think it was definitely one of the best experiences I’ve had in Sri Lanka.

The staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. They were always ensuring our stay was absolutely pleasant which I have not experienced in any other hotel. Food was really really yum and the portion sizes were so filling. For each meal I was extremely full that I could go into a food coma. Thinking about it makes me hungry. The rooms were very comfortable and each room had a beautiful view of the mountains and lakes for miles and miles. 

It’s definitely the place to getaway from the hustle and bustle, for peace and tranquility. I hope I get the opportunity to return Dream Cliff Mountain Resort again and will be recommending this place to all my friends and family.
title: Definitely A Dream Stay

placeInfo/address: Hambantota, Hambantota, Tangalle 82000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Take some time to walk though the hotels greenhouses and the lakeside!
text:
An excellent getaway specially for families and large groups! The hotel is very spacious, spread over a large area with plenty of greenery. Guinea fowl and peacocks freely roam around. There’s a basketball court, tennis and badminton courts and a cricket pitch with the relevant equipment for the use of guests which I thought was brilliant! 

The rooms are spacious and comfortable, however it really baffles me why there are no lake-facing patios in some of the deluxe and superior rooms which are in  prime lakefront locations.

Service is 100%! Our AC stopped cooling on Christmas Eve and they had the condenser replaced and room cooled by the time we were back from dinner, which was just outstanding to me considering the service I’d have received from popular hotel chains in SL for a similar issue! Restaurant staff was also very sweet, they brought items from the kitchen which were not on the menu when we inquired about them, and kindly served my 4yo copious bowls of ice cream and fruit while we ate!

Food could be improved for sure, there were no live stations for breakfast even on Christmas day which was surprising. The chef sure does a killer mutton biriyani though! We had buffets for all meals since the hotel was at full occupancy that weekend. 

Definitely would visit again.
title: Excellent views and stellar service

placeInfo/address: 57, Ward Place, Colombo 7, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is great.  The best feature is the rooftop infinity pool - perfect for getting away from the noise and stress of Colombo.  But also the food is great - very flavourful, and with a wide selection.  They managed our food allergies (gluten and dairy) really well - but make sure you explain very clearly, as some of the staff have limited English.  If you also have food allergies, ask to complete the relevant form when you arrive.  They will then pass the relevant information on to the two restaurants.  

If you're travelling as a family, the two room suite is perfect.  There is a living room and kitchen included.  The price is really reasonable if you book in advance.
title: Excellent.  Just right for pre and post airport.

placeInfo/address: 57, Ward Place, Colombo 7, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
I can only say pros.
We were 3 people and had the Studio room one time for a few days, the Super Deluxe room the second time.
* Great value for a good price.
* Well, it's a hotel room, but it felt nice and very comfortable. There's a wooden floor, the room was very bright due to the glazing to one direction, and features a spacious bath room. The room was rather quiet.
* The studio has another room equipped with a kitchen and a washing machine.
* The staff are very friendly.
* To our pleasant surprise they let us check in hours before their official check-in time (10AM, which is 4 hours earlier than 2PM).
The small gym on top offers everything you need for a good workout.
* Jetwing Colombo 7 is nicely located not far from the Seed, Grind and Milk&Honey Cafés.
* Internet (WiFi) is excellent.
title: Pleasant, gladly again

placeInfo/address: 57, Ward Place, Colombo 7, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for two nights at the end of our trip to Sri Lanka, mainly because we wanted to spend a day in Colombo. At first sight we thought  it was just another International - style modern hotel, of the type you can find anywhere in the world, but we were mistaken! 

What sets it apart are the restaurant food (some of the best I have had anywhere in the last few years) but most importantly the staff. From the welcome at the front desk, to service in the main restaurant and the rooftop bar, everybody we dealt with was outstanding; friendly, professional, and thoughtful. A particular mention must go to Vimukthi, Manisha and Asitha for their friendliness and professional service in the restaurant, and also to the chef, whose name I don't know, and the kitchen staff, for preparing such excellent food, beautifully presented and cooked perfectly. 

Our room was lovely, on the 8th floor so offering a good view over the city, and very comfortable.

A perfect end to what has been a fantastic trip to this lovely country.
title: Not just another modern city hotel!

Dear Guest,

Warmest greetings from all of us at Jetwing Colombo Seven. 

We thank you for your feedback and thank you for selecting Jetwing Colombo Seven. 

Please accept my sincere apologies for the inconvenience caused at the rooftop resto-bar ward7.

I am very confident that this was a misunderstanding, as we welcome families all the time to the resto-bar. I am myself a father of a young child, I ensure that the resto-bar always maintains a child friendly atmosphere. 

I have taken this matter very seriously with the Food and beverage team to ensure that no family feels the way you have felt. We have spent time training and refreshing the entire team regarding maintaining the right attitude towards families with children. 

Once again please accept my sincere apologies and do not let this one-time occurrence keep you and your kids away from the beautiful resto-bar located at the roof top. 

Looking forward to welcoming you back again to Jetwing Colombo Seven again.

Ayubowan (May you live long)!

Ajantha Perera
General Manager
placeInfo/address: 57, Ward Place, Colombo 7, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for 1 night at the end of our Sri Lanka trip. We arrived late afternoon and left early morning. The room was comfy, good sized bed. There were some food marks on the carpet from previous guests. There’s a great rooftop/pool area, the city is so smoggy but incredible to see from so high up. My main ‘con’ were the staff on the top floor. We got the vibe when we arrived there for drinks that they didn’t welcome the children upstairs. Regardless, we stayed for food and drinks but nobody was really very friendly or approachable. We stayed there for quite a while having a few courses and playing board games with our children but the general tone did not shift.
The hotel is conveniently placed and we would stay again if it formed part of the trip, I’m personally not in a rush to go back to Colombo.
title: Short, comfy 1 night stay

placeInfo/address: 57, Ward Place, Colombo 7, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: Nous sommes habitués aux hôtels jetwing. Celui ci, de l'extérieur, ne donne pas envie: on dirait un hlm soviétique! Une fois entre, la magie opere: décoration chic et de bon goût dans les tons gris béton rehausse par des boiseries sublimes (plancher, meubles, huisseries). C'est apaisant et on se sent bien. La chambre est superbe, avec une vue dégagée, sans vis à vis. Baies vitrées lumineuses. La piscine en roof top est un peu petite, la terrasse aussi. On aimerait des transats pour faire la sieste. Après 15h30, l'ombre manque aussi! Ce sera notre seule vraie critique! La restauration est, comme souvent chez jetwing, de très haut niveau. Le filet de bar cuit sur peau associé aux petits légumes que j'ai commandé hier aurait eu sa place dans un restaurant avec étoiles MICHELIN en France: absolument sublime! La cuisine srilankaise est également de très haut niveau. Le service est attentionné. On reviendra sans la moindre hésitation!
title: Un vrai jetwing en plein centre de colombo

text:
This is a charming hotel which is far more than the sum of its parts .
The operations manager is a larger than life character who is across every detail .
He has an accent that is a blend of south London, Dudley , Jamaica and of course Sri Lanka , it is quite something.
Room was great , everything you could want , and lovely and cool.
The Cozy bar is a small but fantastically atmospheric bar where it is very possible to get quite drunk without noticing, the service is absolutely excellent.
The restaurant, whilst small , is cool and has a lovely selection of food , the dessert display is the best and tastiest we have experienced on our tour of Sri Lanka.
Perfectly located for Yala ( and yes we saw a Leopard) , just a wonderful spot .
title: Lovely hotel

text: I cannot understand how this place does not have straight 5! The staff is amazing and attentive, almost invisible while catering to your needs. It is very clean, tents are extremely comfortable, there's warm water and wifi. Everything is squeaky clean. The dinner was mind blowing in terms of tastes and overall experience. On top of that we have had an evening walk and safari trip with Solomon - i cannot recommend him enough! Please ask for him specifically. Not only does he have amazing knowledge about all Animals (birds above all!), but he makes the whole experience fun, memorable and overall amazing. On top of that I have to add - as it is important to me, that everything in there is done with the highest regard of nature - no plastic is left behind, Animals are not stressed out or chased. It was a true pleasure and I will be sending all my friends there!
title: If I could recommend one place in Sri Lanka, that would be it.

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for sharing such a detailed and wonderful review! We're thrilled that you had a fantastic experience with us at the campsite and enjoyed the unique connection to nature. placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Food cannot be taken into the tents but they will store it for you at the reception
text:
This is our third experience stay to visit a national park and it was fantastic. The tents themselves are a very interesting design, having a living space and a separate sleeping area with a toilet and shower behind. Luxurious by camping standards but obviously not the same as a hotel. The beds are hard and the showers were cold but that’s not the reason you are staying here.

The staff were super attentive, extremely polite and available whenever you needed. They brought multiple courses for every meal, catering specifically for our 3 year old daughter and making sure our needs were met. The food was tasty and fresh and the outdoor dining experience again was very unique.

We had 4 safari’s with the wonderful Solomons, this gentleman was the 49th licensed naturalist in Sri Lanka (for birds) and he was a gold mine of information, telling us so many facts about the local wildlife and animals further afield. In addition to this, he was an excellent spotter, finding pretty much everything other than the illusive leopard which to be fair, isn’t really something you see at Udawalawe.

The campsite itself also had an array of animals, including peacocks, lizards, birds and land monitors. 

We really enjoyed ourselves and would highly recommend
title: A very different experience with Nature

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your fantastic experience with Mahoora Safari! We’re delighted to hear that you had such a memorable stay and that our team could accommodate your flexible travel plans. It's wonderful to know you appreciated the attentive care from our catering team and the efforts of our staff to ensure your comfort—especially in managing those unexpected tent visitors!

Seeing around 20 elephants, including baby elephants, sounds like a truly magical moment, and we’re so glad you got to experience it. Solomon will be thrilled to hear your kind words about his knowledge and passion. His expertise and sharp eye for spotting wildlife add so much value to the safaris, and we’re proud to have him on our team.

We appreciate your feedback about the tent netting and are glad our team addressed it promptly for your comfort. It’s always our goal to provide an enjoyable and seamless experience, and your comments motivate us to keep improving.

We hope to welcome you back for another unforgettable adventure in the future!

Warm regards,
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Mahoora Safari was an amazing experience, the team on site were so helpful and looked after us. They were really flexible with our ever changing arrival and departure times as we travelled across Sri Lanka and were planning each day as it came. There was plenty of food provided throughout the day and the catering team member we had was so attentive and friendly. Our tent had quite a few visitors (bugs and salamanders) but the team came to safely capture them and release outside the tent so we could sleep in peace. There were a number of gaps in the netting, but again once we had pointed these out, the team had them all stitched up before we stayed for our second night. 

The safari itself, we were lucky and saw around 20 elephants in a day, including lots of baby elephants which was really special. The elephants are friendly and not scared by the jeeps but a lot of jeeps will appear quickly if they are sighted. Solomons was our guide and he was extremely knowledgable of all the animals we saw in the park as well as his knowledge of Sri Lanka and its history. He is very passionate about his job and has excellent sight for spotting birds!
title: Great experience

text:
We booked 2 nights in the safaritent with a night walk and safari. Dinner in the dark was a magical place. Our guide Solomon told us it was better to do a morning walk instead of the night walk, because there would be so much more to see. And he was right! 
Solomon has a lot of experience and was able to show and tell us a lot during our trips, because he also went with us on safari. Due to footprints he could tell when the animals were there. He can tell a lot of all different kind of animals, especially about birds. We truly liked the story that explains how smart elephants are. We asked to see some other animals, like crocodiles, which we hadn't seen during other safari's. Solomon knew exactly where to find them. 

During this day with Solomon we learned more than the past two weeks in Sri Lanka and we really had a nice time spending our day with him. This local can tell a lot about the island as well in very good English. 
We definitely recommend spending time with Solomon when you're at Udawalawe!
title: Amazing stay!

Thank you for sharing your wonderful review of your glamping experience with us on TripAdvisor! We are thrilled to hear that you and your family had a memorable stay at Mahoora Tented Safari Camp.

We are delighted that our warm welcome and the spacious, well-equipped Mahoora tents provided the comfort and amenities needed for your family. It's great to know that the setup with the kids' beds and master bedroom worked well for your party.

We're pleased that you enjoyed the freshly prepared lunch, sunset walk, and campfire BBQ, as well as the early morning safari. Cooler temperatures do indeed make for a better wildlife viewing experience, and we're glad it was worthwhile for you.

A special thank you for highlighting Soloman's exceptional service. His passion and knowledge of local wildlife truly make our safaris unique, and we're happy he could enhance your trip with his stories and insights.

roomTip: Arrange for your party ahead of time with meals/reauests. Bring spare clothes - closed shoes for hikes and comfy ones for camp
text:
Trip Advisor

We visited in July with 2 adults and 3 children all under 10. We decided we wanted to break up our trip considering the national park was approx 2 hours from where we were staying in Weligama.

On arrival we were warmly welcomed by the team. We had booked The Mahoora tents which have more space and better amenities and comfort. For our party of 5, the living area has been converted to allow 3 kids beds, with a master bedroom connected to the compact but fully functioning bathroom with shower, toilet and sink.

We had a freshly prepared lunch before having a sunset walk, followed by a campfire bbq. 

We had an early rise (pre 5am) for our morning safari, but well worth it. Cooler temperatures means more animals to see and a more bearable heat level.

What made our trip really special was our Naturist, Solomon. Full of stories, insights and a seemingly photographic memory of local wildlife, he kept us fully entertained throughout the trip. 

Thoroughly recommended for a true wilderness experience, and a must do if you are in the South of Sri Lanka.
title: ‘Glamping’ in the wilderness with kids

placeInfo/address: Coconut Cultivation Board Road Pasikuda, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Amazing beach, Pasikudha of Kalkudh,a a place you must visit.
text:
Our recent return visit to The Calm Resort & Spa, Pasikudah was a truly unforgettable experience—one that we will treasure and enthusiastically recommend to anyone seeking the ideal combination of luxury, serenity, and authentic Sri Lankan hospitality. Upon our arrival, we were welcomed with the warmest smiles and refreshing juice as welcome drinks, which immediately set a relaxing tone for our getaway. 
The resort is ideally situated along one of the most stunning beaches in Sri Lanka. Coconut trees gently sway in the breeze, and the view of the turquoise ocean is simply captivating—whether you’re in the lobby, lounging by the main pool, or taking in the scenery from your room, the landscape looks like it belongs in a travel magazine. 
We were fortunate enough to stay in a Garden View Pool Access Room, which surpassed all of our expectations. The room was spacious, beautifully decorated, and impeccably clean, featuring all the amenities we could desire—from cosy bedding and an opulent bathroom to a private terrace with direct pool access. The serene garden atmosphere made it feel like our own personal paradise. What truly distinguishes this resort is its remarkable team. Every staff member—from the front desk to housekeeping, from the restaurant employees to the gardeners—was exceptionally kind, professional, and attentive. Their level of service is unparalleled. 
We were particularly impressed with how well the staff recalled our preferences from a previous stay—it genuinely felt like returning home again and again. 
The dining experience at the resort was another standout feature. The à la carte options, especially the Margherita and vegetarian pizzas, were fantastic—hot, crispy, and bursting with flavour, surpassing many other restaurants we’ve tried across Sri Lanka. The buffet and set menu alternatives also provided a wide array of delicious, fresh, and beautifully presented meals catering to all tastes. Be sure to check out their newly constructed beach bar, situated in a spectacular location on the resort's beach. 
We wholeheartedly recommend sampling the resort’s signature Ceylon Yard (Yara) Tea, which was undoubtedly the finest traditional Ceylon tea we’ve ever had—rich, aromatic, and expertly brewed. 
A heartfelt thank you to Sujeeva and the wonderful team at Calm Pasi, who lead by example and maintain the resort to the highest standards. Their meticulous attention to detail, guest-focused approach, and enthusiasm for creating unforgettable experiences genuinely shine. 
All resort areas, including the pool, garden, and restaurant, are impeccably kept and reflect high levels of cleanliness and hygiene. The ambience throughout the resort is peaceful, welcoming, and perfect for both couples and families seeking relaxation. The Calm Resort & Spa in Pasikudha is the ideal choice. 
We departed feeling relaxed, revitalised, and already dreaming of our next stay. At this resort, we all will be cared for by an extraordinary team passionate about hospitality, surrounded by natural beauty, and provided with world-class service. Kudos to the Team again, see you all again.
title: The Calm Resort – Outstanding Service with its Scenic splendor of Pasikudha

text:
Отель очень понравился - тихий, спокойный. Можно по-настоящему выспаться и отдохнуть.

Отдельная благодарность персоналу, что нас заселили сразу по приезду, хотя мы приехали из аэропорта около 3 часов ночи.

Нас поселили на 1 этаже - шикарные виды из номера на пляж. И можно выходить из номера сразу на террасу через окно-дверь.

Еда очень вкусная, хотя иногда бывало сильно остро.
Мне особенно понравилась тыква карри и манго карри.
Крабы почти каждый день были в меню.

Что можно улучшить: больше зелени и салатов в меню добавить.
title: Настоящий отдых в тишине и спокойствии!

text:
We had a truly delightful stay at Calm Resort & Spa. From the moment we arrived, the front office team went out of their way to ensure our rooms were arranged to suit our comfort. We stayed in the garden villas, which offered easy access to both the pool and the beautiful, private beach. The calm waters were perfect for the kids to enjoy jet skiing and other water sports.

In the dining area, we were warmly welcomed and attentively cared for by Dammika, who consistently made us feel at home. Ganesh also provided exceptional service throughout our stay. The buffet offered an impressive variety of dishes, and we especially appreciated the nostalgic touch of “Yard tea” served at breakfast.

It was also a pleasure to meet the General Manager, Sujeewa, whose personal attention ensured we had the best possible experience. A heartfelt thank you to the entire team at Calm Resort & Spa—we had a wonderful time and look forward to returning.
title: Exceptional Service and Serene Beachfront Bliss

text:
We stayed at this  hotel for two days as a family getaway, and honestly, it exceeded all our expectations. From the moment we arrived, the staff were warm, welcoming, and always ready to help. The check-in process was smooth and fast, and we were pleasantly surprised by the spacious, clean, and well-decorated rooms with a breathtaking ocean view that we couldn't get enough of.

Everything about the hotel was simply perfect. The beach was just steps away, and it was clean, quiet, and ideal for kids to play while we relaxed under the sun. The pool area was also a big hit with our family, with plenty of loungers and a great little bar nearby. We dined at the on-site restaurant both nights, and the food was fresh, flavorful, and reasonably priced.

We loved the peaceful atmosphere, Two days felt way too short we all wished we had booked a longer stay. This place gave us exactly the break we needed, and we’re already talking about coming back for a longer trip. Highly recommended!
title: Best time

text:
J'ai passé un excellent séjour dans cet hôtel ! La salle de sport, le spa et la piscine sont vraiment agréables et bien entretenus, offrant un cadre parfait pour se détendre. La plage est un véritable petit coin de paradis. Les chambres sont spacieuses, modernes et bien décorées, avec une vue splendide qui ajoute un charme supplémentaire à l'ensemble de l'expérience.
Le seul petit bémol serait qu'il manque un peu de transats, ce qui peut rendre l'accès à un emplacement privilégié un peu difficile. De plus, il serait agréable d'avoir un service de boissons sur la plage ou autour de la piscine, où l'on pourrait se faire servir directement, plutôt que de devoir se déplacer.
Un grand merci particulier à Nathalie de FRAM, qui a vraiment contribué à rendre notre séjour encore plus merveilleux. Elle a été au petit soin pour nous, toujours disponible et avec une gentillesse remarquable. Grâce à elle, notre expérience a été vraiment exceptionnelle. Un grand bravo pour son professionnalisme et son accueil chaleureux !
title: Séjour hôtel the calm

This is a beautiful hotel in very peaceful, calm surroundings. We stayed for 4 nights during off season so it was very quiet, felt like we had the place to ourselves. The staff are incredibly attentive, can’t do enough for you and wanting to make sure you have a wonderful time. I didn’t catch everyone’s names but Tharindi especially was fantastic looking after our every need.
My only negative comment comes after I had an accident at the sister hotel the Anantara. We were asked to have our breakfast over there one morning and while walking back to the Avani we stopped to take a photograph over looking the lagoon, my foot fell through the wooden board on the deck and injured my leg. This was very dangerous as the wooden decking was all over the hotel, and similarly around the pool at the Avani. Considering how much rainfall there is at this time of year I feel this was really quite dangerous and could have been so much worse if there were any screws or splinters from the damaged wood.
The problem was fixed immediately and Tharindi and all staff were very good taking care of me. They offered to take me to the doctors and also took me to the spa for a treatment, the therapist also looked at my leg! I would urge the maintenance staff at both properties to keep on top of this situation as it could have resulted in a much worse injury.
However, despite this issue we had a wonderful time and it was a great choice for our holiday.
title: Lovely hotel in a wonderful peaceful setting

roomTip: 大人数での滞在だと、よりこの建築の良さが感じられると思います。
text: 学校の海外研修で訪れ、6部屋に別れて泊まりました。スタッフの方の親切な対応やサービスはもちろん、食事やビーチ、プールなど、リゾートヴィラとしての魅力を堪能することができました。私が滞在した Room 04は、外部空間を含んだ気持ちの良いバスルームがあり、こちらもBawaらしさを感じられる素晴らしい空間でした。ここの最大の魅力は、各部屋の絶妙な距離感にあると思います。開放的で気持ちの良い共用スペースや、階段などをうまく挟み込むことで、声は聞こえてきそうな近さを感じつつも、干渉されている感じがありません。まるで、どこかの部族の集落のような、一体感とプライベート感を両立した空間でした。大人数で、ほとんど貸切のような状態での宿泊だからこそ感じることができた、最大の魅力だと思います。
title: 絶妙な距離感が素晴らしい

text:
Selten haben wir uns in einem Hotel so gut umsorgt gefühlt, wie in diesem Hotel. Alle Angestellten waren sehr freundlich. Der Service war exzellent und das Essen im Rahmen der Halbpension war sehr gut. Am letzten Abend wurden wird mit einem speziellen, extra für uns hergerichteten Dinner verwöhnt. Schönes, geschmackvoll eingerichtetes Gebäude mit schöner Gartenanlage, bequemen Liegen und sauberen Pool.  Unser Zimmer war sauber, aber nichts Besonderes. Das Meer ist nah, aber der Strand eignet sich mehr für Strandspaziergänge als zum Sonnen. Die Brandung war zu stark zum Baden.
Wir haben uns in der ruhigen Atmosphäre des Hotels gut erholt. Eine klare Empfehlung von uns!
title: Hervorragendes Boutique-Hotel

Dear Madam,

Thank you for your detailed review of Villa Bentota. We're glad you enjoyed our location, room, and the service provided by our housekeeping and gardening teams.

We sincerely apologize for any disappointment you experienced during your check-in process. We strive to provide a warm and welcoming arrival experience for all our guests, and we regret that we did not meet your expectations on this occasion. Your feedback is invaluable, and we will certainly address this with our front desk team to ensure that all guests receive the warm Sri Lankan welcome we are known for.

Your feedback on our restaurant offerings is valuable, and we will look into expanding our breakfast variety and adding daily specials. We're pleased our restaurant staff made a positive impression.

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text: Perfectly located on the west coast, within easy distance of the Airport, cool beaches in the South of Hiri and Dikwella, mountains of Ella and the Nine Elms Bridge as well as the National Parks and Historical Fort Galle.   Villa Bentota is a small residence, with just a handful of beautifully appointed rooms I stayed in one of the suites with a lovely terrace overlooking the gardens and the beach in the distance.  Checking in on a Sunday morning, i was pre warned my room would not be ready as it was occupied (thank you for heads up) but was expecting a massive Sri Lankan welcome which simply did not happen - check in was functional, keys and money.  My room was lovely, huge (triple aspect) and with a great view, lovely bed and sumptuous linens and throws. Huge bathroom with a shower and a bath as well as double sink.  Lovely smell of cinnamon oil gently burning to warn off the bugs.   I would liked to have seen more luxury ameneties, candles, speaker and flowers - charged 1750 rupees for a disposable razor was a bit much.   The room was spotlessly clean, the staff looking after the rooms were really amazing, always on hand to assist working around guest schedule .  Good WIFI both in common areas and a room specific - although it did not work in the breakfast room. Outside of the hotel was spotless, a team of gardeners constantly working on the property as well as at the beach just a short walk across the track.  Small restaurant overlooking gardens, lovely spot with a menu to suit all tastes however i would have liked to have seen more variety and perhaps daily specials or a grill evening - breakfast was underwhelming in terms of choices although  what was offered was of good quality.  Restaurant staff were also great, going above and beyond .   Overall this is a really really lovely property, with fab staff and adequate amenities - personally I would add a few more touches, to take from good to great not only in the rooms but as part of the welcome, and in terms of offering advise on day trips and local attractions.    I will definitely be coming back again, so will not share my room number as I want to keep it free for me 😉
title: Lovely Oasis of Tranquility and Calm.  Feels like staying with a family

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Bermuda Duffers,

Wow, that is quite the review. All I can say is thank you for writing such a lovely review, and I am so pleased that you loved staying at the hotel. placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
Our recent stay at Villa Bentota will stay with us forever. It was one of those places that hit every single high note for what we wanted. It is the embodiment of heritage boutique - the design and architecture by Geoffrey Bawa is unique and delivers interest wherever you turn. 

The service is outstanding. It is clear everyone works as a team and strive to ensure guests are happy and want for nothing. All Villa Bentota personnel were professional, friendly, attentive and efficient. They appeared to take great pride in being employees of the hotel.

Our room, suite 4, was delightful. Roomy, clean, beautifully decorated, and very comfortable. We loved our huge balcony overlooking the gardens, coconut palms, and of course, the railway line. Loved the railway line - a real feature!

The food and drinks, and accompanying service, is excellent. Yes, you pay a bit more for the restaurant meals and bar drinks, but everything about Villa Bentota is an experience and the rewards are in the staying there. Breakfast is fresh, great in variety, and prepared to order. My wife is coeliac and was provided with gluten free bread and all meal ingredients were carefully checked before being served. Ruwan and his food and beverage team were wonderful, with incredible attention to detail at all times.

Thank you to the whole team at Villa Bentota. You made for a very memorable stay.
title: Peace, calm, tranquility, service

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Simon

Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay with us at KK Beach. I am so pleased that you enjoyed your stay as much as you did - reading reviews like yours makes this job so rewarding!

Thank you again for coming to stay and writing a review!

With best wishes,
 
George Cooper
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 nights here. The staff were excellent & friendly. Our room (suite 6) was very comfortable & quiet, situated at the far end. The property had several zones, beautifully furnished for relaxation. The pool area was wonderful with good sized shady umbrellas & large towels. Cold water was brought to us regularly. The shop was actually very interesting with local art & handicrafts & we did buy a few souvenirs! Breakfast was delicious & well worth ordering Sri Lankan curry & hoppers the night before. The dinner menu was a little limited but we enjoyed all our meals, especially the curries. We enjoyed the individuality of the hotel & the train running through the bottom of the garden didn’t worry us at all-it was fun to see local people going on their journeys. We only walked on the beach once. It was beautiful but the humidity & heat kept us near the pool.
title: Beautiful boutique hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Steven,

Thank you for sharing your feedback from your recent stay at Villa Bentota. While we're thrilled you appreciated our stunning property and high-quality amenities, we regret any areas where we fell short of your expectations. 
Your comments are invaluable, and we're committed to enhancing our offerings to ensure a truly special experience for our guests. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back and exceed your expectations in the future.

Warm regards,
Kalpa Nanayakkara.
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
This was our 8th hotel during a month long trip to Sri Lanka. We had high expectations for Villa Bentota and were very excited about our 5 night stay, having recently stayed at 3 different boutique style hotel/villas, all with outstanding personal service.  Villa Bentota never quite met our expectations nor the previous service levels that we had received during our trip. 

The property and grounds are stunning, as well  the beach which is just across the train track at the bottom of the gardens. The rooms are lovely and the linens etc. are all of a high quality, including the beds ( we slept well).

The food and beverage is a bit pricey compared with other hotels in Sri Lanka, but comparable to international rates. There were a few things which were more than double the price of other SL hotels we visited.

We found the breakfast and dinner a little disappointing for various reasons given our very high expectations. 

We tended to gravitate towards the beach each day, rather than the pool area. The Villa has two sun beds on a fairly deserted stretch of beach. We did ask the Villa team to put on the sun pads each day, to make things a little more comfortable. The Villa has  a small beach bar that operates for sun downers  from 5pm to 7pm,  again it's quite pricey when compared against the neighbouring properties beach bars. There is no refreshment service on the beach from the villa outside the sundown hours, however there are neighbouring beach bars fairly close that we used during the day.  Like the property the beach is stunning .                                      
 
Service from the Manager was excellent when we asked him for anything, it was dealt with immediately.       
                                                                                         We did experience quite a few small service shortfalls during our stay.

The Villa has enormous potential to be really something special.
title: Mixed feelings

ownerResponse/text:

Thank you once again for your kind words and for choosing to stay with us. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you and your family back for another memorable stay in the future.

We spent 5 very pleasant days here at the end of our tour of the country and thoroughly enjoyed the extremely welcoming beachside location with onsite swimming pool and beautiful gardens.

text: We stayed here during our honeymoon and we had a wonderful time, and wished we could have stayed longer. The room and the hotel was beautifully decorated and felt very authentic. text:
Arriving at Kandy house feels like a step into a reality of what life should be .

text:
What a joy it was to stay in this  gorgeous hotel ! We only stayed 2 days , but wish it could have been for longer . 
We had booked   an ultra deluxe room [ Peacock room I think ]  , it was beautiful , with a charming terrace and private bit of garden with frangipani trees   - we felt very spoilt . We had breakfast each morning on this private terrace , with our own waiter to serve us ....he  was always on hand to cater to any requests .....I am so sorry I cannot remember your  name , but thank you so much , you were just  brilliant . 
The whole house is beautiful , and beautifully decorated .
Dinner was delicious [ as was breakfast] , and it was delightful to sit by the courtyard garden - and again the service was perfect .  Yes, slightly expensive , but well worth it .

Would highly recommend staying in the wonderful Kandy House - a beautiful haven . Will definitely stay here again on any future trips .

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Pioneer room - very pretty, feels private away from the other rooms. Close to the dining area.
text:
If you're visiting Kandy, The Kandy House is a MUST. 

It has a fascinating history, and maintains a traditional feel with beautiful wooden antique furniture throughout. It's also probably the best smelling hotel in Sri Lanka. There is a natural perfume from the gorgeous plants, fruit trees and flowers in the gardens. 

The service is fantastic - they anticipate your every need. We were even escorted from the pool to our room with an umbrella when it rained one afternoon. And they also kindly helped us with some car trouble. 

The food is fantastic, particularly the curry evening - make sure you're staying for that. It's a sensational introduction to Sri Lankan dishes. The juices and smoothies were also lovely. 

The hotel is a little way from Kandy, so it can feel like quite an effort to venture out in the evenings, particularly if you've been out on day trips. Dinner in the hotel, whilst brilliant is on the expensive side, so if you're staying for a few nights it's worth asking the hotel to organise a tuk tuk to any local restaurant and back - it was extremely easy. 

The Pioneer room is lovely, though we didn't actually use the private patio. It feels very private, off on its own away from the other rooms, but close to the dining area. You can hear breakfast being set up in the morning (but this might be true for all of the rooms) and it is a little dark but it's good for darkness at night, and during the day all the doors and windows can be opened - just be careful of insects. 

The pool is very pretty. Though there is now some building work close by so there is a little bit of noise. But with the swaying palm trees and with a gin & tonic or two, it's easy to ignore.
title: A must-stay place

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for two nights, and really enjoyed this peaceful place - an oasis away from the noise of Kandy.  Such a beautiful building, well restored.
Our room was comfortable with a four poster bed and a private large terrace.
The staff were friendly and helpful.  The food was very good.
Afternoon tea by the pool was a treat after a busy morning sightseeing. 
A particular mention for Nimal, who looked after us so well.

Food was excellent, both in quality and quantity, and staff were really friendly, helpful and attentive - a real asset to the hotel.  Of note, the onsite massage treatment was also very good despite being organised at very short notice.

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: Breakfast was epic every day. Service was exceptional. We really felt like royalty. We got a free upgrade because covid emptied the place out. For what it’s worth, it had the best lending library of any place we stayed. Massage available on premises (for a few). But it's the jungle, and leeches infest the yard and foliage. Wear shoes on the grass at all times. Had to throw a pair of socks away (inside out) - still we would stay there again, the place was that magnificent even leeches can’t detract from it. It's the price you pay for being in a quite and remote place, better than poison on the grounds, I say.  We laugh about it, and it added some adventure. 10/10.
title: The BEST!  Just prepare for leeches.

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Kandy city centre is not in walking distance. Mendis can arrange Tuk-Tuks or a driver.
text: This is a lovely small boutique hotel that’s perfect for honeymooners and single travellers wanting tranquility. It’s located a 30 minute drive outside Kandy city centre.  The garden - perfect for evening cocktails affords a beautiful (if restricted) view of the paddy fields.  The hotel manager, Mendis, is warm, jovial and extremely helpful; creating an atmosphere that makes you feel like you’re staying in the home of an old friend rather than a commercial property.  The staff are attentive but special mention goes to Samira whose service is outstanding.  The hotel has  swimming pool (unheated) - and it feels ‘hidden’ among the trees.  The food here is SPECTACULAR and if gastronomy is your thing definitely stay here!  A 3 course meal is about £30 pp.   Every room is significantly different in style and size as this is a converted bungalow so choose you’re room with care.  On the first night we had the ground floor room with a  private  patio.  It was £300 (inc breakfast), so on the pricy side.  The only downside was this: the room was adjacent to the outdoor dining area. On the first night a large party of guests arrived for dinner and were seated outside our room. They made a lot of noise.. However, they were asked to wrap up at midnight - which after we complained - was enforced. Better still, the next night their table was moved away from our front door and the staff were incredibly apologetic.   On the last night we moved to an upstairs room. It was beautiful (and fewer small bugs!). The hot water is provided via a tank in the room so be a little sparing if there are 2 of you! We’ll definitely stay here again.
title: Kandy House: perfect for honeymooners/ single travellers seeking a little luxury, fantastic food, pool & boutique vibe

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: I stayed here for two nights and really loved it!   Great location and beautiful grounds and pool.  The rooms were full of character but had everything you needed.   Food was excellent and service impeccable.

Bar bill was a bit of a shock but, whatever, we had a blast. 
Yala, however, was a disappointment; too many jeeps, too few animals. A call to mobile phones about a leopard led to what you can only describe as Wacky Races as drivers risked life and limb to view a big cat who disappeared before we got there

text:
We arrived at the hotel, unplanned, with a extreme short notice, but we were warmly welcomed with a perfect bittersweet tamarind juice, and a pleasant and friendly smile. Checking in was quite smooth and fast, I must mention, and the staff went beyond their way to make us feel at home..!!

This tucked in property is perfect for a peaceful holiday away from the chaos of city life. Easily accessible from Galle town - few mins away, by bus or a tuk. It give a vibe of a colonial mansion, with its own majestic appearance. The room was quite spacious, with enough privacy, and all the modern amenities. The bed was comfy with the blissful caress of cotton sheets.

The pool is hidden away to the back of this vast property, and it’s perfect for a evening dip after a beer or two..!!

The food was delicious, and I guess if you decide to visit here, trying their Sri Lankan Menu is a must..!!

Most of all, the stay was wonderful due to the pleasant welcoming nature of the staff. Mr. Sanjaya was extremely helpful to make our stay memorable, and they made sure we had a joyous getaway..!!

If you’re ever in Galle, it a must-go place, for a stay, or at least a drink by the pool..!!
title: For a peaceful, yet blissful getaway

placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Tamarind Hill is a delightful, tranquil retreat, a few kilometres and easy bus or tuktuk ride from Galle. Rooms are spacious and well-appointed, the central garden area is an attractive place to relax, and the meals are excellent. Nature is all around, though not so in-your-face as nearby Kurulabedda. 
The staff are friendly and attentive at all hours of the day, and speak excellent English - a particular shout out to Sangeeth and Sonjaya who looked after us very well. 
The only serious downside is the approach to the hotel. The narrow broken road isn't the problem - but the piles of rubbish that line it create depression every time one approaches the hotel. I believe the owners should take responsibility to clean it up regularly and pressurise the authorities to provide bins - at least so one can see that they are trying.
title: Excellent tranquil hotel close to Galle

text:
Friendly and amenable staff. Beautiful old villa courtyard set-up with really well done interiors. Lovely good sized rooms. Gorgeous pool - a hidden gem tucked away at the bottom of the garden. 
Clean and tidy. 
Ample breakfast that goes on and on! 
Great access to vetted tuk-tuk drivers who zipped us into the Fort and back very day. Just a 5 min drive away. 

Easily hands down the best gin cucumber cocktail we have had in  Sri Lanka - the bar tender is a legend. Hopefully they'll get the full licence again (most places in Sri Lanka are operating on a reduced bar service due to Covid lockdowns etc) and more people will visit what is a bit of a forgotten gem of a place. 
Wishing all the best for 2022! Peace and prosperity!

Asia Leisure could do with investing in the entrance road if at all possible off the main road to Galle.

placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
We loved our stay at Dream Cliff. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with a warm welcome and stunning views of the sun setting over the mountains. We enjoyed cocktails on the terrace looking out at the view before a delicious dinner in the atmospheric outdoor terrace, with the backdrop of lovely piano music being played by a very talented member of staff. 
Our beehive, Zircon, was a treat to stay in - a beautiful bathroom, very comfortable bed and a spotless terrace where we enjoyed sitting outside and listening to the sounds of the many birds. Make sure you have your binoculars to hand to take a better look at the varied birdlife including Sri Lankan Grey Hornbills and huge Kites.
We enjoyed a refreshing dip in the pool before we left, we were sad to leave Dream Cliff! Thank you for having us.
title: A highlight of our Sri Lankan holiday

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for the wonderful review. We are working on the points you mentions. We are already airconditioning the beehives, adding a lowered ceiling preventing the toilet noise into the rooms and other improvements that you mentioned. placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
We (couple + 7 year old son) were at Dream Cliff in December, ushered in Christmas. When we look back today at our 10 day trip, the views from this resort is what's etched most into our minds - and that's priceless. The food and service is outstanding - promptness of the room service, the freshness of the menu, the courtesy of the dining staff - we were thoroughly pampered. 

At first, we were slightly taken aback that there was no air conditioning in the rooms - however, 15 minutes into the stay, and one realizes that it's not required at all. 

Any room for improvement - yes, mostly room related - the room decor could be slightly less 'tacky', bathroom slippers would help, pillows are slightly hard, wifi is a bit patchy (a blessing maybe!), geyser can be hotter at times, no closed wardrobes, noises from the bathroom get amplified due to the dome design etc. 

However, all said and done, we would still stay here unquestionably whenever we're in SL next. The positives overwhelmingly overwhelm the few improvement areas.
title: A glimpse of heaven...

text: Second visit, and the food remains delicious, though the menu hasn't changed in the past two years. The room is excellent with a fantastic view, and this time, we enjoyed the Ruby beehive. If you're traveling by train, Haputhale is easily accessible. A local tuk-tuk driver charged 2000 rupees for a drop-off at the resort.
title: Mountain Edge Escapes: Simplicity, Scenery, and Serenity

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for the excellent reiew. We will take on your sugestions for our future guest.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Be aware that the walk from (some of) the rooms to the restaurant area involves climbing some steep steps.
text:
This is a lovely hotel which repays the time and effort taken to reach it. 
The main draw here is the utterly spectacular view southwards over the rolling hills from the beehive-style rooms. It must be one of the best hotel views in the world !

The room itself (Ruby Beehive) was beautiful, quaint and very private. The bed was the biggest we have ever slept in  , maybe an emperor bed. Bathroom was clean and surprisingly spacious.

The gardens are beautiful and a walk around the grounds should not be missed, being another way to take in that astonishing view. And do make the effort to get up for the sunrise at 5.45 am.

Food was somewhat variable. Breakfasts were consistently fantastic - highlights included Kola Kanda porridge and hoppers with fish curry. Some of the evening dishes also hit the mark including Seer fish in Ambassador sauce, and prawn skewers. Biriani and some of the Western dishes were less impressive, our advice would be to stick to the Sri Lankan options - and avoid the ‘Dream Cliff style’ club sandwich altogether. 

One other issue was a 1980s easy listening playlist on a loop over dinner, which we found somewhat grating. Others may love it.  Get a new playlist please!

Staff were very helpful at all times. Thanks especially to Vips and to all the staff who lugged our cases up the steep steps on departure.
title: Beautiful rooms with a spectacular view, but food variable.
