ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Warmest greetings from all of us at Jetwing Colombo Seven. 

We thank you for your feedback and thank you for selecting Jetwing Colombo Seven. 

Thank you for your wonderful comments about the Ward7 roof top bar. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the selection of our signature cocktails. 

Looking forward to welcoming you back again to Jetwing Colombo Seven again.

Ayubowan (May you live long)!

Ajantha Perera
General Manager
placeInfo/address: 57, Ward Place, Colombo 7, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
Not the most buzzling city hotel in Colombo compared to the ones that some prefer in Kollupitiya with beach fronts and sky lounges. 

This is exactly the reason to chose Jetwing Seven for your quick stay or night out for drinks in the Colombo city. 

Being located down Ward Place Colombo Seven, the most chic and upmarket part of the city, Colombo's equivalent to Mayfair, London, or Beverlyhills California, it is patronized, even though limited in number, by a class that is equally hip (not to be confused with hippie) in style, who aren't defined by the brand of ties they wear. 

My personal attraction of the hotel is it's aptly branded Ward 7 bar with a small but cosy balcony overlooking the city, particularly the adjoining Hospital Square from which the bar itself draws its theme. 

A particular attraction and one you MUST check out is its unique cocktail menu with signature cocktails made keeping in line with bar's theme - Ward 7.

While being a little pricey one can not complain given the innovative range of cocktails they have. One that stands out from the list and one you MUST try is 'Aneasthaesia', which will privide you with a truly anaesthetizing experience.

I think you could also have your regular cocktails like Blue Margaritas, but do not make the mistake of asking for Bloody Maries, which they do not serve, which I did, probbably to the annoyance of at least one of the two Catholic dudes (whom I thought were friends) that I last went there with. 

Later only I realized that the owners of Jetwing too were Christians and perhaps Bloody Maries are a too sensitive a drink to be served in their establishments. 

Regardless I highly recommend the place. The day I went, the ambience was a little sombre, but given the themes of the bar and the cocktail menu, and the music that complemented, I'd say it's one of the perfect places in Colombo to go chill in the evening, when the sun is setting, with a friend or two.

Cheers!
title: Get Anesthetized at Ward No 7

roomTip: Take binoculars for bird watching
text:
Located just 3 hours drive on the Southern Expressway Sri Lanka the resort is spread over almost 8 acres of beautifully curated garden with lush greenery, trees and lots of well mown grass. The rooms are super large, tastefully furnished, spacious with excellent linen. Bathrooms are large designed to stay dry devoid of wet floors.
Check in is fast, front office is efficient and the guests can drive up to the chalets or rooms.
Pool is well cared for set in a great location.
Chef is a marvel with tasty cuisine with a wide spread to be chosen from. However, variety in the selection of meats is very limited with a marked absence of beef or pork. The grilled tank giant prawn was delicious. However, being so close to the sea, calamari curry or sea crabs and the presence of beef or pork would have eased the monotony of finding the same menu repeated at lunch and dinner. This might be OK for one night bookings but over several days it is tiresome. But, with such tasty cooking it is well worth.
The marvels of an excellent kitchen can be improved with some Restaurant Service skills given to the Restaurant Team. They need to learn that the essentials of restaurant skills is not clearing tables or laying covers, BUT looking after individual guest's needs.  With such a willing Team I am sure this can be done.
All in all, a super holiday and a tip to any traveler to the South of Sri Lanka, mark this as a "must stay" place.
title: IDEAL HOLIDAY EXPERIENCE

placeInfo/address: Hambantota, Hambantota, Tangalle 82000 Sri Lanka
text:
I recently stayed at Bird Resort, Hambantota for one night. Overall, we had a good experience and would recommend the resort to others.

Please note that this rating is highly subjective.

1/10 - @#$% 
2/10 - Not good at all 
3/10 - Not OK
4/10 - Average 
5/10 - OK
6/10 - Good 
7/10 - Very good 
8/10 - Super
9/10 - Excellent 
10/10 - Extremely excellent

Overall experience: I would rate our overall experience as 8 out of 10. The resort is clean and well-maintained, and the staff were friendly and helpful. The only downside was that the food was a bit limited on weekdays.

Room: The room was spacious and comfortable, with a comfortable bed, a sofa in the room, and a TV with satellite connection and a minibar. The bathroom was also clean and well-equipped. I would rate the room as 8 out of 10.

Staff: The staff were friendly and helpful, especially Sachini and Nushan from the front office. They went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable, including arranging a birthday cake and decorations for my wife. I would rate the staff as 9 out of 10.

Food: The food was generally good, although the set menu on weekdays was a bit limited. The cakes and desserts were excellent, though. I would rate the food as 7 out of 10 for meals and 9 out of 10 for cakes and desserts.

Facilities: The resort has a nice pool, a mini basketball court, a large playground, and a badminton court. They also offer elephant feeding in the evening, which my wife and my one-and-a-half-year-old daughter enjoyed a lot. They also offer free entry to the bird park next door, which is Asia's Largest Birds Park with over 180 endemic and exotic birds.

Overall, we had a good experience at Bird Resort, Hambantota. The staff were friendly, the room was comfortable, and the facilities were good. I would recommend the resort to others, especially families with young children who are planning to visit the bird park. Great experience. We will be back again.

Especially, I would like to mention Sachini from the front office. She helped me with everything from the room reservation to my checkout. She even arranged a room decor and cake in the evening to surprise my wife for her birthday. She was very friendly and helpful, and I would definitely recommend her to others.

Tips:

** If you are visiting on a weekday, be aware that the food menu is more limited.

** Get an electric cart to visit the bird park next door. It's a large park with over 180 birds, and it can be a bit tiring to walk around. (The electric cart costs 5000 LKR, but it's worth it for the convenience.)

** Sachini is a great asset to the resort, and she will go out of her way to make your stay enjoyable. Be sure to ask for her help if you need anything.
title: A Great Place to Visit with Kids

Location/Surroundings
Just off the highway, halfway between Yala and Galle. 
Confusing roads due to “Over development”
Well maintained lush garden with variety of rare and stunning trees. 

Reception/Check in/Check out
Smooth and efficient service
Friendly and well-mannered staff, yet bit undertrained
Nice ambiance yet poor selection of music 
No wet towel on reception, just a drink

Rooms/Bathrooms
Spacious, well-planned and well furnished
Adequate amount of bathroom amenities
Can increase number of TV channels available
Do not love the idea of using private vehicles inside the hotel, which may cause problems

Activities and Outdoors 
Can visit bird’s park and feed elephants in the resort
Lot of outdoor activities and space for cricket, basketball etc.

Pool
Nicely maintained pool with kids pool and pictures southern sunset
Can increase number of pool benches, construct a bathroom/Changing room/shower and walking path from accommodation site. 

Restaurant and Food
Cannot comment about the variety as it was very limited occupancy
Quality was satisfactory
Seems there were miscommunications between waiting staff and kitchen
Some cutleries and side plates were not cleaned properly
PLEASE USE CLOTH NAPKINS rather than tissue
Can certainly increase the bread menu
Should mention the friendly restaurant staff that is attentive though they were never trained to work in such a place.

text:
Birds Resort --- Hambantota
No visit to Sri Lanka, nor, life of a domiciled Sri Lankan, would be complete, without a visit to the exquisite beauty of  “Birds Resort” situated in Hambantota, on the Southern Coast of Sri Lanka.
  Recently our family was blessed by God, to be able to visit and stay at this unbelievably gorgeous property. The lush rolling green acres of land, were beautifully landscaped with Giant uncommon trees, sometimes laden with fruit.
  Maintained with great love, and meticulous care, were innumerably species of birds from around the world, with brilliantly coloured feathers and swans of different hues, gliding gracefully in artistically designed ponds. Open “Buggy Cars” take you through winding well concreted roads, for those who prefer not to walk but yet viewing the animals in their giant cages. 
  The inviting, sparkling pool is another enormous and awesome area of absolute serenity, with dozens of spreading shade trees and sunbeds for relaxing swims, or just peaceful contemplation.
  The crunch point was the interior of the Resort Hotel itself, which makes one gasp with admiration, at the stupendous collection of carefully chosen, priceless antiques, typical of southern Sri Lankan culture of glorious bygone ages. The spacious and tastefully laid out dining area with it’s beautiful collection of antique lamps was another fascinating sight.
  A cluster of inviting, well- planned Chalets, cater to every need for privacy or family vacations, being the very epitome of absolute comfort and scrupulous cleanliness.
  Last but Not in any aspect the least, was the warmth, hospitality and efficiency of the dedicated staff, which spoke volumes for their training, to treat every single guest as royalty. Their kindness and interest in our comfort and well being, was par excellence and is something, we will cherish in our memory always.
  May God’s abundant blessings be upon this amazing, Hambantota “Bird Resort”.     

S. Jayawardena
title: Birds Resort --- Hambantota

text:
If you're a bird fanatic or a nature lover, this resort will have to be on your list. 

The rooms are large suites with your vehicle parked right outside your room. The rooms were large and well appointed. 

For entertainment, there was a mini basketball court, swimming pool, and a badminton court.  

The food was served in our stay due to low turnout as a set menu. The food was ok. Nothing special. Even so, when the dish was good and we asked for seconds, we were refused and told to buy of the ala carte, although we paid for buffet pricing. Extremely dissapointed in that aspect. 

The Hambantota Birds Park is right next door with an entrance from the Resortitself. Was a beautiful experience. 

Got to feed the resorts Elephant's, too. Also, there's a range of Harley Davisdon bikes parked in the foyer.
title: Birds. Birds. Birds.

They even took the time to show us around every single room in the villa so that we had all the information we needed. The team also went out of the way to decorate the bar area for our welcome drinks with fairy lights and it looked stunning! We were really touched by all the effort they went to throughout.

The villa itself is absolutely breathtaking, with stunning views of the ocean and beautifully appointed rooms and common areas. The staff were all incredibly friendly and attentive, and they made sure that our every need was taken care of. The food was unbeatable - our favourite was the lamprais! The head chef Nalaka also ensured that our special meal requests were catered for. We really feel like the Villa is a home away from home.

All in all, we can't recommend The Villa Bentota by KK Collection highly enough. If you're looking for a truly magical holiday location or even a wedding experience, look no further. Thank you, Nishanth and team, for making our special day unforgettable and we will certainly be back again soon :)
title: The most beautiful boutique hotel with incredible service

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ms. Jessica,

Thank you for choosing our Hotel and taking the time to share your feedback. We appreciate your interest in Bawa's works and are glad you found our 70s built resort with a 200-year-old structure appealing. We value your suggestions for improvement and will take them into consideration.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused by the cleanliness of the rooms and bathrooms. Maintaining a high standard of cleanliness is of utmost importance to us, and we will address the issue with the moldy shower tiles promptly.

Regarding the presence of bugs, being located in a natural setting, encounters with bugs can occur. However, we strive to minimize their impact and will look into ways to further address this concern.

We are thrilled to hear that our staff, particularly Sandaruwan, Ruwan, and Lakshman, provided you with exceptional service. They will be recognized for their friendliness and helpfulness during your stay.

We appreciate your feedback on the food, particularly the curry crab. We apologize for not meeting your expectations in terms of the crab's size and texture. We will review our culinary offerings to ensure consistent quality and presentation.

We are delighted that you enjoyed the unique experience of the train passing by the resort and the beauty of our grounds. Creating a relaxing and picturesque environment for our guests is a priority for us.

Once again, thank you for sharing your valuable feedback. We hope to welcome you back in the future and provide you with an even more enjoyable experience.

Best Wishes,

Kalpa Nanayakkara
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
roomTip: Room 4 was nice!
text:
We came here because I was interested in Bawa’s works. For a 70s built resort with 200 year old structure, it’s quite good, but I really feel like it could be better. 

The rooms and bathrooms can be cleaner as the shower tiles are very moldy. 

Expect lots of bugs everywhere. 

The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, especially Sandaruwan, my daughter’s favorite and Ruwan who helped us with our food choices. Lakahiman also assisted my toddler. 

The food was okay. We tried the curry crab and while the curry taste was good, the crab was so skinny and soft. It was also strangely watery. I’m not a crab expert but coming from Manila, we also have a lot of seafood so this was a bit strange. 

What I really loved about the place is the train that passes every few minutes right by the resort and before the beach. I felt it made the place very unique. The overall effect and the grounds are also very pretty and relaxing. It’s a great place to chill if you don’t mind bugs.
title: Interesting Resort

roomTip: There is some 4G in spots, but don’t rely on connection. Part of the experience to switch off though!!
text:
I can’t recommend this place enough! I am a solo 26 year old female traveller and Solomon instantly put me at ease after a terrible journey (weather, motion sickness, loss of bank card etc!). Solomon is kind, funny and very wise about all the animals. 
The staff go above and beyond to make you feel at home. I didn’t realise a camping experience could be so luxurious. The tents feel like something from Harry Potter and I fell asleep to the sound of rain. The dinner was excellent and even the wine! I had the best nights sleep in Sri Lanka so far. 
And then there was the safari… no words!!
We saw so many elephants, of different ages, and a big male one too. We also saw crocs, lots of birds including eagles, water buffalo, spotted deer, wild boar. As a vet by profession I was conscious of some safari experiences not being so ethical but we stuck to the dirt tracks and let the animals pass as they pleased, so they were never harassed. I would highly recommend doing the 6am safari to see the most wildlife.
title: Magical!

As someone who’s not been camping much, I wasn’t sure what to expect but was totally blown away by Mahoora. We had an amazing time! The tents are luxurious, spacious with nets to keep all bugs out. The bed was super comfortable and offered all conceivable luxuries to make our stay perfect, including our own well-equipped bathroom. 
The safaris were something I’ll remember for ever - we saw elephants, crocodiles, water buffalo, monkeys, jackals and some of the most colorful birds I’ve ever seen. text: We had a wonderful 3 night stay at Mahoora Tented Safari Camp Udawalawe. The staff were excellent, attentive but not intrusive and they took care of us exceptionally well and always with a happy smile. Breakfast and lunch were served amongst the trees. Dinner was also amongst the trees with a camp fire.  The food was absolutely delicious and the presentation of the meals was fabulous. One certainly won’t go hungry as  there as there was too much food, however too good to leave on the plate and I am sure we left heavier than we arrived. Our tent was spacious and included a lounge room, bedroom and ensuite so we were very comfortable  during our stay. Whilst there is no air conditioning we slept well with the large fans provided. The main reason to stay here is to go on safari in Udawalawe National Park.  We love being out in the bush and seeing what nature will provide, large and small, around each and every corner. We were lucky to have Mr. Solomon as our naturalist on board our exclusive jeep for our 4 safaris. His knowledge is exceptional with a passion for wildlife to match.  We learnt so much from Mr. Solomon, not just about wildlife but about Sri Lanka. Mr. Solomon is also the camp manager so he is a very busy man but never to busy to stop for chat when in camp. A truly memorable stay and we were sad to leave, however we will have the memories forever.  Thank you Mr. Solomon, staff and Mahoora Tented Safari Camp Udawalawe for a wonderful stay.

Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We're delighted to hear that you found our establishment professionally run and very friendly.

We appreciate your understanding of our semi-permanent canvas structures, which provide a unique camping experience without compromising comfort.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused by the minimal lighting. We intend to create a serene atmosphere while minimizing attraction to insects. However, we understand your concerns and will look into improving signage and lighting to enhance safety and convenience for our guests, especially those with limited mobility or eyesight.

Your comments regarding the dark finishes and furnishings in the tent are duly noted, and we will explore options to improve visibility within the accommodations.

placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: A head torch would be a very useful asset. If possible, request a tent close to the entrance and food tent, as they are more accessible.
text:
Very professionally run, and very friendly.
With semi-permanent canvas structures, it looks a bit like a scout camp, without the need to tramp across the field to have a shower or use the toilet.

However, be aware that it gets dark early in Sri Lanka and the lighting is absolutely minimal to get you to your tent. Whilst they give you a wee torch it is very easy to get totally lost on the way to some of the tents and there seems to be no signage. On arrival in the tent do not expect higher levels of lighting as all the finishes except the bedsheets are dark, and the lighting is extremely weak.  It is definitely not a place for those with poor eyesight, and even those with extremely good eyesight could easily crash into the glass-topped table or the dark trunk at the end of the bed. Losing dark coloured clothing or luggage is more or less a given with the dark furnishings and floor coverings and whilst we thought it might be brighter in the morning there was not a great deal of difference due to the opaque dark canvas.
title: Excellent, but not for those of limited mobility or eyesight.

text:
I have somewhat mixed feeling feelings about the whole experience. I still gave 4 stars though because of the people and the service- it felt unfair to give something less..
We arrived at 2pm and went almost straight for the safari. Everyone very accommodating and helpful, our safari was great, we saw beautiful things and, most important, we did not feel rushed at all! The tents are also wonderful, very well protected from insects, and very clean. Dinner (bbq) was mediocre, breakfast was much better. The staff was amazing, extremely helpful and willing to help at all times. We had a small safety incident at night but again the staff was very responsive and came straight away to us even though it was 1 in the morning. The operations manager offered a complimentary night which we could not stay for, or a small discount, to compensate for our sleepless night. To be fair the discount was minimal and we felt that since the gesture was made, it should have been a bit better -especially considering the very high cost of the experience (when compared to every other place we stayed/activity in Sri Lanka)
title: Mixed feelings but a unique experience

Thank you for recommending us as a great break from beach trips. We're honoured to have been part of your Sri Lanka tour and hope to welcome you back for more unforgettable moments!

Warm regards,
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text: This camping site was a lot more charismatic and overall a way better experience than we had hoped for! The tent accommodation was really cosy and had nice products and interior, but the real selling point is the food around the fire. It’s a really unique and delicious dining experience I would recommend to anyone. Well worth doing to break up beach trips! Solomon and the staff were also really friendly and looked after us well
title: Great experience on a Sri Lanka tour

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Archie,

Thank you for sharing your exceptional experience at Mahoora Udawalawe!

We're thrilled that you found our glamping setup unique and cosy, offering the comforts of a double bed, hot en suite shower, and the ambience of the jungle. Being at one with nature while enjoying a safe and luxurious camping environment is precisely what we aim to provide.

Solomon, as you beautifully described him, truly embodies the spirit of our safaris. His expertise, passion, and extensive knowledge make every safari an enlightening and unforgettable journey. It's fantastic that spending time with him allowed you to truly connect with the national park.

We're glad you enjoyed our hearty five-course breakfasts and dinners, creating perfect endings to your safari adventures.

Thank you for highlighting the camping experience in the wild. Embracing this aspect is indeed part of the adventure we offer.

We appreciate your visit and hope to welcome you back for more unforgettable experiences in nature.

Warm regards,
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
We absolutely loved our stay at Mahoora. The camp has created a unique and cosy glamping set up complete with a double bed, en suite shower (hot!) and even lamps and electricity. This is all in the middle of nowhere; whilst you sleep to the sound of the jungle and the occasional elephant roars in the distance! We felt at one with nature, but in a safe and pretty luxe (for camping!) environment. 

The safari - with Solomon (HRH The Prince) - was the highlight of our entire fortnight in Sri Lanka. Solomon is a safari veteran - he knew the national park inside out, from the trees to the birds to the hundreds of elephants. He even has a 20 year archive of research to prove it!  We were lucky enough to spend an entire day with him for both a morning and afternoon safari. He was so passionate about the landscape and sharing his knowledge. We were humbled by the time we spent with him and fell in love with the national park. 

You will not go hungry here. Breakfast is a five course affair, as is dinner. The perfect way to end safari trips under the canopy and at night time by candlelight. 

Despite all the luxuries you are still ultimately camping in the wild - torches needed at night etc. So be prepared to embrace this before booking.
title: At one with nature (safari with Solomon!)

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Отличный тихий спокойный отель в отдалении от всей суеты. Если нужно постоянно куда-то ходить, ездить, бродить, то лучше поискать что-то в городах. Здесь есть вся необходимая инфраструктура для уединения. Огромная береговая линия, большая территория, целый парк для прогулок. Если нужно поесть вне отеля, есть ресторанчики. До города с магазинами ехать 10 минут на тук-туке.
Отлично кормят, разнообразно, обильно, вкусно. Десерты просто бомба, хотя, я не любитель сладкого. Мороженое 4 видов.
Пляж чистый и большой. Рядом другие бухты, поспокойнее, для детей.
Персонал приветливый, реально радеет и старается угодить, максимально внимательный. Номера убирают хорошо. Сервис в номере утром и вечером.
Огромная работа по уходу за территорией. Очень чисто и ухоженно. Много милой живности, гикончики, птички, бурундуки, варанчики.
Минусы.
Собаки на пляже. Они безвредны, но навязчивые. Тянут одежду, обувь, лазают по лежакам. Туристы сами виноваты, потому что подкармливают. Надо что-то с этим делать. Это прям беда.
Сороки. Их много, они каркают.
Для нашей большой компании отель оказался идеальным. Обменивались впечатлениями с другими туристами, видели другие отели. У нас и вкусно, и красиво, и чисто, и заботливо. Мы довольны.
Бар. Коктейли делать не умеют вообще.
title: Отлично для уединенного отдыха

text: Завтра улетаем домой. Спасибо Авани  за прекрасный отдых. Отель очень понравился. Все чисто, красиво, ухоженно. У нас был номер с видом на речку. В номере есть чайник, холодильник, утюг(если кого интересует), тапочки, халаты, в ванной - шампунь, кондмционер, гель для душа, зубные щетки, паста, фумитокс. Единственное - если нужен фен, то берите свой. Зде��ь он ну очень слабенький. Ежедневно ставят 2 бутылки воды. Но если нужно ещё - попросите, всегда дадут. Мы брали завтрак-ужин. Питание своеобразное конечно, но голодными не останетесь. Если ждёте рыбу-мясо-креветки, то это не здесь. За-то фрукты и сладости на высоте! Вечером всегда мороженое. Убираются в номере дважды в день. Не знаю зачем надо так часто, но наверное так надо. Вроде пустяк - фигурки из полотенец, но здесь это какое-то Действо! За 12 дней ни одного повтора. Прям ждали уже - что за зверушка будет ждать нас сегодня? Динеш - ты молодец!  Все улыбаются, здороваются, ручки лодочкой - приятно! Купаться в океане можно, но со стороны Анантары. Там мол гасит волны. А с нашей стороны - для отчаянных, очень крутой вход в море и сильные волны. У отелей общая территория, там тоже можно брать полотенца, пользоваться лежаками, купаться в бассейнах. Там на пляже и воду можно брать в пластиковых бутылках. Если на пляже нет, можно брать у бассейна. Не знаю почему в Авани этого нет. Рядом небольшое кафе Рэд Лобстер. Оно единственное в шаговой доступности, но вкусно, все свежее.  Брали рыбу, креветки, том ям, тунца. Порции нормальные, но к любому блюду дают рис - получается прям ну очень много! До супермаркета далеко, нам сказали минут 20 идти - врут! Или спортсмены длинноногие. По жаре вообще тяжко. На тук-туке 1 доллар туда-обратно. Экскурсии конечно далёкие. Мы ездили на 9-арочный мост (1 день) - 3,5 часа туда, а обратно 4 с небольшим, т.к. пошёл дождь и движение, конечно, замедлилось.  В 4 утра уехали - в 10 вечера вернулись.  Но может это нам показалось тяжко, а некоторые любят попутешествовать. В общем отель очень понравился, спасибо всему персоналу за ваш труд и улыбки!
title: Прекрасный Авани.

text:
Ive spent there 2 weeks, there were some small issues, but the stuff has been really helpful and was open to help.
The ocean beach is not crowded, nice for a small walk.
Food is fine, I liked more breakfast as there were more fruits.
Will recommend this place.
title: Nice hotel, nice location

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Very nice hotel. Beautiful, comfortable and great staff. The pool had an amazing view and the breakfast was great. The manager helped me a lot with retrieving something important to me I forgot at the hotel, after we left. Highly recommend!
title: Great!

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
What a beautiful place to stay, was such a great find. Only has 6 rooms in an old colonial style home right on the beach.
Close enough to everything or just a short tuk tuk ride to other places up and down the coast. Lots of restaurants close by with some great barbecue seafood. The rooms are great with large bathrooms, the staff are excellent and very knowledgeable about where to go and what to do. The food at Coco Tangalla was excellent and unfortunately we only ate there on our last night but it was great.
title: Love Coco Tangalla

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Excellent small hotel, we stayed 5 nights and really enjoyed our stay, our room was lovely and spotless, the breakfast was great as was lunch and dinner, some of the nicest food during our stay in Sri Lanka, all the staff are brilliant and so friendly and helpful, so shout out to them all, the small private beach at the back is stunning although not swim able, we had a great stay.
title: Excellent small hotel

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: This place is amazing!  As soon as we arrived we were made to feel so welcome.  The room we had was beautiful, the decor, the comfortable bed, the bathroom, it was all so nice.  We had dinner in the restaurant, the food is lovely, the breakfast was delicious.  We loved the chilled vibe, either sitting around the pool or on the comfy sofas.  We didn't want to leave and will go back!  Thank you to all of the staff for making us feel so welcome!
title: Beautiful chilled Vibe!

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
A wonderful experIence. The team were flexible, attentive and accommodating. They couldn’t have done more to make sure we were well taken care of and enjoyed our time there.

The food was outstanding, fresh and flavourful.

 Highly recommended. A perfect holiday.
title: An absolute find

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: What a wonderful find. Coco Tangalla  is such a beautiful guest house. The staff go above and beyond to make you feel so welcome, nothing is too much trouble. The food is amazing, we stayed two nights and both meals were delicious. I wouldn’t hesitate in recommending this guest house.
title: Amazing! You won’t be disappointed

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
La maison de mes rêves ! 
Magnifique hôtel décoré avec goût.
Très jolies chambres, soignées, hyper propres, avec des petites fleurs déposées sur le lit chaque jour.
Superbe piscine, propre, avec un accès direct à la plage.
Tout est beau !
Petit déjeuner délicieux.
Personnel aux petits soins.
Nôtre préféré au Sri Lanka 😍
title: Tout simplement magnifique 😍

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
A fabulous small property located by a very beautiful rocky beach. Perfect spot for exploring Tangalle since it is located by the main road. 
The entire villa is really cozy and the plus point is their absolutely incredible staff who were very attentive and helpful. Ambiance is just perfect and intimate. The service we received was great. Food was superb. They prepared an amazing spread with so many delicious dishes which filled us up so well.
Overall a lovely stay at a lovely place!
title: A warm place away from home!

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: We booked 3 rooms for 2 nights in December. The rooms were clean, rustic and comfy. The staff did their best in ensuring comfort. The best part was the beach. It was like 10 steps away ! Loved the stay. Food was delicious. We spent most of our time at the beach. Great for a couple of nights ! The beach is rocky so you cant swim but great for spotting sea creatures. The staff gave us fresh coconut water from the trees. Amazing!
title: Small and cosy beachfront villa

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Very relaxing place.Highly recommend.Reservation team is perfect.T
    hey really assistant top to bottom.
text: Coco Tangalle is an absolute dream for couples celebrating special occasions like anniversaries. The beachfront setting sets the stage for romance, and the rooms are designed with a perfect blend of comfort and elegance. The staff's attention to detail and empathy ensure that every moment feels personalized and cherished. The culinary experience is exceptional, offering a delightful array of dishes to indulge in together. Overall, Coco Tangalle promises an unforgettable anniversary celebration filled with love, relaxation, and beautiful memories.
title: Lovely place ❤️

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for an amazing 8 days here, and didn’t want to leave! Such a relaxing place with the best staff and incredible food!

There are restaurants within walking distance or a 5 minute TukTuk ride away, and we enjoyed exploring the area and visiting the many beaches and wildlife reserves. Paradise beach was a highlight, and Dinuka and team were brilliant at giving us tips and helping arrange drivers etc.
title: A real gem

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Very chilled environment and staff excellent. A fabulous swimming pool and views great.  Food was very good and freshly made.  Would definitely recommend Coco Tangalle and beach is very clean and nice sand
title: Chilled environment and staff excellent

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Ik was de enige gast in het hotel (solo traveller) en ik voelde me bij aankomst hierdoor enigszins opgelaten. Maar dat gevoel verdween al snel, ik werd hartelijk welkom geheten en voelde me heel erg welkom. Het personeel is zeer voorkomend en onder de bezielende leiding van Dinuka heb ik me elk moment welkom gevoeld. Het eten is fantastisch en het zwembad bracht een heerlijke verkoeling op elk moment van de dag. Ik heb ook wat trips ondernomen vanuit het hotel, wat elke keer weer perfect geregeld werd door Dinuka. Ook de massage on site was heerlijk. Kortom, ik heb intens genoten en kan dit hotel bij iedereen aanbevelen, ik hoop er nog eens te komen!
(p.s. als je de keus hebt, boek dan de kamer met het balkon en zeezicht, deze is heel ruim, de andere kamers zijn wat kleiner)
title: Fantastisch hotel met een zeer goede keuken

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Staying at Coco Tangalla works perfectly as an oasis to relax, as well as a base to explore. It has a gorgeous pool facing the Indian Ocean, really helpful and efficient staff, charming rooms with AC, and delicious food which makes you wanna kickback rather than go out for dinner. The position is ideal for trips to watch blue whales, elephant herds and amazing birdlife. I included a surf at Hiriketiya, and a day-trip to Galle. Felt so lucky to stay 5 nights (in Kundhira room), and totally recommend this little gem with its feel-good factor. Hope you love Coco Tangalla too!
title: Perfect spot! A must see and stay!

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The pool is nice but swimming in the rocky sea is difficult.
text:
This was disappointing at first because our room was so small compared to other hotels we had stayed in during our time in Sri Lanka and the facilities were minimum.
However it just got better and better. 
We had opted for half board which is a good idea as there are no restaurants nearby.
Our first meal was freshly caught Tuna, devine, our next grilled fish and chicken and then they impressed us with the most tasty prawns I have EVER eaten and we enjoyed them so much we asked for them again the next night.
There were only four young male staff members doing everything to take care of us and nothing was too much trouble. They served a delicious breakfast as well.
Our stay here was extended as one of our family had to be admitted to the local hospital Coco Tangalle packed us meals to take to our ill sister and made extra rooms available at their inconvenience. I think the English owners name was Jim and he was most obliging. 
Australians and European backpackers loved the local beaches with their Bali style bars and cafes.
title: Didnt want to leave this friendly hotel and the lovely staff.

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: We arrived at Coco Tangalle for a 3 night stay and it completely exceeded our expectations.  We were met by a charming team, who throughout our stay went out of their way to ensure we had everything we needed. We were on a mother daughter trip and had most of the hotel to ourselves, but even if it had been busy the facilities are spacious enough. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated, and the pool was lovely to swim in. the private beach at the end of the garden is spectacular. Without a doubt the best thing about the stay was the food. Every night we ate there we didn’t think it could be better than the night before - but it was! With huge thanks to Dilshan, Isuru and Dinika for making our stay so magical and memorable. We will definitely be back.
title: Wow!

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: We had a lovely stay at Coco Tangalla. The staff are so lovely. The location is epic. We had Lobster one night and crab on the second. We organised a baby sitter for both days. We we were in heaven. Highly recommended
title: Perfection

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: The food is excellent. Probably the best we have had in Sri Lanka, we’ve been here 18 days now and stayed in 7 places so far. The staff are excellent and try very hard to please. You can’t swim in the sea which is within 20 foot of the hotel because of rocks and quite big waves but there is a nice beach ten minutes walk away with restaurants along it.  The pool is good.  The decor in the hotel is extremely nice and the place really does grow on you. The reason for only four stars is that they don’t have a licence for alcohol though seem to have beer and are quite happy for you to bring drink in which they will serve to you. Also there is no coffee or tea in the bedrooms
title: Perfect place to chill out

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: King Coco room was the best!
text: If you can, stay here in this boutique hotel for a few days. You will not be disappointed in any way. We stayed in King Coco room with a fabulous balcony overlooking the ocean. It's so peaceful (once you get used to the roar of the ocean!) and the pool was one of the best ever. The chef produces beautiful dishes  - we were the only guests due to Covid and it was like having your own private villa with a private chef. We will be back.
title: Little bit of heaven

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
This was our second time in this beautiful place in tangalle.  Wow nothing has changed,  the beautiful rooms are  quite spacious and very clean. Located in on the beach of beautiful Tangalle. 
The staff , Dinuka who manages the place does an outstanding job to make our stay an extra special one. He will do anything from finding fresh sea food to advising on things to do and don't and educating us about the life of the sea and nature. While Isuru make sure we are looked after to reach the maximum comfort during our stay. And Dilshan, the man behind the kitchen, Bless his magical hands for the amazing food he makes, practically everything he makes is heavenly delicious.. 
This little heaven in tangalle is a must visit and I will definitely recommend visit for sure. Thank you all for making our stay so memorable. See you all soon. Best of luck till them. Cheers 🍻
title: Awesome in every possible way

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for taking the time to share your "Perfect stay" experience at Taru Villas - Mawella Tangalle. We're absolutely delighted to hear that your time with us was incredible!
We're thrilled that our staff's attentiveness and dedication to service enhanced your stay. Our team takes great pride in going above and beyond to ensure every guest feels special, and your recognition of their efforts means a great deal to us.
Your description of enjoying our beautiful beach in near solitude captures exactly what makes Mawella special – that rare combination of pristine shoreline without the crowds. We're glad you took advantage of our complimentary body boards and enjoyed them daily!
It's wonderful to hear that you appreciated the immaculate condition of your room, our pool facilities, and the variety and quality of our dining options. Our culinary team works passionately to create delicious meals using fresh, local ingredients, and they'll be thrilled to receive your compliments.
Your recommendation of our sunset kayaking tour is particularly appreciated. The wildlife encounters you described – from monkeys and egrets to pelicans and fruit bats – showcase the incredible natural diversity that surrounds our property. We're so happy you had the opportunity to experience this magical side of Tangalle.
Thank you for your glowing recommendation. We hope to welcome you back to Taru Villas - Mawella Tangalle for another perfect stay in the future!
Warm Regards,
The Taru Villas Team
placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Incredible stay!! The staff went above and beyond and were really attentive. The beach was beautiful and we were virtually the only people on it. They had body boards for you to borrow which we used every day. Really lovely cosy hotel. The room was immaculate, the pool was great. The food options for breakfast, lunch and dinner were great and the food was delicious. Couldn’t recommend more. We did the sunset kayaking tour with the hotel and we had the best time if you get a chance definitely do this! We saw monkeys, tonnes of birds from egrets to pelicans and loads of fruit bats.
title: Perfect stay

text:
A wonderful last minute choice! We ended up here because we had to cancel another hotel due to bad weather and didn’t regret this for a minute. 
This was a beautiful and relaxing hotel to stay at with easy access to a very chilled and quiet beach. The hotel also has 2 lovely pools which are very relaxing and offers a nice choice of you don’t feel like going into the sea.

Mr Oshon in particular was very helpful and took particular care of us by calling the kayak centre we hoped to visit to check that it was running tours and also giving us information about the turtle watching. 
We had a wonderful and relaxing two days here and would highly recommend it.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for sharing your delightful experience at Taru Villas Mawella Tangalle. We're pleased that your change of plans led to what became one of the best experiences of your touring holiday.

We're thrilled that you appreciated our small, high-quality hotel setting on our gorgeous beach. It's wonderful that you enjoyed your upgraded room in the historic governor's house, with its plunge pool and sea-facing terrace. The leisurely breakfast service on your private terrace is exactly the kind of relaxed luxury experience we aim to provide.

Your enjoyment of our pool, gardens, and especially the beautiful bay with its fishing boats and palm-fringed backdrop is gratifying. We're glad you took advantage of our body boards to enjoy the waves, even when swimming conditions weren't ideal.

While you chose to dine out at one of the local beach restaurants, we appreciate your confidence that our meals would have been excellent based on your breakfast experience. Your kind words about our attentive yet unobtrusive staff are particularly meaningful to us.

It's truly rewarding to hear that your brief stay became a real highlight of your holiday. Thank you once again for choosing Taru Villas Mawella Tangalle. We hope to welcome you back for a longer stay in the future.

Warm regards,

The Taru Villas Team
placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you can get one of the rooms in the old house....
text:
We only had one night here as part of a touring holiday, but more by luck than planning our plans changed and gave us the best experience in that time.

This is small, high quality hotel on a gorgeous beach. The hotel is a mix of rooms in the old governor's house and more modern blocks. We were given an upgrade to a room in the old house, this was huge complete with a small plunge pool and a terrace looking towards the sea, where we were served a wonderful breakfast in the morning and which we were able to take our time over and do it justice. 

There's a decent pool and an adjacent bar/restaurant. The gardens in front of the pool and terrace have a couple of gates onto the beach, which has to be one of the best on the island, a small, pretty bay with fishing boats, a few beachside/on beach restaurants and small hotels/villas behind palm trees.

Waves were too strong to swim in but the hotel had a rack of body boards and we spent a happy hour with a couple of these.

We chose to eat out, one of the beach restaurants (Cocktails), food was excellent but we've no doubt from the breakfast that any meal in the hotel would be excellent.

Staff were fantastic, attentive without being obtrusive. A real highlight of our holiday.
title: Delightful, quality stay.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for sharing such a heartfelt review of your stay at Taru Villas – Mawella. It is truly wonderful to hear that, among all the lovely places you visited in Sri Lanka, our villa stood out as the highlight of your journey.

Tucked away behind our discreet entrance, Mawella is designed to be a peaceful retreat, blending barefoot luxury with the natural beauty of the coastline. We are delighted that you enjoyed the spacious master bedroom with its private plunge pool and the serene experience of dining on your veranda, accompanied by the sights and sounds of the Indian Ocean.

Our team takes immense pride in offering warm and attentive service, and we will be sure to share your kind words with Donald—he will be thrilled to know he made such a positive impression on your stay.

We appreciate your feedback regarding the Wi-Fi and will continue to explore ways to enhance connectivity while preserving the tranquility of our surroundings. It’s also wonderful to hear that you enjoyed our freshly prepared meals, particularly the tropical fruits at their peak ripeness—our chefs take great care in curating the finest local produce for an authentic and flavorful experience.

While Mawella’s beach is breathtakingly beautiful, we do understand the importance of ocean safety, and we always encourage guests to be mindful of the natural currents. We are grateful that you highlighted this aspect for future travelers.

Thank you once again for your thoughtful review. We hope to welcome you back for another unforgettable stay by the shores of Mawella.

Warm regards,
The Taru Villas Team
placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Our 3 weeks in Sri Lanka has been wonderful. We have stayed in some lovely accommodation - Taru Villas has been the best.

Access is down a track off the main coastal road and then through a quaint doorway. You are then in delightful grounds with grassed areas, pools and a comfortable lounge. We stayed in the stunning spacious master bedroom, complete with plunge pool. At breakfast and in the evenings we enjoyed our meals on our private large veranda 

There were superb views down to the Indian Ocean, we could hear the waves crashing 24 hours a day.

Service was top notch at all times, shout out to Donald who could not have been more helpful or caring.

The amenities were all we needed, but Wi-Fi was not always high speed. The food was well prepared,beautifully served, fresh and hot. We have never had more tasty tropical fruit at the perfect ripeness.Any dietary requirements are catered for.

The ocean is very close, but do beware of the undertow.
title: An idyllic location and hospitality

Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for your beautifully detailed review of Taru Villas Mawella Tangalle. We're delighted that your previous experience with our sister property in Galle led you to discover our retreat here.

Your evocative description of arriving through the antique door to discover our stunning villa on the curving bay captures the sense of discovery we hope all our guests experience. We're pleased you appreciated both the traditional villa style of our main house and the contrasting modern Miami Beach aesthetic of our additional building.

Your detailed observations about our various accommodations, particularly the magnificent master pool suite with its private courtyard jacuzzi and sea views, will be helpful for future guests. The variety of our dining spaces - from the beachy restaurant to the antique table setting - reflects our desire to offer diverse experiences.

We're particularly touched by your appreciation of our staff. Their dedication to ensuring nothing is "too much trouble" is central to our service philosophy.

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The Master Private Pool Room is exquisite.
text:
Having stayed at its sister property in Galle, we knew we were in for a special stay at Mawella. Down a small track, you enter a beautiful garden through an antique door which opens to reveal a stunningly restored villa on a vast, gently curving bay. 

The beauty of the property is obvious from the moment you step through the door. A large open air sitting and dining area with 3 rooms on one side and the magnificent master pool suite on the other with its own private courtyard jacuzzi pool and huge terrace with sea views. This is the best and most exquisite room. 

There is a building next door which houses several more rooms and in contrast to the traditional villa style of the main house, it has more of a modern Miami Beach style.  2 private villas are also within the grounds. There are 2 pools - one garden pool by the private villa and the other closer to the beach. Meals can either be taken in the bright, beachy restaurant or around the huge antique table in the main building. 

As with all Taru Villa properties, the staff are just delightful and nothing is too much trouble. This is an excellent place to relax and drink in the beauty of the setting. Just along the beach are a couple of places to eat but you will have the beach mostly to yourself except from some colourful fishing boats.

A big thank you to all the lovely staff for making our stay so special.
title: A Beautiful Retreat

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed at Hunas Falls Hotel in Kandy — an unforgettable experience from start to finish.

Executive Chef Keerthi was outstanding. He personally ensured we were well taken care of, going the extra mile with custom food recommendations tailored to our taste — especially for vegetarian and Indian cuisine. The Sri Lankan food was authentic and flavorful, and we even tried innovative creations like a pasta dish with a local twist...impressive both in taste and presentation.

The service matched the food. Dhananjay and the ladies on the service team were incredibly cooperative and made us feel right at home. The front desk staff were just as warm and professional...always ready to help.

The chlorine-free swimming pool deserves a special mention. With a depth of 2.5 meters, it felt like swimming in a natural mountain lake — pure, refreshing, and surrounded by nature.

Rooms were clean, cozy, and well-maintained. The property itself is beautifully kept, with scenic walking trails, gardens, and quiet corners that let you breathe. But the real highlight? The view — absolutely mind-blowing. Waking up to waterfalls and mist-covered mountains is something else.

Hunas Falls Hotel is a rare blend of good food, hospitality, and serene luxury in nature. Highly recommended.
title: A Hidden Gem in the Mountains – Good Food, Service & Views

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
We recently stayed at Hunas Falls, and it was such a peaceful and refreshing escape. The property is absolutely beautiful the gardens are well looked after, and the views are nothing short of spectacular. It’s one of those places where you can just sit and take in the scenery for hours.

Our room was spacious and cozy, with a lovely view that made waking up each morning feel extra special.

We went on one of the hikes during our stay, and it was honestly a highlight. The surroundings are stunning, and the trail itself was a great experience peaceful, scenic, and well worth it.

Food wise, there’s room for improvement. It wasn’t bad, and the pricing is reasonable, but the flavors could definitely be better. Hopefully something that gets fine tuned over time.

A big shoutout to Sachith, who was incredibly helpful and friendly throughout our stay. He really went out of his way to assist us, and it’s that kind of service that makes a place memorable.

the road leading to the hotel is narrow, and the last kilometer is quite rough, with a lot of potholes. It’s manageable, but better to go in a vehicle with good ground clearance to avoid any trouble, especially if it’s been raining

All in all, Hunas Falls is a special spot if you’re looking to slow down and reconnect with nature.
title: Peaceful Getaway

text:
This place is amazing with amazing views and facilities. 
Special shoutout to Dileesha for arranging our full stay. Also a mention of Tawar who took to and from the Hunas falls. These 2 and everyone in the hotel made our stay a lovely one. 
The food was amazing as well. Definitely recommended to anyone.
title: Little piece of heaven

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Checkout their library.

Leaches are a common sighting so be careful and come prepared. 

Evenings are rainy mostly in the year.
text:
Hunnas Falls Hotel recently became one of my top 10 best hotels to be when I need a rest. This is ideal for someone who’s looking to truly rest. Away from busy life, away from stress, this piece of heaven is one of the greatest harmonies of nature and luxury.

The welcome was so special with the special Aarathi — we felt truly honoured. The welcome drink was also so unique and delicious.

We stayed in a garden view room and the view was to die for. The room was spacious, clean, and modern while preserving the history. You have to mind that this is an old hotel so some things will show the age. But, it has its own character. Everything was provided in the room: tea, coffee, mini fridge, hair dryer, and toiletries.

Food was good, but I felt some of the items were frozen rather than freshly made. Nonetheless, it was delicious. Dhananjaya made all of our meals feel extra special. He’s so professional, warm-hearted, and knows how to make someone feel truly special. Dinner was candle-lit over looking the lake and I will never forget that night.

I hope the hotel feeds those little kitties and doggies who roam around the hotel premises — they add extra life to the already alive natural atmosphere.

In the morning, we took a stroll around the lake and I highly recommend doing that, because it’s something magical.

We also checked out their library, which was very interesting.

All and all, this was a remarkable visit and we will definitely come back.

The staff did a marvellous job keeping everything clean and organised. Nilmini, Dananjaya, and Dilusha helped us from the moment we arrived, and we thank you for that.

See you soon!
title: Nice getaway from busy life

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Hunas Falls is in a lovely location.  Beautiful view. Ideal climate / weather conditions.

Staff members are very friendly and provided a wonderful service.  The food is great. Rooms are wonderful and well lit.

Ideal property for nature lovers. The Upper Hunas Waterfall is located on the hotel premises. It's a 10-minute hike to the waterfall. Different types of birds are in plenty throughout the day. 

Recommended
title: Wonderful

Overall, we had a fantastic experience at Hunnas Falls.

text:
We had a truly delightful stay at Radisson Colombo. From the moment I arrived, the exceptional service at the reception set the tone for a fantastic visit. The front desk team were warm, welcoming, and incredibly efficient, ensuring a smooth check-in process, and they were generous to upgrade our stay to sea view room. they were always ready with helpful recommendations throughout my stay.

The breathtaking views from the ON14 Rooftop Bar were absolutely mesmerizing — especially during sunset, which painted the sky with stunning colors and created unforgettable evenings. It’s the kind of beauty that keeps calling you back. What made the experience even more special was the exceptional hospitality from Viraj and Anushka. Their genuine warmth and outstanding service made us feel truly valued as a guest/ Customer. 

Morning started on a high note with a fantastic breakfast spread. The variety and quality of the dishes were impressive — from fresh fruits and baked goods to hot local and international options, everything was delicious and well-presented. The attentive staff made sure guests had everything they needed, creating a relaxed and enjoyable atmosphere to begin the day.

A heartfelt thank you to the entire team at Radisson Colombo for making our visit so memorable — I look forward to returning!
title: A Perfect Stay with Stunning Views and Warm Hospitality

text:
Vi boede to nætter på Radisson Colombo i maj 2025 og havde en rigtig god oplevelse. Værelset var dejligt – rent, pænt og komfortabelt indrettet. Servicen på hotellet var generelt i top. Vi blev mødt med en venlig og imødekommende modtagelse i receptionen, og det var en stor hjælp, at vi fik lov til at tjekke ud senere end normalt, da vores fly først gik om aftenen.

Hotellets tagterrasse med pool er virkelig skøn – perfekt til at slappe af med en fantastisk udsigt. Morgenmaden var fremragende med et stort udvalg og høj kvalitet, især frisk frugt og yoghurt var vores favoritter. 

Alt i alt en rigtig positiv oplevelse, og vi vil klart anbefale Radisson Colombo til andre rejsende, der leder efter komfort og god service i Colombo.
title: Gode rene værelser, god morgenmad og god beliggenhed

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Swisstrekkers,

We are delighted that your time with us was so enjoyable; it is our aim with every guest that they have the best possible time with us, however long that might be.  We have also adjusted our menu, and hope that you will be satisfied with the newer version next time you visit!
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Fabulous hotel with fabulous service!  We spent two nights here on our tour of Sri Lanka and had a wonderful time. When we arrived we had been upgraded to a loft room which seemed good, however the bed was upstairs and the toilet was down rather steep stairs which we had concerns about. Prochane the duty manager fully understood this and arranged a different upgrade for us so that we were on one level. We would have been happy with a lower grade room but he went out of his way to honour the upgrade.  Could not fault this. Everything about this hotel was first class from the service, pool, breakfast etc.  It is a delightful oasis in an ideal location in the quirky and charming town of Galle. The only small downside for us was that the evening menu was a bit limited for us and we felt it could have had a few more classic dishes on it.  
We had a brilliant young waiter serving us most of the time, he was cheerful, smiled and had a great sense of humour. Sadly I can't find his his name and he was such a great ambassador for the Galle fort.
Highly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay again.
title: A gem in the old town of Galle

ownerResponse/text:
Good morning Loretta,

We are delighted to learn that you so enjoyed your time with us, even with the noisy stairs!  This is the only real downside of owning a heritage property, and having to stay true to the original designs of the building, but we are looking at ways we can improve this without damaging the heritage aspect.  Hopefully next time you visit, you'll find the stairs a whole lot quieter!
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful renovated building with the absolute best pool.. breakfast and dinner were excellent.  All the staff are lovely helpful and attentive and make the stay more enjoyable. ownerResponse/text:
Dear Cristina,

Thank you so much for your feedback; we are thrilled that you so enjoyed your stay with us!  We are actively working on the bed; like most features of the property, it is an antique, but hopefully we can do what's needed without endangering the authenticity of the structure.

Please do come and stay again soon!
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Great bar on site
text:
We stayed for one night in the admiral suite. The hotel is amazing, staff very professional and courteous. The hotel has 11 rooms only, so all staff are hands on making sure you are comfortable and well looked after.  My favorite part is the courtyard pool which we had it all for ourselves. The food and drinks menus have a good diversity and everything we tried was tasty and thoughtfully prepared. 

The only minus which we had informed the staff about was the bed which was extremely squeaky, that it woke us up several times once one of us would turn sides. Hopefully staff have fixed this issue before next guests come in. Otherwise an amazing hotel and 5 star hospitality.
title: Amazing boutique hotel

placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
A beautiful historic hotel in the centre of galle fort. We had an incredible stay at this hotel and cannot fault anything about our experience. We stayed in the garden suite and have no words to describe! 
We used the pool many times it was great to cool off in especially after a day of sightseeing, it was great and the hotel provided towels so using it numerous times a day was not a problem it is placed in the pretty gardens in the centre of the hotel grounds with immediate access from our amazing suite. There  are sun loungers around the pool should you wish to relax but there was so much to see and do in the area we didn’t have time ! The staff kept all areas clean and were so pleasant and helpful everyone was exceptionally kind. The breakfast was so good with lots of choices.
We cannot recommend this hotel enough and would definitely stay again when visiting Sri Lanka. We particularly liked to sit on the outside area and people watch while enjoying a leisurely drink at the end of the day.
Thank you so much
title: Beautiful historical hotel. Incredible

placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: This was our second visit to this hotel the first being in 2019.  It did not disappoint.  The comfort and service were just as we remembered and the location within the Galle Fort is perfect.  The food was excellent and was the bar with its endless  varieties of Ceylon Arrack.  whilst the bar attracted non residents it is a pity more did not stop to enjoy the food.  The staff were very fair.  When we decided to both order rice and curry for dinner the waiter suggested there would be far to much food and that we order just one and maybe a starter to share.  He was right!
title: A return visit

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Surreytripper,

It was such a pleasure having you to stay, and thank you for your thoughts.  We have passed on your observations to the service team, and hopefully this over-attentiveness will be a thing of the past (whilst still paying close attention to our guests, of course!).  If you are planning to come back, do let us know; we'd love to see you again!
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Spent three nights in the grand apartment suite on a b&b basis but had dinner at the hotel every night.  All food was amazing.  Head waiter was very sweet and helpful explaining the menus but was a bit too attentive, asking if everything was ok 4-5 times every meal which ended up being a bit intrusive when we were trying to relax and enjoy our food.  Trust the chef.  Have faith in the kitchen.  In the unlikely event that there had been any problem with the food we would ask.  We were greeted by the manager when we arrived and check in was a really chilled experience with cooling drinks and a tour of the hotel and our suite.  Would definitely recommend the Galle Fort Hotel and hope to return
title: Beautiful hotel.  An oasis in the fascinating Galle Fort.  Brilliant staff.  Would love to return.

placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed at this gorgeous hotel for a night at the end of our tour round Sri Lanka. 

Our loft room was beautiful, very creaky stairs to the bedroom but part of the charm of this historic building. The pool was so pretty and tranquil, and a lovely treat after walking around Galle in the sun. We had a fantastic evening meal in the restaurant, probably the best of our whole trip, and the individual breakfast was just as good. Lovely cocktails overlooking the street too. 

Friendly helpful team, especially Oshadie in reception - the tin of tea to take home was a nice touch as was the birthday cake when we arrived!
title: Lovely, tranquil historic hotel

placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Hotel grand luxe au centre de la citadelle fortifiée de Galle.
Le patio est juste splendide avec une piscine intérieur chaude et calme.
6 transat pas plus comme on aime.
La vue depuis le hall d’entree est exceptionnelle.
Des gens entrent dans l’hotel juste pour prendre des photos tellement c’est beau.
Je trouve que la realite de la vue est plus belle que les photos.

La chambre familiale en duplex est enorme avec une belle salle de bain.
Le petit dej est top au calme.
Le soir il y a souvent un chanteur qui joue de la musique moderne c’est parfait pour diner ou juste prendre une verre.

L’emplacement est parfait juste a coté des 2 rues les plus animées.
Avec le patio on a le calme et la proximité de l’animation de la rue.
Le personnel est adorable.
On a adoré cet hotel.
title: Hotel grand luxe dans le centre de Galle

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: 53A Galle Road, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81740 Sri Lanka
roomTip: All was great
text:
We stayed in a sea view room at Ubuntu Beach Villas in Mirissa for 5 nights. This is a wonderful hotel with an excellent location situated right on the beach next to the number 1 voted beach bar, Zephyr. On our first night we visited the Seafood Market at the much larger sister hotel, The Lantern Boutique Hotel. We chose our fresh fish and it was cooked to order. The meal was fairly expensive in comparison but to be fair we did pick the mud crab and giant lagoon prawns (the most expensive items in accordance to their weight.) The quality of the meal was superb and well worth the cost, taxes and service charge (which bumped the price up considerably.) Also to our amazement (as we ate under the stars) a large female turtle walked up the beach near to where we were sat and begun digging a nest in the sand to lay her eggs. What a real treat to see with your own eyes. A once in a lifetime experience to see up close and in its natural environment. Needless to say we didn’t visit any turtle sanctuaries. At our hotel we opted for bed and breakfast as there are so many great options to eat near Mirissa beach and of course next door at Zephyr (where the food is also very good.) The breakfast was fantastic, served with fresh fruit and cakes/toast etc. Then you can chose your main breakfast from the 
a la carte menu. We opted for the eggs (cooked as you like) with bacon and sausage. Chefs were super accommodating and it was the best breakfast which set us up for the day. Our server for the 5 days was Malith Pushpa kumara who was attentive and took great care of us during our stay. Room service was equally amazing. Our rooms were made up daily and we received a call each evening to see if we needed anything extra for our room. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. Next time we would book at the Lantern as their sea view rooms have large balconies and at Ubuntu you have a Juliet balcony with sliding doors. The sea is rough so you need to be super careful when taking a dip. The staff had kittens (so to speak when our 12 year old ventured in.) Mirissa beach is a 3 minute drive in a Tuk tuk so no issues with accessing a calmer beach. I hope you enjoy the photos I have shared. Thank you to all the friendly staff at Ubuntu beach villas for making our stay at Marissa a memorable experience. We will be back!
title: Relaxing, warm and friendly staff in a great location to explore Mirissa

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: 53A Galle Road, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81740 Sri Lanka
text: Ubuntu beach villas is a stunning building, beautifully designed, comfortable and spacious. The unspoilt stretch of beach is total paradise. It’s amazingly peaceful and relaxed,  and doesn’t have a hotel feeling. We felt like we were in our own villa with incredible personal service. We barely saw other guests, some days having the entire place to ourselves. The staff were so friendly, genuine and attentive without being over the top. They were very flexible, ordering Tuk Tuks when we needed them, or setting up a table next to the pool one evening as we wanted to eat under the stars! Malaka looked after us 24/7 always with a lovely smile, and nothing was too much to ask. The food was amazing and the menu varied- some dishes being modern an imaginative, others more traditional, and always excellently made with the freshest produce. Our delicious breakfasts were made by Malinda, a chef we couldn’t believe was a young trainee as everything was absolutely perfect. Nuwal kept everything spotlessly clean (the place is literally sparkling) and would go to our room at whatever time suited us best. It’s a quick Tuk Tuk rude into the closest town/ village but we didn’t really want to leave much! The beach is just beautiful and you can walk nearly a kilometre in either direction, seeing just several other people, and feels incredibly safe. The hotel has a few other low key sites tucked away along this stretch (you can walk 100m to the main one to have lunch/dinner/ use facilities if you want more of a restaurant feel). Being there in mid March and having had a a couple of storms, the sea was a bit more rough than normal for this time of year, however, even then you could still swim some days about 100-200 meters along the beach. Anywhere in Sri Lanka you have to be careful due to currents but if you stay close to the shore on a good day you can definitely swim. If you go to visit beaches with shallow waters expect to see lots of other tourists and that it won’t be pristine. The two pools are gorgeous and the perfect temperature. The spa staff are on hand at any time if you want a massage. Nothing bad to say, it’s the perfect place to relax after exploring the rest of the country, and can also be a base to explore the area. We wanted to stay forever!
title: Perfect paradise!

text: Vanaf het moment dat we aankwamen werden we enorm vriendelijk te woord gestaan. We moesten even wachten tot onze kamer gereed was omdat we 2 aparte bedden wilden, en dat was geen probleem. De kamer was super. Schoon en mooi. Ook heerlijke bedden. Het eten van de kaart was echt heel lekker. Bij het buffet is genoeg keus. Ik ben zelf een moeilijke eter dus voor mij was er niet altijd veel, maar dat ligt aan mij zelf. Ook bij het ontbijt is keus genoeg. Het zwembad is ook heerlijk, en schoon water. Medewerkster Pramodya Herath is ook enorm leuk. Ze straalt enorm veel vriendelijkheid uit en is oprecht geïnteresseerd.  We willen je nogmaals bedanken en wensen je al het goeds toe.  Ook hebben we nog even met de baas gepraat, en ook hij, enorm vriendelijk en geïnteresseerd.  Mochten wij weer naar Sri Lanka gaan, komen wij zeker terug bij deze leuke mensen!
