placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Tout était parfait 
Piscine magnifique
Chambre avec climatisation très agréable 
Restauration très bonne et variee 
Le personnel est très agréable et serviable et la responsable pra
Madame Herath très gentille serviable adorable
Merci pour ce séjour
title: Super expérience dans cet hôtel je recommande

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Très belle découverte.
Un petit hôtel en pleine campagne, la forêt juste à côté, c'est le calme absolu.
Une ambiance de sérénité règne dans cet endroit.
Le personnel dès l'accueil donne le ton avec leur gentillesse.
Le point fort de cet hôtel est le repas, pris le soir au bord de la piscine, servi à table par un personnel aux petits soins, le chef Rohan Desmappriya vient à la rencontre de ses hôtes, merci à lui pour ses excellents plats.
Jolie piscine, chambre parfaite, très propre, équipements certainement très récents.
Un hôtel idéal pour se reposer.
title: Un hôtel au calme avec un service parfait

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Sehr schöne Anlage im absoluten nichts. Toller Pool, schöne Zimmer und sehr leckeres Buffet. Auch das Personal ist sehr zuvorkommend.
Man hat von der Terrasse sogar Aussicht auf den Lion Rock. Lediglich nachts stören die jaulenden Hunde.
title: Sehr schön

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: Estuvimos alojados tres noches, la ubicación es perfecta, la piscina inmensa, permite nadar sin problemas, con sensacion de piscina infinita, la comida es magnífica tanto en el bufet como el menú, pero lo mejor es el personal, todos ellos son muy amable y agradables. Completamente recomendable
title: Perfecto para relax

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Prachtig hotel met ruime kamers en groot balkon. Keuze voor lopend buffet, maar je kan ook van de kaart kiezen. Bijvoorbeeld een chicken of beef burger of clubsandwich (2000 roepi is 6 euro) 
Het zwembad is prachtig en wordt goed onderhouden. Het personeel is zeer vriendelijk. Je kan ook voor weinig geld je kleding laten wassen. Echt een aanrader
title: Prachtig hotel

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Wat een aanrader dit hotel, super gastvrij ontvangen met heerlijke kaneel ijsthee. Hotel ziet er schoon en goed onderhouden uit. Wij hadden een nieuwe kamer welke zeer modern en ruim was met een leuk terras/balkon.

Zwembad, buiten gedeelte en restaurant zijn ook zeer goed onderhouden. 

Dan het personeel; wat een fijne mensen! Altijd vrolijk en het team oogt als een gezellig en goed functionerend team. Iedereen spreekt Engels en doet zijn uiterste best. Gastvrouw Pramodya doet er alles aan dat je niks tekort komt.
Het eten is warm, smaakvol en veel keuze wanneer er een buffet staat. Ook a la card heerlijke gerechten gekregen.
title: Uitstekend hotel

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent two nights. We have alagic, and we got personal treatment receiving all the attention needed. Special Thank Promodya Herath ❤️ service is perfect.  Delicious food. nature noises at night, too but not disturbing               

Let's meet again 

Tip
Just speak to Promodya she will help make everything possible
title: If you come to Sri Lanka, please come

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
It was a very nice hotel. We got a good service and ttasty food.
Rooms were clean and food was tasty.
Reception and restaurant staff were very friendly.very helpful.
Dilmini who was in reception was very nice and helped us a lot to find out about the attractions nearby.
Anyway we are hoping to return..only bad thing is no shop nearby.
title: Awesome hotel

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Place was so calm and excellent service with delicious food.
room was amazing and given different experience.
Rooms are clean having all facilities.
Its clean and providing quality amenities.
Nearby activities
Sigiriya rock, Pidurangala, dambulla, Polonnaruwa, Anuradhapura, Minneriya national park and village safari
foods Superb! can select from menu and prepared as per our choice. Delicious breakfast with fresh fruits.
Special thanks goes to Ms.Dilmini who arranged all these services with friendly manner
title: Great Place

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: Tolles Hotel mit Pool und Ausblick auf Sigiriya aus dem obersten Stockwerk. Das Personal ist unglaublich lieb und das Essen wirklich unfassbar lecker. Es gibt eine riesige Auswahl, Frühstück wie Abendessen und die Zimmer sind einfach wunderschön.
title: Hammer

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: Es war einfach nur schön. Tolle Atmosphäre mit super suoper lieben und zuvorkommenden Personal. Alles war total sauber und die Zimmer waren echt toll. Nach Sigiriya sind es nur 15 Minuten und auch andere Attraktionen sind hier ganz in der Nähe. Würden jederzeit wiederkommen:)
title: Entspannend und schön

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of our tour and were delighted with the hotel.
The staff were particularly lovely, especially the gorgeous Pramodya who went out of her way to be welcoming. 
The room was spacious with good a/c and WiFi, the pool was lovely and the food was fine.
title: Wonderful staff

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Hassim provided us a wonderful tour of the historic place. This place dates back to 19th century and has Scottish and British history in it. Hunters club has many animals preserved which were hunted before. Wonderful scenic place. Only 300 LKR for entry fee
title: Historic place you must visit

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
The Hill Club was wonderful.  We last visited in 2003 and were not disappointed on our return.  The staff were delightful and very helpful.  The Sri Lankan breakfast was delicious. 
We appreciated the hot water bottles in our bed as the evenings were chillier. The food was delicious. 
The grounds are beautiful and it's just a short walk to the town.
I really hope we can return again.
title: Nostalgia

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: I had a wonderful visit to The Hill Club in Nuwara Eliya – a charming and historic hotel that beautifully reflects the elegance of the colonial era. The atmosphere, architecture, and surroundings make it feel like stepping back in time. A heartfelt thank you to Sujani and Kasun for their warm hospitality. They took me on an informative tour of the hotel and explained everything with such kindness and humility. Truly grateful for their time and care❤️
title: Incredible experience

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Superbe expérience, Hassim nous a fait un tour des lieux en nous expliquant l’histoire du lieu. Cela fait 30 ans qu’il travaille ici c’était très intéressant.

Cela vaut laisser transporter en Angleterre le temps d’un petit thé. 
En complet décalage avec ce que nous avons vécu jusqu’à présent au Sri Lanka 

On recommande pour une petite pause dans la journée sur Nuwara Elia,
title: So british

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Superbe visite de l’hôtel avec Hassim, très gentil! Endroit hors du temps, on a l’impression d’être en Angleterre, même le temps ( pluie quand nous étions) nous rappel l’Angleterre ! Nous avons pris un petit thé c’est très reposant, et agréable !
title: Visite de l’hôtel avec Hassim

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Hasim was a wonderful host giving us a tour and telling us all about the history. An amazing place not to be missed if you love British history. Drinks and service was amazing and so many fascinating colonial artefacts if you’re into that sort of thing!
title: An historic pearl

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Mr. Hashim very kindly showed us the whole property. It was very interesting to get a glimpse of the different rooms and hear the stories. We will be back tomorrow, to visit the tennis court and throw a match! But for kow, will will enjoy tea and coffee.
title: Day Memebership

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir waren für 2h hier um Tee zu trinken. Mr. Hashim is a very dear and polite Gentleman and gave us a very informative Tour of the Club. 
The Tea was delicious and is definitely worth a visit when staying in Nuwara Eliya. Day Memberships cost 300 Rupies.
title: Day Membership

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Amazing location and Hashim was very approachable and took us through the entire venue. The hospitality provided during the trip was high class. I would go again and sign up as a formal member to this location. As a visitor from Australia seeing the history was amazing
title: Amazing hospitality

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Es como un viaje a otra época pero que te sitúa en como era la elitista sociedad británica en Njwara Eliya. Es muy recomendable hacer la visita guiada, si no te lo pierdes todo. Quizás te impactará la diferencia entre esta época y la actual, e incluso te pueden indignar algunas de sus costumbres, se trata de conocer, y el saber no ocupa lugar. Además el edifico es soberbio. Esta visita forma parte del agradable paseo por la localidad.
title: Conocer otra época

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful property giving colonial vibes.........Special thanks to Sujani for giving us a detailed tour.....Well maintained and manicured lawns............Would definitely like to try and come  stay for a night with family........
title: Review

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: The staff was so friendly and gave us a tour around the place which was very informative. It was an interesting history that the place has. The Sri Lankan food was really good and plentiful . Big portions! We will consider staying here in future.
title: Friendly staff

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a lovely tour of the Hill Club and learnt all about the fascinating history of the Followed by a lovely lunch in the historic dining room 

Staff are incredibly polite & helpful.

The whole experience takes up back to time of the English & Scottish tea planters.
title: Very nice tour of the hotel and grounds understanding the history

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Really interesting tour to view this historical building. Hashim was very knowledgeable and informed us all about the history of this building. Would recommend visiting for the day or even staying the night as it would be a great experience.
title: Great tour of the Hill Club

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Very informative and fascinating would go again with other family members as it shows lots of heritage and historical value to Sri Lanka and you get to learn a lot about the history and about how monarchy from England have come over and the story behind all of it.
title: Great day

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: We had a fantastic visit to the Hill Club in Nuwara Eliya, where our host gave us an insightful and entertaining tour of the rooms. Their knowledge, humor, and warmth made the experience truly special. It was fascinating to see the historic artefacts, from vintage gramophones to classic typewriters, which added to the charm of this beautifully preserved place. The club’s ambiance, rich history, and welcoming atmosphere make it a must-visit for anyone in the area. Highly recommended!
title: Hill Club Tour

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your gracious review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your visit to The Hill Club and appreciated the beauty of the building and garden. It is wonderful to know that Hashim’s informative and efficient tour enhanced your experience, providing you with a deeper understanding of the history of Sri Lanka.
We are grateful for your kind words and pleased that you had a lovely time in this beautiful part of Nuwara Eliya. We look forward to welcoming you again in the future for another memorable experience.

Best regards,
The Hill Club Team
placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: A beautiful building and atmosphere, including the garden, very well maintained. Special thanks to Hashim, he gave us a very efficient and informative tour. A lovely experience, taste of the history of Sri Lanka. Beautiful part of Nuwara Eliya.
title: Guided tour of the Hill Club

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for sharing your kind feedback. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your visit and the opportunity to explore the halls with a guided tour. It is wonderful that you were able to relax and enjoy a refreshing cold beer in our beautiful garden.
Your recommendation means a great deal to us, and we are grateful for your positive comments. We look forward to welcoming you again for another enjoyable experience in the future.

Best regards,
The Hill Club Team
placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Very nice to have a cold Beer. We were given a very nice tour through the halls and afterwards drink a cold beer in the garden. Definitely a place worth to visit. Enjoy a very chilled beer in the garden. Nice beer in the garden very nice beer in the garden.
title: Nice Visit

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughtful review. We are delighted to hear that you had a pleasant experience with us during your honeymoon, and we are pleased that the special touches, such as the towel heart and cake, added to the celebration of this memorable occasion. We are also glad that you enjoyed the beautiful location, gardens, and the added comfort of the hot water bottles during the cooler evening.
We appreciate your understanding regarding our dress code policy, and we apologize for any inconvenience caused by not being prepared for the formal attire requirement in the main dining areas. We always strive to provide clear information to our guests, and we will take steps to ensure that our dress code policies are communicated more effectively in the future.
Thank you again for your feedback. We truly value your patronage, and we hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back for another special visit.

Best regards,
The Hill Club Team
placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed here for one night as part of a tour around Sri Lanka on our honeymoon. Our driver had told them in advance it was our honeymoon so they had a lovely towel heart made on our bed when we arrived, and they delivered us a lovely cake. The location was great, very close to the town, and beautiful gardens. It was a little cooler on the night we stayed and as part of the turn down service they put hot water bottles under the covers! Be aware this is a private members club so you have to wear formal wear (ie jacket, tie and trousers for men) to have dinner in the main restaurant and to use the rooms downstairs in the evening - we hadn't realised this and had not brought that attire so had to eat in a smaller back room in the evening, and were the only ones in there!
title: Lovely building and staff - but bring formal dinner wear!

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for sharing your kind feedback. We are delighted to hear that you appreciated the sense of tradition and the historical charm of our establishment. We are pleased that you enjoyed the formal dinner experience, and we are glad that the provided jackets and ties added a fun touch to your evening. It is wonderful to know that you had the opportunity to enjoy a delicious steak, offering a delightful change from the local curry dishes.
Your thoughtful comments are greatly appreciated, and we look forward to welcoming you again for another memorable visit.

Best regards,
The Hill Club Team
placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: A lovely nod to the past. We like the nice sense of tradition. And the ‘formal dinner’ in the evenings is a nice change of pace. Don’t worry - they have jackets and ties they can lend you. It’s fun! A tasty steak! A nice change from the yummy curry we have had on the trip so far.
title: A nice nod to history.

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed in this fantastic small scale resort for the last two days of our Sri Lanka tour when the Corana crisis started to hit very hard back home. We thought if we should go in quarantine, this the place ! Friendly staff, great food and a view of the grand Indian Ocean.
title: Pocket Paradise

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: This place is a little piece of heaven in Tangalla and is everything you'd wish to find in a hotel.  Lovely bedrooms in a beautiful old house.  The trip was  made all the more special by the helpful, truly hospitable staff led by Dinuka.  A big thank you to Dilshan, Isuru, Sudara, Hemantha and Chandrafala for making out stay so memorable. The food is local and equisite and we were even showed how our meals had been prepared. Could not recommend highly enough.
title: An amazing place

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Try to avoid the one with some road noise .
text: Cannot fault this place except my fried egg on day 5 was not runny.Seriously everything was as advertised and we would emphasis the brilliant location,fabulous sea food and of course all the staff.Many thanks.
title: Coco fantastic.

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Amazing hotel, stuff is so profesional and hospital, first place where I understand how tasty may be Srilanka cuisine. I dream to get back there and again spend even few days. The view from the pool is amazing, rooms are so fancy. The best value you can get for this money.
title: One the best places I've ever been!

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Myself and My Husband visited Coco Tangalle for the 4th time.
We visited for 3 Nights and stayed in King Coco room.
our dates were 21st -24th December and at this time we were the only  guests... People are missing a treat.
From the moment we arrive we are made to feel welcome and nothing is too much trouble.
We arrange through Dinuka (The manager of the property)  for a Private Masseur to come to the property where our  balcony is used... This is so good.
The Food is as good as any Top Restaurant and each day we are consulted on what we would like and how we would like it cooked.
The entire Staff team are what makes this property so welcoming.
Any trips that you care to go on Dinuka will do his best to arrange safely.
A big Thank you to :
Dinuka
Isura
Sudara
Hemintha
Dilshan
Chandrapala
Rasitha
Sirinsadana and Jinaajansa

We will return to Sri Lanka and when we do will go back to Coco Tangalle.
There  wasn't a guest Comment Book available at the time so I suggest this is put in place so that Guests can make their valuable comments.
title: Feels like Home

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Coco Tangalla is villa boutique Hotel on the roadside yet runs to the shore giving an unsparing view of the southern sea of beautiful Sri Lanka. With a hint of medieval Sri Lankan Architecture Famous Geoffrey Bawa’s another example of Tropical Modernism the key of cozy warm villa house. It’s 2 hours drive from Katunayaka Airport. Comfortable bedding and compact room environment gives You a much relaxing and warm feeling. They got six of them the double rooms. Foods provided on ala carte or they do have set menu Lunch, Dinner and Breakfast option where the food quality is at a high standard. There are many sea food options and Sri Lankan specialities. The beach is like private one as no outsiders hanging around, they are cleaner and enjoyable sea bath at your footstep. They got a very friendly, attentive staff who’s got candid attitude is a main factor of making your stay a comfortable and memorable. We will be visiting very soon. All the best with much love.
title: COZY WARMTH STAY

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: This was the second time we returned to Coco, and we will certainly be back again. We had initially booked into another Villa in Tangalle, but decided to check out as we didn’t have a good experience there. We booked last minute at Coco and Dinuka, the Manager and his exceptional team made us feel incredibly at home, beautiful rooms, stunning views of the Indian Ocean, delicious food! The best! Dinuka is really an exceptional Manager- helpful, kind, friendly, knowledgeable of all local attractions and the villa is maintained exceptionally. We will be back again!
title: Excellent as always!

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Very nicely decorated, with a relaxed vibe. Next to a main road, but at night we only heard the waves from the sea close by. 
We had dinner at the hotel one night, which was very good and we were given a bottle of wine on the house which was much appreciated. Breakfast was delicious and portions big. The pool was pleasant and warm. The beach outside the hotel is very picturesque. We went out to see the sunrise, which was gorgeous. 
Service was very friendly and attentive. 
Highly recommended.
title: Lovely boutique hotel

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
We had an amazing
Time here! Staff made the stay, they are really attentive and very kind. Food was up there as some of the best in Sri Lanka. Amenities were fantastic. Worth the money, we consider it a luxury stay with much heart
title: Exceptional

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: The other reviews say it all! You couldn’t find a better place to relax. The staff are absolutely amazing, going out of their way to make your stay as pleasant as possible. The food is absolutely amazing. Highly recommended for a great place to chill out!
title: Wow, great!

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Room overlooking the pool is the one to have with outside seating area and ocean view.
text: What a lovely place to come to relax. Wonderful friendly staff, a lovely pool, and delicious food. What more does one want. Excellent. The sound of the ocean is very relaxing, I would come back anytime.
title: Beautiful house

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Get the room with the Bathtub.
text: The stay at Coco Tangalle was amazing. Clean and neat property - almost a Colonial Heritage House now turned into a Boutique Villa. With amazing views at the Tangalle beach area, the property is beach front. The cuisine is mouthwatering and the staff are very friendly and attentive. They go the extra length always to make the stay memorable.
title: The whole Villa - all to myself!

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed 2 nights and wish we had more.only 1 other staying so it was like having the whole place to ourselves.
Location, is a little walk to the town and shops. A swimmable beach close by within walking distance.
We had a very small room , but it overlooked the pool and surf beach. A staff gave us a lovely surprise after dinner.  
 Very comfortable bed and it looked gorgeous
  Bathroom was big and plenty of hot water.  It too overlooked the pool and surf.
We ate at Coco because the food was excellent. Service with many smiles
 and very happy lovely staff. We felt very privileged staying here. The staff were very attentive and extremely welcoming.
Pool was great.  Very clean and plenty of sunloungers. 2 big day beds on the dining area which again overlooked the pool, gardens and surf.
The gate at the bottom goes directly onto the sandy beach.so picturesque, you could sit and watch the wave crashing into the rocks all day.
Could not recommend this more highly .
title: A little piece of paradise

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed here for a night at the end of our honeymoon and I wish we had stayed for longer. The hotel is beautifully decorated with a lovely pool and views of the seas. We stayed in the King CoCo suite which was amazing, with a spacious balcony overlooking the pool and sea. All of the communal spaces were welcoming and relaxing and the food was the best we had in Sri Lanka. The staff were extremely attentive and catered to our individual needs. I would highly recommend staying here, it seems like a great base to explore if we had had more time.
title: A dreamy hotel

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: King coco is definitely the best room to have.
text:
Coco was by far our best hotel experience in our 3 1/2 weeks in Sri Lanka. To be fair it was also by far the most expensive. It was the perfect end to our holiday and we could not fault the hotel, the service and the food. We often avoid eating at hotels preferring to sample more local restaurants, however because we were the only guests ( sadly due to the aftermath of the bombings), the hotel very generously included our breakfasts and dinners in the price of the room. Perhaps this was a reward for not cancelling our booking which was at the pre Easter higher rate to take advantage of the much discounted rate on offer when we stayed. We really appreciated the gesture and it was the only discount or deal anyone offered during our entire visit. The food was sensational, gorgeous fruit platters and the best egg hoppers we had in Sri Lanka. The curry night and seafood platter were also superb. By far the biggest asset of this hotel is its staff. A selection of fine young men for whom nothing was too much trouble. We hope that the tourism industry soon recovers and Coco Tangalla gets the full occupancy it so deserves. 
If you can, splash out for King Coco room. It is well worth the extra expense.
title: Favourite hotel in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed at this unique luxury hotel for two nights and found the staff to be ever attentive. Rooms are clean, air-conditioned with a fan. Meals here are of the highest quality. Because there are only six rooms this is a very personal establishment. Security is excellent and the entry gate is manned 24hrs. The views from the dining area made our stay special. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the pool. We visited just after the recent Easter Sunday event which has hit SriLanka hard and caused many cancellations. We recommend not cancelling as things are very safe.
title: Just a Perfect Place

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for 4 nights in the garden room overlooking the pool. The room was small but well designed and it did lack some amenities, such as tea-making facilities and basic personal care items (tissues!) but it was very peaceful, listening to the ocean. The rooms at the front of the bungalow are much closer to the (very busy) road so may not suit light sleepers.
The reason this hotel deserves its 5 stars, however, is not due to the accommodation, the pool and garden, or the beach-front location, but the service! The young (all male) team couldn't do enough for us. They cared for the hotel and their guests brilliantly; they really took pride in their jobs! Flower petals and candles on the tables in the restaurant every evening and the "turn-down" service is not to be missed! The chef is superb. On our last evening, we were the only guests staying. The chef cooked us a menu of our choice (fantastic food!) and we were treated like VIPs - all very romantic! 
If you don't wish to eat at the hotel every evening, the staff can make recommendations. They organised a tuk-tuk to take us to the nearby Cactus Lounge - a simple restaurant on the beach which serves excellent seafood.
title: Beautiful boutique hotel with first class service

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful house/rooms, some of the best service from the staff we had our entire trip.  I'd recommend hiring a moped/car so you can explore more of Tangalle and surrounding beaches.  Lovely breakfasts and the pool was fantastic.  Would definitely recommend for couples who like value for money boutique accommodation.  Wouldn't recommend if you are looking for nightlife/lively area!
title: Lovely stay!

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Had the room with the balcony, so lovely to sit out on and see/ listen to the waves
text:
We were only here for 1 night, which was a real shame. Room was so comfortable and the staff couldn't do enough for us. Fantastic breakfast.
No kettle in the room, but on request a pot of tea was brought to our room and served on the balcony. Didn't use the pool but it did look inviting.

Thankyou
title: Not long enough

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Other have described this hotel in detail and we agree with all the good reviews. The location is good and a short walk into Tangalle. Lovely building, lovely pool, lovely room. We would definitely go back and thanks to the wonderful but unobtrusive staff for looking after us. Highly recommended !
title: Gorgeous hotel

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Colonial ambience! Our room was delightful, with a lovely view onto the gardens. Loved the sitting rooms with garden views and an open fire. 
Good variety of food and gorgeous breakfast. Attentive formerly service.
title: Beautiful old buildings in delightful garden

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Best hotel in Nuwara Eliya.. hurry up and plan your next vacation staying at Jetwing St.Andrews’
text:
Well maintained periodic property nestled within the heights of great nature views
Stayed 2 nights at the hotel and enjoyed the excellent food options, the staff are very friendly and go the extra mile to make sure the entire stay is a memorable experience.
Plenty of places in the hotel for a small social gathering or quiet place to read and enjoy the scenery.
title: Memorable

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed half-board at the hotel and enjoyed the excellent food options, the staff are very friendly and go the extra mile to make sure the entire stay is a memorable experience.
It was great to talk to the staff about their knowledge of the local fruits and tourist attractions.
Plenty of places in the hotel for a small social gathering or quiet place to read and enjoy the scenery.
title: Well maintained periodic property nestled within the heights of great nature views

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Make sure to pack a lot of winter-wear if you are from a hot/humid countries.
text: Well, first of all, the hotel crew was very smiling and warm, besides being helpful. The rooms and indoor parts of the hotel were made in very pretty English style design.The food was absolutely scrumptious(especially the chocolate-filled crunchy pastries and Cream of Mushroom Soup.) The whole place is really old and charming surrounded by European-like nature and a rich culture,history and language. Two people who I am sure will remain prominently in my memories are Uncle Arshad and Auntie Gowry, both of them attended my family regularly and made us feel special. The whole trip was really something and I am sure I will never forget the kindness I received.
title: Awesome crew,beautiful European-like scenario. Delightful pastries and incredible hospitality.

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: From the time we entered we were taken care of really well. We had set menus and the food was amazing. The room and the hotel is very clean and the staff is very friendly
title: Will be coming back !!!

roomTip: Bring your own alcohol. If you want very very quiet accommodation this is for you.
text:
This is a 5 bedrooms bungalow accommodation and we were the only guests so a little too quiet for us. Little atmosphere. But excellent service and food was very good and beautifully prepared. Room was clean, comfy bed but no mini bar tv or fridge. Bathroom was big with lovely shower. 
There’s no alcohol license here so we bought wine and beer and stored in kitchen fridge.
title: Extremely quiet peaceful stay. Very small hotel. Excellent service.

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Hotel is located right in the heart of town and easy to get to.
text:
Loved our short stay at St Andrew’s. The staff were all very helpful from time we arrived until we left. Always inquiring about our well being and if our stay was comfortable. Navodya at the front desk as well as the others who were there at check in and check out were helpful and courteous. 
The dinner and breakfast buffets had great Sri Lankan and western options. The cups of tea at breakfast hit the spot! 
Loved the rooms and the beds were very comfortable. Already plan on staying again on our next visit to Nuwara Eliya.

text:
Flew in at midnight and transferred to this hotel for two night stay.
Room on bottom floor fine, clean and comfortable bed.
The beach is not good at all just ok to walk with shoes on.
Pool area lovely with loungers and umbrellas.
Rooms overlooking pool the best, we were at the other end and gardens in desperate need of attention and building up. It’s a forgotten area.
Restaurant had the best breakfast with a lovely selection of food.
Dinner was also nice in the restaurant 
Plenty of areas to sit and spread out.
Staff attentive and not overbearing.
Didn’t see anything around outside of hotel as being on tour it’s go go.
Won’t be returning but recommend this hotel.
title: Nice pool area.

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text: The only reason I am rating this hotel 4 instead of 5 is due to the lack of sun loungers around the stunning pool and gardens.  It's the most magnificent area, with plenty of shade, but during our stay they had moved chairs to allow you to at least sit, but we were there to relax after a week of nonstop sightseeing in Sri Lanka, so sitting upright in a chair was not the plan.  That said, our room was wonderful with a fabulous bathroom and stunning sea view.   The hotel is fresh and modern and from the marvellous welcome at Reception on arrival to the friendly efficient staff in the Restaurant we loved this hotel.  We opted for the Half Board deal and were delighted with the extensive buffet breakfast, with live cooking stations for eggs & hoppers and fresh juices etc.  Dinner was Table Service (which we loved) chosen from a Menu to suit all tastes each night, beautifully presented by excellent Servers.  We really enjoyed the Bar for pre-dinner drinks with its relaxed atmosphere, floor to ceiling windows and sofa with footstools seating facing out to sea.  There is a very nice well maintained gym, restaurants connected to the hotel just opposite and is situated perfectly for sightseeing should you be able to tear yourself away from the pool!
title: Perfect But For Lack of Sun Loungers

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: There are many breathtaking view point and places to visit , ask guidance from the hotel and they will help you to travel.
text:
Our honeymoon at this hotel was an unforgettable experience. It was our first visit, and from the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with warmth and outstanding hospitality. The hotel itself is beautiful, offering plenty of activities and things to do, ensuring we were never bored.

The food was absolutely delicious, and to our delight, they surprised us with a romantic candlelight dinner, making our stay even more special. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, with stunning views that allowed us to relax and enjoy a peaceful, calming environment.

The management and reception team were exceptional, always checking in to ensure we were having a great time. A special mention to the hotel manager, the outstanding reception staff, restaurant team, and especially Mr. Wasantha and Mr. Janaka, the front office manager. They not only provided excellent service but also guided us on the best areas of the hotel to explore. Even during checkout, they took care of our needs and gave us a warm and heartfelt farewell.

Thanks to their dedication, our honeymoon was truly enjoyable, memorable, and beautiful. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a fantastic getaway!
title: Outstanding experience at Hunnas Falls.

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
"An unforgettable experience at Hunnas Falls Hotel! 🌲 🌧️ 🌺 🍀 🌹 🏔️ 

From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with warm hospitality and the friendliest staff. The hotel's scenic beauty is truly mesmerizing, and bathing under the majestic waterfall was an absolute highlight. We spent our days in pure relaxation, immersed in nature’s tranquility. This haven is the perfect escape to recharge your mind and soul. We feel so blessed and lucky to have discovered such an iconic place to experience the true beauty of Sri Lanka. Hunnas Falls Hotel truly exceeded all expectations, and we are proud to see such a gem representing Sri Lanka’s hospitality. Thank you, Hunnas Falls Hotel, for making us feel at home with your exceptional service and for giving us memories we’ll cherish forever. We are proud to be Sri Lankan, thanks to the incredible experience you provided!"
title: An unforgettable experience at Hunnas Falls Hotel! 🌲 🌧️ 🌺 🍀 🌹 🏔️

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The road is narrow so small vehicles would be ideal
text:
I wouldn’t hesitate for a second to recommend this place to anyone—it’s the perfect getaway spot! Not only is it tucked away in the middle of nowhere, far from the hustle of town, but it also offers the perfect blend of nature, luxury, and adventure, all in one package.

I visited this place over the weekend with my colleagues, and the hospitality was outstanding. Mr. Janaka, who handled most of our requests, did a fantastic job ensuring we were comfortable and well taken care of. We originally planned to stay just one night, but honestly, we wished we could have stayed longer.

We arrived just in time for lunch and later went on a bird-watching trek with the help of a local guide. The trek was challenging but exciting, and everyone loved the experience. Dinner was served outdoors by a massive bonfire, where we sang songs under a breathtaking starry sky—truly magical!

As for the food, I’d rate it 6.5/10—a nice mix of Western and Sri Lankan cuisine. Another highlight was the waterfall located just a short walk from the hotel. The cool, refreshing water made for an unforgettable experience.

Though this place is known as a honeymoon destination, I’d say it’s just as perfect for a work getaway. It has everything—adventure, relaxation, and great hospitality. Mr. Janaka and his team were incredibly attentive, making our stay even better.

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a unique and refreshing retreat!
title: A Perfect Blend of Nature, Luxury & Adventure – Highly Recommended!

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text: I really enjoy the stay with my family. Hotel view site is like heaven with endless beautie. Staff is very kind, helpful and clearing. Specialy have to mention the excellent service provided by Nilmini, Suchin & Dilhani. Frount office Manager Mr. Janaka also gave a good sevice to us by looking after our needs to his level best. They gave me a upgrade room with a stunning view of nature. Can have a bath at natural water fall at hotel premises. Meals also at satisfaction level and can enjoy it with lake viwe. placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
My stay at Hunas Falls was truly memorable. The hotel's location is simply breathtaking, surrounded by lush greenery and cascading waterfalls. It's a tranquil escape, perfect for unwinding.  What made my experience exceptional was the staff, especially Vasanth.  He was incredibly attentive, ensuring my dietary needs were perfectly met.  I have specific food requirements, and Vasanth took the time to understand them completely. He worked with the kitchen to create delicious meals tailored to my preferences. This personalized service was outstanding.
Beyond the food, the entire team contributed to my enjoyable stay.  Their warm hospitality and genuine care were evident in every interaction.  They offered helpful recommendations for local attractions and made sure I had everything I needed. The rooms were comfortable and well-maintained, offering stunning views.  The hotel facilities were also excellent, providing opportunities for relaxation and recreation.
Hunas Falls is more than just a hotel; it's an experience.  From the stunning natural beauty to the exceptional service, everything was perfect.  I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a peaceful and rejuvenating getaway.  Thank you, Madhushiks, Vasanth and the entire Hunas Falls team, for making my stay so special. I can't wait to return.
title: Hunas falls

text:
Splendid location with amazing staff. An excellent location for a couple to enjoy peace relaxation and tranquility while enjoying the lake view. The meals were excellent with an authentic taste. 
There are many activities to partake while you are at the hotel. 

I was truly moved by the hospitality provided by the staff members. A special word of acknowledgment to Mr. Janaka the FO Manager for organizing and providing us with a fabulous experience.

Be sure to visit the Hunas Falls which is at a walking distance from the hotel. 

The unique way of dining outdoors at the garden during dinner alongside a bonfire was another wonderful experience we gained at the hotel. 

If anyone plans on a luxurious vacation where you could enjoy privacy and relaxation, this is the location.
title: Most wonderful Vacation

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text: Hunas Falls Hotel is a perfect getaway for nature lovers seeking peace and relaxation. The breathtaking scenery, with lush greenery and stunning waterfalls, creates a truly magical atmosphere. The rooms are spacious, well-maintained, and offer spectacular views of the surrounding hills. The staff is incredibly hospitable, always ensuring a comfortable stay with their warm and attentive service. The food at the restaurant was delicious, with a good variety of options to choose from. The hotel also offers great outdoor activities like hiking and nature walks, making it an ideal place for a refreshing retreat. Highly recommended for anyone looking to unwind in a serene and picturesque setting!
title: A Peaceful and Beautiful Place

placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bring your bathing suit - the pool was a nice respite from the heat and hustle of the streets.
text: Beautiful classic hotel in the heart of the fort area.  Perfect location to explore and experience all that the fort area has to offer.  We had the library room which is very large and comfortable.  Air conditioning good, lots of space to relax, and right off the courtyard.  The bathroom shower is also large, and down a few steps.  As we are seniors, would have liked a grab bar in the shower and maybe a night light for the middle of the night forays.  We had breakfasts and one lunch while there - all excellent. Best of all was the staff — they couldn’t have been any nicer or more accommodating.  A special shout out and thank you to Kalpani for her warmth, friendliness, help, and professionalism.
title: Great location and great staff in historic hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear StreetMeet,

We are so thrilled that you so enjoyed your stay with us, and enjoyed everything that Galle Fort Hotel is and offers.  You will be pleased to hear that we are reworking our menus as I type, and hope to have new menus available soon, providing a greater variety to suit all palates.  Do come and stay again!
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Lovely hotel in the middle of the historic Galle Old Fort (great to explore the sights) with a special atmosphere that combines the old and the modern. The rooms, arranged around an inner courtyard with a pool, are comfortable, spacious and clean. Staff is very friendly and helpful. 

Do not miss out on the arrack tasting because the hotel houses a special arrack bar which also prepares amazing cocktails. The terrace outside the bar is the place to be in the evening, enjoying the tasty food and a couple of drinks. In comparison to the dinner experience, the breakfast seems a bit bland though.
title: Great experience in a hotel steeped in history

ownerResponse/text:

In the meantime, we've shared your praise with Indika and the team, and hope you will return to indulge with us again in the near future.
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Absolutely perfect place to get dinner with the best cocktail experience in the Galle  fort. The hotel has over fifty cocktails which made by local arrack recipes and Ropewalk is the Signature cocktail .

Staff are very polite and helpful. Specially I would like to thanks Mr. Indika who take care of us and provided best hospitality dinning experience. It was Amazing and remarkable experience. 
Thanks you very much Mr. Indika and team.

ownerResponse/text:

Your observations regarding a more relaxed lounge area have been taken on board, and we are going to see what we can do.  However, for some of the other tasks, like the floors, we do need to wait for a lull in business levels generally, so that we are not disrupting guests as far as possible.
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Very historic building, rooms are comfortable but not luxurious.  Good food and great bar (although we are not drinkers). The best aspect are the staff, very very friendly and nothing is too much trouble. My wife did the cooking demonstration with Roshan (head  chef and great bloke) and had a wonderful time going to the markets and learning to cook great curries. The hotel needs a lounge area with somewhere comfortable to sit, chat and have a drink, perhaps the area behind the bar and the rear veranda. Needs to pay attention to maintenance to remain on top form
title: Great staff but in danger of slipping in its reputation

text: Our family of 4 (2 young kids) enjoyed our stay at the beautiful Galle Fort Hotel. Great service in bar and delicious non-alcoholic lemonade type drink (forgot the name but get it!). We had to check out before breakfast started so they arranged boxed breakfasts for us to take in car to airport. Highly recommend!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Jaaade,

Thank you so much for staying with us; it was a delight to have you, and for sharing your thoughts on your time here.  We love a challenge, so catering for your vegan requirements was a pleasure.

Happy birthday, again, and see you in 12 months for the next one!
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for 4 nights in the hotel. We absolutely loved everything from this stay.

The room keeps its original heritage charm, the cleaning is exceptional and the common areas like the pool and courtyard, feel like you are in your own oasis.

A huge shout out to the Chef and culinary team, who went above and beyond to prepare plenty of delicious vegan food for me (including a bday cake) and spoiled my stay with coconut roti :)

The Ropewalk bar is also one of our favorites in Galle, and we will definitely miss breakfast on the terrace with the peaceful view of the pool or the streets.

Thank you to the entire team who was helpful, polite and caring. You made this stay super special!
title: Charming Heritage stay in Galle

ownerResponse/text:
Good morning Sarah,

Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at The Galle Fort Hotel.  We are so sorry to read that you disliked the bed in the Admiral Cheng Ho suite; it is an antique, and clearly we need to invest some more attention in restoring it to its former comfort, so thank you for letting us know.  With regards to the noise from the rooms upstairs, we do ask guests to be mindful, as with a heritage building, there are limitations to what we can do structurally.  Again, however, thank you for letting us know; we will see if there is a way we can insulate the floor of the room to muffle sound filtering through to the rooms below.

That aside, we are thrilled that the food and service met your expectations, and will share your words with the team.  Hopefully you will visit Sri Lanka again some day soon.
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid the Admiral Cheng Ho suite if you want to be able to sleep! Good restaurants No 39 and The Bungalow.
text: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of our holiday in Sri Lanka.  This is a beautiful hotel and we enjoyed our stay, excellent food & service and enjoyed being in the heart of Galle Fort. However, we stayed in the Admiral Cheng Ho suite and I have to say it has the most uncomfortable, noisy, creaky bed we have ever slept in!  3 nights of terrible sleep, even though I moved to the other bed on the mezzanine floor of the suite.  Also a lot of noise from the room above. .. with people clomping around at all hours.
title: Lovely hotel... but absolutely terrible bed!

ownerResponse/text:

Thank you so much for celebrating your special day with us, and for the review that followed.  We are absolutely thrilled to hear that you were delighted with your experience, because every day should be celebrated, but birthdays even more so!  Please come and visit us again soon, if you can!
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: What a joyful visit for a large family special birthday celebration lunch. From the moment we arrived we were made so welcome. The extensive regional menu choices provided tantalising choices for all palates. I opted for the Southern coast and Hills. At a guess, I would say that consisted of eight different dishes all delicately spiced and delicious. I opted for a no alcohol based cocktail which was perfect for me and enabled me to share with others and taste some of the alternatives. Verdict - we thoroughly enjoyed our visit for a special occasion lunch at the Galle Fort Hotel and were literally blown away by our lunch and the welcome. We can wholeheartedly recommend and will hopefully return and arrange a stay.
title: Special lunch in historic Galle Fort Hotel

ownerResponse/text:

Thank you so much for staying with us, and for trying everything we had to offer; we are delighted that you so enjoyed your time with us!  Hopefully this won't be your last visit.
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Another single night stay on our tree-week tour, another location we wish we could have had longer!

What a beautiful little gem in the heart of the fort, all of the staff were very attentive and friendly.  We ended up having dinner somewhere else in the fort but came back for dessert and a dessert cocktail.  the cocktail bar here is something else, two pages of bespoke inventive cocktails, we tried most of them between us in the two days and one night we were here ;)

We had breakfast and lunch here before checking out and all of the food was delicious and fresh, I had the prawn curry with bread and it was amazing.

The fort itself is very interesting to walk around and offers great views back into the main city and out to sea.
title: Luxury in the Fort.

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: We went to ropewalk restaurant for dinner and it was the best decision. Their menu had many great options whether it be healthy eating or something on the indulgence side as well. We went ahead with their pepper tofu salad and the chicken cabinet. The dishes were enough for 2 people and they served us with an entree as well. Unfortunately, I couldn’t take any pictures of the other dishes. Their service was really good and Thilini was a great waitress. The atmosphere was great and they have live music which was cherry in top. Definitely recommended this place.
title: Best dinner in the heart of Galle Fort

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,
Thank you for taking the time to share your wonderful experience at Taru Villas Mawella Tangalle. We're thrilled to hear that your 4-night stay with us in August 2024 was such a great experience and a perfect start to your first Sri Lankan trip.
We're delighted that you appreciated the quiet and peaceful atmosphere of our location, as well as the beauty of our beach. Creating a tranquil environment for our guests is one of our primary goals.
Your kind words about our staff, particularly Gihan, our villa manager, are truly heartwarming. We take great pride in our team's professionalism, politeness, and kindness, and we're glad that their patience and willingness to help enhanced your stay.
We're pleased to hear that you found your room in the 'social' area to be spacious, well-equipped, and spotlessly clean. Maintaining high standards of cleanliness throughout our property is a top priority for us.
It's particularly gratifying to know that our food was the standout factor for you. Our culinary team will be delighted to hear that you enjoyed every meal, from the beautifully presented dinners to the impressive breakfasts. Your praise for our Eggs Benedict as "probably amongst the best we have ever had" is especially rewarding.
We're honored that you found our service, staff, and restaurant to be unmatched during your Sri Lankan trip. Your high recommendation and hope to return are the ultimate compliments.
Thank you once again for choosing Taru Villas Mawella Tangalle. We look forward to welcoming you back for another great experience in the future.
Warm regards,
The Taru Villas Team
placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed at Taru Villas Tangalle at the end of August 2024, for 4 nights. This quiet, peaceful location, on a beautiful beach, was the start of our first trip to Sri Lanka. The staff were professional, polite and extremely kind - Gihan our villa manager, answered our constant questions very patiently! Nothing was too much trouble, the room we had in the ‘social’ area was large, well equipped and spotlessly clean, as was the whole hotel. However, the food was the stand out factor for us, we couldn’t fault it at all. We ate there each night, each course beautifully presented and of a very high standard. The breakfasts were equally impressive, eggs Benedict probably amongst the best we have ever had. We moved on to 4 other places on our trip and honestly nothing compared to the service, staff and restaurant at Taru Villas. We would highly recommend this destination and hope to return one day.
title: A great experience

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your glowing review and for choosing Taru Villas Mawella for your recent getaway. We are delighted to hear that you had an amazing experience and that our property exceeded your expectations.

It's wonderful to know that you found everything immaculate and enjoyed our beautiful beachfront location. We take great pride in offering a secluded and peaceful environment while still being conveniently close to Hiriketiya Beach for those looking to explore further.

We greatly appreciate your kind words regarding Gihan and our team. Providing exceptional service and creating memorable experiences for our guests is our top priority, and we're thrilled that their efforts made a positive impact on your stay.

Thank you once again for your generous feedback. We look forward to welcoming you back to Taru Villas Mawella for another unforgettable stay.

The Taru Villas Mawella Team

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at the Kurumba house which was perfect for our family of 4. We loved the large and spacious patio, huge lawn and privacy from the rest of the estate. Having a butler was also very convenient. The Kurumba House is perfect for families or for two couples, a point to note is that the rooms are not interconnecting however that wasn’t an issue for us. The rooms and interiors in general are very lovely and well appointed. Mawella beach in front is spectacular, not a surfing beach, but the kids had plenty of fun body boarding and there are free boards on site. 
Food is excellent, breakfast especially was of a high standard. Cocktails were well made. They can also organise tuktuk visits to nearby sights like the Hiriketiya beach or blowhole. 
A few points that would make this place better 
1) food prices are on the high side for the kids menu. For eg a margarita kids pizza cost more than the regular pizza
2) the Sri Lankan food was a tad repetitive due to the accompanying vegetable sides being constant. Maybe this is a feature of the cuisine but more variety would be nice 
3) proactive suggestions from staff regarding best times to visit places would be helpful. For eg: we visited the blowhole and the staff helped organise transport but unfortunately we didn’t know that the timing of our visit coincided with low tide, and hence we couldn’t really enjoy the spectacle at all. These small touches from staff would go the extra mile in making this place even better
title: Highly recommended

ownerResponse/text:
Уважаемый гость,

Благодарим вас за ваш подробный отзыв! Мы рады, что ваше пребывание в нашей вилле Kurumba оказалось для вас таким приятным и запоминающимся.

Мы рады, что вам понравился наш прекрасный пляж и обширные участки виллы. Мы стараемся поддерживать их в идеальном состоянии, чтобы наши гости могли наслаждаться красотой природы и комфортом отдыха.

Ваше описание номеров и территории виллы очень ценно для нас. Мы стремимся к тому, чтобы наши гости чувствовали себя комфортно и расслабленно, наслаждаясь каждой минутой пребывания.

Отлично, что вам понравился наш бассейн и что вы могли насладиться его теплой и прозрачной водой в уютном дворике. Мы всегда рады предоставить нашим гостям возможность расслабиться и охладиться в нашем чистом и комфортном бассейне.

Мы благодарим вас за выбор нашей виллы Kurumba для вашего отдыха, и мы надеемся видеть вас снова в ближайшем будущем!

С наилучшими пожеланиями,

Отдел маркетинга Taru Villas
placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Отлично в феврале. Пара маек, шорты и шлепанцы. Средство от москитов и после укусов (это Азия!)
text:
Все просто роскошно. Во-первых, роскошный пляж. Чистый, широкий с минимальным количеством людей. Если вы увидите на всей его протяженности (где-то 2-2,5 км) человек 15-20, то это будет вау. Там обычно никого нет, при этом нет ощущения опасности, просто обалденный пляж. Песочек мягкий, нет камней ни на нем, ни в воде. Сама вода прозрачная, чистая. Никаких живностей там тоже нет. На самом пляже пара кафе, можно перекусить морепродуктами, выпить сок. По пляжу очень приятно гулять, особенно перед закатом, Шри Ланка так устроена, что там ходить пешком особенно негде, поэтому возможность пройтись туда и обратно между океаном и зеленью, наслаждаясь невероятными пейзажами -  огромная радость, когда в Европе еще серая зима. Вода в феврале теплая, но плавать не получится, это океан, только прыгать в волнах. У виллы есть свои лежаки, которые каждое утро выставляют на пляж. Во-вторых, роскошная территория виллы. Она стоит отдельно от остального отеля, на территории отеля, но только у этой виллы есть своя территория, никто не приходит. Между домом и калиткой к океану огромный ухоженный газон. Каждое утро садовники его чистят, а вечером он симпатично подсвечивается. Есть и большая беседка в тени огромного дерева, пили там чай регулярно. Территория очень хорошо продумана, есть гамак, лежаки, большой мягкий топчан, шезлонги. При этом большая часть в тени, не чувствуется изнуряющая дневная жара.  В-третьих, роскошная вилла. Дом оформлен с большим вкусом, обе спальни (они раздельные, соединяются через веранду) стильные, с большим двуспальными кроватями. Отличное мягкое белье и подушки. Убираются очень чисто, все свежее. Приятно было, что много мест для хранения. Хотя на Шри Ланке не нужно больше 3 сарафанов и тапочек, все равно все аккуратно разложить удобно. Есть, конечно, кондиционеры, мы старались не включать, но ночью было душно и приходилось. С выдумкой сделана ванная, не привычно, но очень интересно. Вся сантехника новая, все очень и очень достойно. Но жемчужина дома – это веранда. Она огромная, обставленная со вкусом хорошей разнообразной мебелью, а какой с нее вид на двор и океан😊 Там же накрывают еду, ее приносят, ходить никуда не надо, все это очень удобно и красиво. Меню есть постоянное, есть блюда переменные. Я не берусь судить качество еды в ресторане, просто потому что мы в Москве действительно избалованы очень хорошими ресторанами. Не будет справедливым писать, что готовят не вкусно, просто надо посмотреть вокруг, как живут люди на Шри Ланке, а также представить себе, что говяжьи щечки не приготовят здесь, как в Лионе, как минимум, потому что это совсем не их кухня. Все, что готовят традиционное – салаты, суп лакса, карри – это все вкусно очень. Также произвели хорошее впечатление паста с морепродуктами и десерт брауни. Цены в ресторане как в Тоскане, хотя на пляже все стоит в разы дешевле, но мы все же предпочитали есть в отеле, так как очень красивая подача на хорошей посуде и все это на своей веранде. Да, сильно дороже, чем вокруг, но по удовлетворенности от еды, не сравнить. Хорошая коктейльная карта и приятное мороженное. Из описания отеля я не поняла, но по факту за Вами закрепляется сотрудник отеля, в нашем случае это была необыкновенная дама, довольно хорошо говорящая по-английски. Она ухаживала за нами, убиралась, организовывала еду…. В общем, респект максимальный отелю за такой персонал. А даме огромный привет, скучаем, что никто нам так дома не помогает😊 Сервис отменный!  В-четвертных, роскошный бассейн на заднем дворе. Да, свой собственный, чистый, теплый в уютном дворике с лежаками.  Метров 9 в длину, вода прозрачная, сущее наслаждение там купаться вечером. 
В общем, это огромный успех, что для каникул мы выбрали этот отель и именно виллу Kurumba. Шикарный отдых в феврале, благодаря прекрасному климату Шри Ланки и роскошному отелю. Он без сомнения стоит своих денег. 
PS от аэропорта 3 часа, удобно до Мириссы (1 ч), там киты и черепахи, также час в другую сторону до bird watching (максимально рекомендую).
Москитов не заметно, но кто-то ноги покусал, чесались. Лучше с собой захватить.
title: Kurumba house

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked Taru Villas Mawella based on a recommendation from someone on Instagram ... and it was the Most Amazing Holiday Experience we've had

Getting there is easy and fast, about 3 hrs via expressway from Colombo Airport

The rooms are beautifully appointed (we had the Master Bedroom and Sea View Room - two doubles). The Sea View room is a little small, but we spent minimum time in the room - so that was perfectly OK! (we'd obviously recommend these rooms, as the direct views and access to the beach is a huge plus).

The location is great - the beach is clean and uncrowded. We went in Aug which is off-season, the sea right in front was choppy -  but just one minute away is a gentle and flat slope of beach, wonderful for just hanging around. There were enough folks trying body-surfing, swimming etc - seemed fine (although we did not try all that!).

The food is AMAZING ... Chef Dileep and his team turned out marvels for every meal! From Sri Lankan delights (obviously) to 'Western' food - it was all "cordon bleu" standard! One of us was a vegetarian - but that was no problem at all for the kitchen team!

The service was equally fabulous! From manager Gihan to the staff of Donald, Sujeeva and others, they did everything to please. We asked for many different things, but nothing fazed them - they said "yes" to it all, with genuine hospitality and smiles.

The most wonderful thing about Taru Villas is that it is not anything like a "hotel" stay experience - it is like staying at a friend's house, with everything big and small taken care of with taste, warmth and quality.

Would recommend it strongly!!!
title: The Most Amazing Holiday Experience

The food was delicious, and chef Dilip went out of his way to make dishes that weren’t on the menu to make us happy. 
The service was excellent, and I have to make a special mention of Donald whose service is nothing short of fantastic. 

The ocean, although it is off-season, was perfectly swimmable. 
The place has been maintained really well and the housekeeping team did a good job, keeping things clean and tidy. 
I can see us returning to Mawella again and again.
title: Blissfully relaxing stay

text: A luxury property catering for a restful stay. Walk through its restful grounds, then through the gate onto a pristine curving sandy beach populated only by a few local colourful fishing boats. Excellent food, impeccable service, attentive and professional staff. The cleanliness and tidiness of the whole place was remarkable.

roomTip: Cheaper rooms lack prevented outside space
text: Right on a beautiful uncrowded beach with lovely sand - quite big waves while we were there and beach swimming was not for the faint hearted.  The gardens were nice and beautifully kept.  There were plenty of staff around who were all very smiley and attentive.  Ice water appeared beside your sun lounger without being requested and was refilled without request.  It’s an attractive building with a nice main sitting area and large dining table.  You could eat wherever you wanted, including the more modernist property Tangalle Social next door.  The food appeared to come from the same shared kitchen and was not particularly special and the menu was a bit  limited. Overall a very nice place to stay with a good feel.  I would go back there again.
title: Three nights as part of a round trip of Sri lanka

text:
The hotel was nice and situated in a quiet area, approximately 25 minutes from the city center. It is easily accessible by Tuk Tuk, with a fare of less than 2 euros or 600 SLR.

The staff demonstrated professionalism and were attentive to our needs. We encountered a few issues with our reservation, but these were resolved promptly and efficiently.

I would like to express my gratitude to Chamod, Lia, Samith, Kalana, Channa, PaSindu, Amanda, Channa, Chanad, and all the reception staff, as well as the team at the entrance who assisted with transporting our luggage to the room.

There were a few minor areas for improvement, such as a broken hand shower (which did not cause significant inconvenience) and gym equipment that was somewhat outdated and limited in variety.
title: A weekend in Colombo

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for sharing your heartfelt experience. We are truly sorry to hear about the challenges you faced during your stay and sincerely hope your wife is recovering well. It means a lot to us that our team was able to support you during such a difficult time.

Your kind words about Trevor and Chamod have been shared with our management team, and we truly appreciate your recognition of their dedication and compassion. We are incredibly proud of their commitment to both professionalism and genuine care for our guests.

We sincerely hope to welcome you back under happier circumstances in the future. Wishing you and your family good health and all the best.

Warm regards,
Bhanuka Samarakoon
Room Division Manager
Radisson Colombo
placeInfo/address: No 36-38 Clifford Place, Colombo 00400 Sri Lanka
text:
Chamod, and Trevor.

My wife got dengue fever, and was hospitalised drying our stay. Mister Trevor personally intervened and provided me assistance, witch was needed, since i was travelling with 8 month old baby.
Kitchen staff, especially the trainees were allways there to prepare small special dishes, so my baby could eat(be advised that baby food like meat and vegetables puree are not available in sri lanka, and restourant food is too spicy and salty for babies under 1 year).
Chamond and Trevor got out their way to assist me with everything i neded while i was alone, taking care of baby and sick wife.
I was sick before my wife, and she got sick when i got better, and Mister Trevor and Chamond made my stay as pleasant as humanly possible in those condition.

Mister Trevor especially took atleast one hour of his time each day to sit with me, talk to me, and help me with daily tasks i had, and i dont know if i would managed everything as good as i did if i didn't had assistance.

As someone who worked in service industry at one point of my career, amd with 10 years of experience as an manager in retail, and with my position in Ministry of Culture in Croatia, as  senior geographic information system analyst, i can honestly advise you that those two employees have a great potential to be of use to Radisson group, and i sincerely hope that this review will impact in some way their future, or atleast their paycheck.
I left Sri Lanka with no money (hospital bill took everything from me sadly) but if i had an opportunity, i would handsomely tipped them for their service. I had feeling that they was there not just as ranking officials of Radisson hotel, but as a good human beings, and you dont get that combination of professionalism and humanity in one person.

Sincerely,

Simović Mladen.
title: Sickation

text:
Super hôtel je recommande vivement !! Les chambres sont spacieuses et très propres. Le personnel est hyper attentionné et professionnel. Il n’y avait pas grand monde quand nous y sommes allé nous avons donc eux droit aux transats et aux 2 piscines juste pour nous !! Seul bémol la mer bougé trop nous n’avons pas pu nous baigner mais les piscines étaient super chaude ! L’hôtel est bien placé à 5min de la plage de Mirissa en tuktuk. 
Un grand merci à Lakmal qui a était génial nous avions l’avion dans la nuit et avions pu rester à l’hôtel la journée après le check out et nous avons eu droit à une surprise de voir les bébés tortues relâché dans la mer c’était extraordinaire !! Encore un grand merci à toute l’équipe et Lakmal !! 😃

placeInfo/address: 53A Galle Road, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81740 Sri Lanka
text: Our stay at Ubuntu Beach Villas in Mirissa was simply exceptional! Manager Lakmal and his team, especially Namal and Malith, made our experience truly special. Our party was made up of a total of 13 adults and 2 kids and Namal and Malith effortlessly ensured that all of us had a fantastic stay! The hospitality, direct beach access, amazing breakfast, and the outstanding BBQ we booked were highlights of our stay. The villas are a perfect blend of comfort and tranquility. If you're looking for a memorable retreat in Mirissa, Ubuntu Beach Villas is the place to be! Highly recommended.
title: Unforgettable Stay at Ubuntu Beach Villas!

placeInfo/address: 53A Galle Road, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81740 Sri Lanka
text:
We had an amazing experience at Ubuntu villa by reveal - it was beautiful, very well managed and the hospitality team was fabulous. Took great care of us from beginning to end. Lakmal the property manager was always available and friendly and helpful. His staff - malith, takshila and the cleaning team were all amazing and made the kids also feel at home. 

The place is very kids friendly and being on the beach makes its fun and accessible. 

Would recommend for any family, large group etc

Food was also fabulous
title: Dream holiday - Ubuntu villas

placeInfo/address: 53A Galle Road, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81740 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Excellent beach bar / restaurant next door (Zephyr) and the walk up to Lantern (main hotel / restaurant / is lovely - as is the bar..!)
text:
Pros:

- Really beautiful space and good facilities / rooms. Pool is lovely and you’re literally on the beachfront which is very cool. 

- Location itself is actually pretty perfect in as much as you’re still a cheap, 5 minute tuktuk down to all the bars and restaurants of Mirissa Beach, but far enough away that it still does feel private, remote and secure. Incidentally, there is an awesome beach bar / restaurant (Zephyr) literally next door that you can walk out along the beach to, as well as Lantern (the main hotel) which is a really nice walk along the beach to and has a really nice bar / restaurant / beachfront lounging area.

- We also did a day trip to Galle (easy 60 min drive) and you can also very easily get to Weligama down the coast too.

- Friendly service.

Areas for improvement:

- Reveal really need to be more clear as to how all their properties fit together. I’d suggest that they do this as standard with guests when checking in I.e. take 5-10 mins to explain, or make it clearer on their listings.

- For example, with the exception of breakfast, whilst you can order from a food menu at the villas, they have to go and collect it from the hotel down the road (c. 250m away). The same goes for ordering a beer / cocktail - they don’t have an alcohol licence at the villa, so you can order drinks but they have to run down to the hotel to get it. This isn’t necessarily a problem (and the food is delicious!!) just something we didn’t feel was really explained or made obvious until we asked. Basically, I would class it more as a well-catered AirBnB.

- As above, service really was super friendly, helpful and enthusiastic throughout, but there were a few little bits that could elevate them to a real luxury property (e.g. we had to leave at 7am to catch our flight, but breakfast opens at 7. Considering the cost and that we’d stayed 6 nights, we felt it would have maybe been a nice touch just to accommodate a slightly earlier opening e.g. 6.30am). Also, when we checked in we were basically left alone downstairs for 30 mins without much of a welcome as our room was prepared - again, not a huge issue by any means, but just played more into the feeling of it being a BnB / catered apartment. 

- Given the above, for what we paid in comparison to surrounding places / Sri Lanka generally, if honest we felt value for money wasn’t quite as strong here.

As per one of the other reviews, this place has loads of potential but just needs to tweak a few bits.
title: Great location / space, but a few tweaks needed

placeInfo/address: 53A Galle Road, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81740 Sri Lanka
text: A private Villa with a pool right on the stunning southern beachfront… Tailor made service setup by the always reachable Lakmal and his amazing team, who pampered us by meeting any and every need… and then, one of the best personalised spa experiences with the magician Dewi! What more can one ask for? If you need a slice of paradise, with all its delights and comforts look no further… oh wait forgot to mention the mouth watering Sri Lankan breakfasts, with the perfect ending of curd + treacle- don’t miss it!!!

placeInfo/address: 53A Galle Road, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81740 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Ubuntu for 3 nights and had the most wonderful stay. The hotel is beautiful designed and decorated and immaculately clean. Staff work so hard to keep it clean and maintained. It includes lovely touches such as Toiletries, dressing gowns and slippers too. The staff are fantastic so attentive and couldn't do enough for us. The breakfast was delicious with big portion sizes and the cocktails were good too! We had the best stay and we're sad we had to leave! 

Just a note, the hotel is about 4km from Mirissa main beach, shops and restaurants, which we were aware of before booking. We were easily able to get tuk tuks from the hotel to Mirissa for around 500-600LKR.
title: Such a beautiful place to stay!

text: We have travelled around Sri Lanka and stayed at 4 different 5* hotels. While it has been a pleasant experience, this hotel is more commercialised compared to the others we stayed in. The room was very clean with stunning sea views, but sadly lacking in a hairdryer that we had to ask for and wait 15 minutes while it was delivered. The pool area is good and the swim up bar is a very nice touch. The buffet at breakfast and dinner has a fantastic choice, but sadly the hot dishes were not very hot and a bit of a disappointment. Compared to our other hotels the service in the restaurant was average at best. When checking out 2 of the lads at the desk asked for a mention in our review. Sorry but from my point of view, all you really did was take my money for drinks and a meal and I didn’t receive any service from you. Would I praise every checkout assistant whenever I went shopping at the supermarket, I think not.
title: A nice place to stay

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed here for the first night of our tour of Sri Lanka, it is not too far from the airport.  Rooms did indeed have an excellent sea view , so for once that promise did live up to the hype.  Rooms are good, if a little shabbily finished around the edges in bathroom/shower.   Air con works well, good shower. Our room wasn’t ready when we arrived (we did arrive early), but they had changing rooms to allow us to sit by pool, we spent most of the day in the garden / pool area for the afternoon, very pleasant. Pool has a small swim-up bar. Towels provided.  It didn’t bother us but there were a lot of crows round, I guess if you were there for a few days their call may get on your nerves after a while. Went for a walk on the beach. Great beach, but beach is pretty littered which is a shame. We asked for a-la-carte for dinner, but somehow in communication issues they ended up giving us the buffet which I guess they push as its easier for them. So if you don’t want the buffet, make sure you are understood.  It was pretty good but was a lot of food! Wine is expensive. Staff need to sell amenities a bit more, I didn’t know there was a gym (no-one mentioned it) until we left and we only found the roof-top bar by mistake!   But all in all, a perfect stop for one night at start of tour.
title: Fine hotel relatively near airport to start tour of Sri Lanka. Garden/Pool area excellent
