placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
Das Hotel eignet sich hervorragend für einen letzten Stopp nach einer schönen, ereignisreichen Rundreise durch Sri Lanka. 
Wir haben die 2 Tage sehr genossen, vor allem das reichhaltige Frühstücksbuffet, alle sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend. Shan verbreitet grundsätzlich gute Laune in der Lobby und ist sehr hilfsbereit, wie auch der Rest der Angestellten.
Keine 100m Fußweg entfernt befindet sich ein sehr gutes italienisches Restaurante, dass nach dem scharfen Essen der letzten 2 Wochen eine Wohltat für den Gaumen war.
Wir würden dieses Hotel definitiv jedem Empfehlen.
Minimaler Minuspunkt: Um eine Liege zu ergattern, muss man um 10 auf der Liegewiese stehen oder typisch deutsch um 8 reservieren. Vielleicht könnte man da etwas aufstocken.
title: Toller Abschluss unseres Urlaubes

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
A hotel with breathtaking views and some of the most stunning sceneries you’ll witness right from your balcony. Though it’s an older property, it is well-maintained, offering a blend of charm and comfort. The deluxe rooms are spacious, clean, and neatly arranged. The pool is decent, and the hotel also features a tennis court and a ground for outdoor activities. Just a 5–10 minute uphill walk will lead you to a natural waterfall where you can take a refreshing bath. However, the roads leading to the hotel are a bit narrow, so caution is advised while driving.

Special thanks to Ms. Madhu for her exceptional dedication and attention to detail. She ensured that everything was perfectly arranged, and her energy and supportive nature made our stay even more convenient and enjoyable.
title: Unforgettable experience

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
My family and I had an absolutely wonderful time at Hunas Falls! From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with exceptional warmth and care by Madushika and her amazing team. Their hospitality was truly outstanding, and they went above and beyond to make our stay special.

The breathtaking natural surroundings, combined with the peaceful ambiance, made it the perfect escape for us. Our two kids thoroughly enjoyed exploring the beautiful grounds, while my wife and I loved the opportunity to relax and soak in the stunning scenery.

A special thank you to Madushika and her team for their genuine kindness, attention to detail, and impeccable service. You made us feel so at home, and we are incredibly grateful for the unforgettable memories you helped create. We’re already looking forward to visiting again soon!”
title: My family and I had an absolutely wonderful time at Hunas Falls!

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Hotel is located at a very beutiful location. The road for arrival is mesmerizing. The garden is also well maintained. Staff is friendly and the service is good. Food selection at the buffet is good being a three star hotel. 
Few Improvements that is better if done, 
1. Upon arrival even though it was mentioned as a king size bed for the suite room we got. We only received two single mattresses attached together.  
We requested to change it to get a better sleeping experience considering our back problems as well but we didnt get a response. 

 2. The bathroom amneties are not upto the standard. We had to call the house keeping to help us with switching from shower to the hand shower. It was either one that we could use considering the knob tightness and each time I had a shower I couldnt get hot water but luckily for once my husband had a hot water shower. When inquired they said keep the water open for sometime to get hot water. We did as told. I once kept it for more than 15 mins but I still didn’t get it. It is also a waste of water and time to keep the water open for so long to get hot water. 

3 There were no tissues or facial serviettes available in the room

4. Only two 500 ml water bottles were provided free of charge for a one night stay. Medically speaking 500ml for 24 hours per person is not enough. Water bottle cost is around Rs. 90. I prefer you provide unlimited water for the guests and try to do the cost cutting from some other section or may be increase the rates of the stay and give water. 

5. Restaurant staff is friendly and very good but they lack the skill of making food on time. Lunch was supposed to be started at 12.30. So we went to the restaurant at 12.30 but the staff was still cleaning the windows and the place was not of any welcoming ambience. Us including the other guests had to just sit and wait past 1 pm to get the appetizer. Initially not even water was served at 12.30. 

The hotel and the location is a truly beutiful place. If these small corrections can be done the stay could have been extra ordinary. Overall we had a good stay at the Hunas Fall Hotel.
title: Had a good stay

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip:

You have to stay a minimum 02 nights to get the most of your stay at this mesmerizing hotel
text:
Hunas Falls is perhaps most beautiful hotel in the Kandy region .  Which has 30 rooms on 150 acres . The views around are just mesmerizing .
Up on arrival the receptionist did a quick check since they had filled the guest registration card and i only had to just sign . I noticed the housekeeping and restaurant staff were humble and ever so willing go that extra mile to please their guests  . 
A special mention to the restaurant staff as they did did a wonderful job attending to all guests , since the hotel was full 
Thank you
title: "Time stands still" at Hunas Falls  which is their tag line

text:
We visited the hotel from December 18th to 20th, 2024, as a family with two kids, and stayed in the Highlander Suite with a breathtaking view of the surrounding mountains and the beautiful garden. Visiting the Upper Hunas Falls, located on the hotel premises, and feeding the fish were great experiences for the kids.

The staff, led by Ms. Madushika, was incredibly friendly and supportive, always ensuring our stay was as comfortable as possible. They even provided us with an extra bed and kid's meals free of charge.

This is a location worth visiting at least once in a lifetime, and I hope to visit again soon.
title: Unforgettable Family Stay with Breathtaking Views and Exceptional Service

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Hunas Falls Hotel is a hidden gem that offers an unforgettable experience, combining exquisite food, breathtaking natural beauty, and top-tier service.

The natural surroundings are simply stunning. Nestled amidst lush greenery and cascading waterfalls, the hotel feels like a retreat in paradise.

The service was outstanding, with the staff going above and beyond to ensure guests feel at home. Their friendliness and warm hospitality created a welcoming atmosphere that made our stay all the more enjoyable. It’s rare to encounter such a genuinely caring team that prioritizes guest satisfaction in every interaction.

Highly recommended for anyone seeking relaxation and a touch of luxury!

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The last few meters of the approach to the hotel is full of pot holes. Also, you need the best driver to take you there.
text:
“Where time stands still” it is written near the main entrance to this hill paradise around 14-15 kilometres heavenwards from the hill station and former imperial capital of Kandy. Perhaps time stands still in salutation to this natural enclave that cradles this long standing hotel. First as a teenager towing my parents, then with extended family and friends,  as a newly wed on our honeymoon and now with my own kids, escaping to Hunas Falls hotel has become a ritual. 
And this time was no different, we’re spellbound, I for the twentieth time, nature never grows stale. I read some reviews that the hotel looks slightly dated. Hmmm…interesting, perhaps this is my key attraction, not a gripe. I like things the way they are. Yes, perhaps a bit of a paint and nothing else. My Father with severely compromised mobility was with us with my mother, my wife and our kids. My kids are obsessed with the place as well, perhaps it’s in the blood or just that nature nurtures those who crave for it.
My heartfelt gratitude to those who’ve known us over the years and still there, Wasantha, Janaka and Gunasekera. They are like an extended family and they still treat us like such. And my heartfelt gratitude to the waiters who carried my father on a wheelchair up the stairs and back, with smiles. The rooms are impeccable and has everything you need, the WiFi and cable tv are top notch. 
The food was sumptuous. The new Manager Mr. Mushtaque greets us with warmth and a personal handshake. The new addition to the executive staff Maudushika blended in with good vibes and a warm heart. Nostalgia burns deep and relentlessly. 
A minor observation is perhaps the sore need of the hour to fill in the gaping pot holes and cracks on the road over the last few meters to the main entrance. Who knows, perhaps it keeps off those who aren’t committed nature lovers. To the management and owners of HFH, perhaps improving what you have may be all that you need, nature will look after the rest. I cannot wait for my twenty first visit.
title: Twentieth visit and counting (16-17 Dec 24)

text:
-Nestled in the heritage site Galle fort itself, this Dutch colonial style boutique hotel was the perfect place to relax.
-We stayed at the grand apartment suite for 4 nights  & It was a fabulous experience. 
-The ropewalk bar had the most amazing cocktails and bartenders.
-The staff are top notch. House keeping was immaculate, to the point they worked in the background every day and ensured to change towels, set up the bed for the evening. 
-Service staff remembered little details of our preferences, and followed up every step of the way. They personalised our experience.
- The ambiance, comfort, location, food everything about the place was simply attentive, personal and elegant.
- This is a boutique hotel that has mastered hospitality.
title: Amazing hospitality and beautiful property

placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you’re a family I highly recommend booking to stay in the Grand Apartment Suite as there is plenty of room, in fact it’s huge.
text: We stayed at the Galle Fort Hotel for our last 3 nights in Sr Lanka and it didn’t disappoint. It’s a beautiful heritage hotel with a central courtyard right in the centre of the fort itself close to shops, galleries, spas and every wonderful thing that the vibrant fort offers. The courtyard features ancient frangipani trees, a beautiful outdoor terrace for dining and a stunning pool tiled with green and blue mosaics. The whole scene feels like a peaceful oasis. The staff are  efficient and caring with the stand out being Roshan Rosa who provided our cooking lesson (reviewed separately). Our room the ‘Grand Apartment’ suite, was huge and elegant and easily accommodated an extra bed for our daughter in the enormous separate living room. In spite of the central location our room was really quiet with effective air conditioning so sleep was easy.  The bar is literally floor to ceiling choices and an extensive cocktail mix, the hotel restaurant is outstanding. We had a wonderful time staying here and highly recommend it.
title: Heritage oasis in the centre of the Galle Fort

placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka

roomTip: Take time to enjoy the beautiful pool
text:
Beautiful hotel in the heart of Galle with the most wonderful food and staff.  
The location is fantastic and the hotel itself just beautiful with lovely decor.  You can walk to everything from here and the hotel also arranges trips further afield if you need.
We had a fabulous stay - just wish it had been longer.
title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of Galle

ownerResponse/text:
Dear guest,

Thank you so very much for this incredible feedback; it makes our hearts sing with joy!  We loved having you to stay, and hope you will return again soon!
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Allow yourself enough time to sit on the front porch next to the bar, and watch the world go by, whilst sipping on a nice old drink.
text: Exceptional. My wife and I recently decided to escape to Sri Lanka for a long weekend and after some research decided that the old fort town of Galle would be great to visit. We booked a 3 night stay at the Galle Fort Hotel and were blown away by the building, the rooms, the atmosphere and the food. We could not have asked for a better place to base ourselves whilst explore the local area and then unwinding in the beautiful pool. We stayed in the Grand Apartment which was heavenly, with separate bath and shower area, a beautiful big 4 poster bed and a separate lounge area. A fantastic room. The hotel is located in the centre of the old fort town and is within easy walking distance of all the activities and sites. Whilst there are a number of good hotels in in area, we high recommend that you book into this hotel and truly enjoy your stay. As mentioned the food prepared and supervised by Chef Roshan is fantastic and if you ask him very nicely, he may even prepare for you his fantastic fish curry. It is not on the official menu, but i am sure that with the right  asking, he would prepare i for you. To sum it all up THIS PLACE IS FANTASTIC.
title: EXCEPTIONAL EXPERIENCE

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

We are delighted that you chose to while away a lazy Sunday afternoon with us; it's the perfect spot to do exactly that.  We will miss Ishan, and wish him well for his future, but know that the other staff will give just as good an experience as he did.  Come back and see us again soon.
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I had a few hours relaxing on the front verandah on Sunday afternoon at GFH

I enjoyed the Arack cocktail, some nice rose wine and a few delicious snacks and a beautiful atmosphere 

Very professional team - Ishan took great care of me ( I hear he’s leaving to go to the Maldives - good fortune for  the Maldives )
title: Lovely spot on a lazy Sunday afternoon

ownerResponse/text:
Good morning Sarah,

We are absolutely thrilled that you so enjoyed your stay with us recently.  Our aim is that everyone who passes through takes home the most incredible memories, whatever those entail, and we hope that you did too.  See you soon on your next visit!
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Due to heritage requirements there aren’t many power points in rooms, so ask for or take a power board. 
Try some of the attack cocktails!
text: Galle Fort Hotel is in a fantastic location inside the old walled fort. The hotel is small and rooms are tucked away from the street. The courtyard with pool is inviting. We had 3 nights and enjoyed our chats with chef Roshan & waiter Dilip who were very helpful with menu suggestions. The breakfasts and curry dinners were excellent and our waitress Nethmi was charming. Management willingly changed our room from a loft room as the bathroom downstairs layout didn’t suit us.
title: Delightful heritage hotel in great location

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Kattej,

Thank you so much for your warm words of recommendation; we are thrilled that you enjoyed every aspect of your stay with us!  Please do come and see us again soon!
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The Galle Fort Hotel would have to be one of the best hotels we have ever stayed out. The staff were outstanding and amazing with our young kids.
We stayed in the Garden Suite and it was perfect for quick dips in and out of the pool.
Location is perfect - right in the heart of the fort but so tranquil once inside.
The food was also amazing, be prepared for a big breakfast.
Would highly recommend and definitely will return if we return to Sri Lanka.
Huge thankyou to the staff for making it such a wonderful experience in Galle.
title: Hands down Amazing!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your feedback.  We are delighted that you got to explore the Fort, as well as sample some of the amenities the hotel provides, too.  As you say, the pool is not huge, but given that we are 1 of just 3 properties in the Fort with a pool, it's definitely an added advantage when looking for a place to stay!  Come back and stay again soon!
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Every room is different. Look on website before choosing, to see what suits you best (note that some have bed upstairs and bathroom down).
text: The hotel is in a fantastic location, right in the middle of Galle Fort. It's a magnificent old Dutch house, lovingly renovated, into luxurious and unique rooms. Mine was the Porcelain Suite, with a huge four poster bed, sofa, table, large bathroom and stunning furnishings. Nice touches like chocolates and other treats in the room. Not many other facilities, except a nice albeit small pool (which is a rare commodity in Galle Fort hotels). But no need for these, as you are right in the middle of many other options for spas, restaurants, etc. There's great food - the hotel has a really excellent restaurant and bar.  The breakfast was delicious, and the one dinner we ate in house was really something special. Have to note some of the best and most well-trained staff I've had the pleasure to encounter. I'd definitely recommend this hotel. Pricey, but worth every penny,
title: A beautiful and characterful luxury hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Marie,

Thank you so much for your kind words and advice; we are glad that you enjoyed your time with us.
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Très bien situé, personnel très  agréable, Dylan très attentionné. Les petits déjeuners sont très bons et copieux. Chambre très spacieuse avec coin salon et toilettes séparés. 
Le restaurant mériterait d’ajouter des salades et de baisser les prix, les plats restent bons  …

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: Gradevole albergo con attorno fitta vegetazione. Bella la piscina. Personale sempre sorridente e disponibile. Ottimo cibo di qualità e sempre diverso, preparato con gran cura.  Camera con vista piscina, spaziosa e comoda. Super consigliato, siamo stati molto bene.

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: Lovely hotel. Very spacious and comfortable with wonderful views. The buffet is well prepared, tasty, varied and plentiful. The staff are lovely, professional and helpful as is the owner whom we had the pleaure to meet and chat with. We stayed for 2 nights (as part of a group from France)and I  would definitely recommend and will return.
title: great place

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Ga voor de a la carte sri lankan curry. Die is fantastisch.
text: De staff van dit hotel begrijpt wat hospitality is. Allen werken ze hard om ervoor te zorgen dat het hotel niet alleen schoon en proper is, maar ook dat je er graag bent. Mooie gebaren, tips over de omgeving, je krijgt ze allemaal. Echt een aanrader. Specifiek bedankt Pramodya Herath voor je warme gastvrijheid en de leuke verrassingen die je voor ons geregeld hebt.
title: Above and beyond

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: Très bel établissement, on s'y sent très très bien ! Chambre et salle de bain très spacieuses, belle douche à l'italienne, lit confortable king size, plateau de courtoisie, petites bouteilles d'eau. Clim + ventilo plafonnier. Magnifique piscine (bien chaude). Diner et petit déj sympathiques, peu de choix de boissons. Je vous conseille d'aller voir le rocher du Lion au dernier étage. Seul point négatif très isolé, impossible d'aller se balader à pied en dehors de l'enceinte du l'hôtel particulièrement le soir, nous avons rencontré non loin une éléphante
title: Bel établissement

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
We were on a tour through Sri Lanka and one event during our trip was the "Mahaovita Dinner“ of the Cassandra Culture Resort. 

We didn't know what to expect, and we had one of the most fantastic experiences I can think of. I always want to find out about how people live and eat in each country, so here we had a great chance to find out. 

It took place in a little hut by a lake, started with a local drink and then we not only  learned about local food  but they showed us how the different meals were made, we could even prepare some ourselves. Then we all ate with our fingers, as it's done here in Sri Lanka.

What can I say, the food was delicious, the people very friendly, especially our host Miss Pramodya Herath was extremely friendly and open. It was a pleasure to join this dinner experience. This was definitely one of the highlights of our trip. Thank you, Pramodya and team, for a wonderful evening.
title: Great experience in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Een modern hotel met luxe ingerichte kamers. Wij hadden kamer nr. 125 op de derde verdieping met uitzicht op de leeuwenrots, prachtig! Het eten en de bediening is voortreffelijk en het super aardige personeel doet werkelijk zijn uiterste best om het steeds weer naar je zin te maken.
De dame die de touwtjes in handen heeft, Pramadya Herath, regelt alles voor je en is een op en top gastvrouw! Bedankt allemaal en tot ziens!
title: Excellent stay in top hotel with nice staff.

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Neem als lunch eens een echte traditionele Srilankaanse lunch, super.
text:
Mooie grote kamer! Héél vriendelijk personeel. Met name Pramodya ze kan prima Engels. Geeft leuke tips om iets te ondernemen! Het eten is prima. 
Het is een fijn hotel, met een zwembad dat letterlijk grenst aan de jungle. Al met al een prima accommodatie, zeker het bezoeken waard.
title: Prima hotel

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: We are returning to Sri Lanka for the fourth time, each time we start our holiday in Sigiriya.  We are very glad that we found the Cassandra Culture Resort hotel.  Every year the hotel gets better and better.  We liked that the hotel management and staff are trying to make your stay enjoyable and memorable. I would also like to mention the hotel owner, who speaks Russian very well - he is a very interesting conversationalist.  After a long flight, when you reach your hotel, go for a massage, visit numerous attractions or go on a safari.  After which it will always be a pleasure to return to the Cassandra Culture Resort. Next time we will definitely start our vacation from this hotel.
title: Holiday in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: Très belle expérience à l’hôtel Cassandra, où nous avons passé deux nuits. Vue magnifique sur le Rocher du lion (merci pour le surclassement en suite ;-))! Piscine très agréable et environnement calme et apaisant (en pleine nature). Repas délicieux. Promodya et son équipe sont très souriants et aux petits soins. À recommander sans hésitation!
title: Magnifique!

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
A very nice hotel in an excellent location to discover the Sigiriya area. Spacious and comfortably furnished room with top WiFi. Very quiet and well kept resort with a large and very clean pool. A very tasteful restaurant, which allows romantic outdoor meals in the fresh air. The quality of the generous menu is exceptionally good. However, the heart of the hotel is the friendly and helpful staff. Every wish is read from your eyes with pleasure. Above all, Mme Pramodya, the absolutely professional and very amiable person responsible for the catering area, advised us very well and made it possible to prepare a Sri Lankan specialty especially for us. Many thanks again for that🙏
We will be happy to recommend this hotel to others and will take the opportunity ourselves whenever possible.
title: A top class hotel in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
J’ai séjourné au Cassandra du 1er au 3 mars 2024.
L’hôtel est calme, aux portes de la forêt, possède des chambres climatisées, spacieuses avec coffre fort, boissons et réfrigérateur et une belle piscine avec transats et prêt de serviettes.
Bons petits déjeuners et dîners ( un menu différent le soir + des plats au choix à la carte)
Le personnel de l’hôtel est très sympathique et accueillant. Mention spéciale pour Pramodya Herath, très professionnelle et d’une très grande gentillesse. Très à l’écoute des demandes de la clientèle. Elle a répondu à toutes nos attentes et demandes. Ravie d’avoir pu faire sa connaissance.
title: Sigiriya

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Nous avons réservé un séjour de 3 nuits au Cassandra Culture Resort. Malgré un manque de réactivité sur la communication en amont, celle-ci a été excellente sur place grâce à nos échanges avec Pramodya Herath, très professionnelle et réactive vis-à-vis de nos demandes. Elle a pris à cœur notre satisfaction et nous a donné de très bons conseils tout au long du séjour ainsi que pour la suite. Elle a organisé à merveille nos activités de telle sorte que nous avons pu faire toutes les visites souhaitées à notre rythme tout en gagnant une demi-journée de repos pour profiter de la piscine !

Concernant la chambre : impeccable, propreté irréprochable, moderne, bien équipée (nécessite un adaptateur britannique et non indien, mais qui peut être prêté sur demande), le ménage a été effectué quotidiennement. La literie était très confortable. Pour ceux qui sont gênés par la lumière, un masque de nuit est nécessaire (remarque valable pour tout hôtel au Sri Lanka, aucun de ceux réservés lors de notre voyage n’occulte la lumière, il s’agit donc d’un conseil pour de futurs clients et non d’une critique). Les parties communes sont propres et la piscine très agréable à utiliser. Le spa est en construction, toutefois l’hôtel propose les massages en partenariat avec un hôtel voisin et conseillé par Pramodya, il s’agit du meilleur massage de notre séjour sri-lankais, je recommande. Un petit bémol serait le manque d’isolation phonique entre les chambres et le système de climatisation qui est plus bruyant que la norme, mais globalement le niveau de l’hôtel nous a convaincu de notre choix donc il s’agit d’un point d’amélioration qui ne nous empêchera pas de revenir dans le futur.

Le petit déjeuner est varié et très bon (parfois en buffet, parfois à la carte selon le jour ; choix entre continental et sri-lankais), la cuisine du midi et du soir est excellente : une note spéciale pour le rice&curry, d’une générosité incroyable et tellement bon pour un rapport qualité/prix excellent ! 

Contrairement aux avis notés sur le caractère isolé, nous n’avons pas trouvé cela gênant car dans tous les cas les visites nécessitent un transport qui vient vous chercher à l’hôtel. De plus, il est bien situé dans le triangle culturel ce qui nous a permis de visiter à la fois Sigiriya (les deux rochers pour le lever et coucher de soleil, à une vingtaine de minutes en tuktuk), Dambulla, Anuradhapura, Polonnaruwa et Hurulu Eco Park. 

L’ensemble du personnel est accueillant et serviable, nous avons fortement apprécié leur professionnalisme et leur discrétion tout en restant réactif. 
Merci à Cassandra Culture Resort pour notre séjour, nous avons passé un excellent moment dans le triangle culturel et serions ravis de revenir.
title: Excellent

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: Séjour de 2 nuits dans le cadre d'un circuit au Sri Lanka. Très bel hôtel : cadre dépaysant dans la verdure, grande  chambre avec très bonne literie, petit balcon donnant sur la piscine et le rocher du lion (chambre au dernier etage), personnel très souriant et serviable, petit déjeuner et repas de grande qualité. Nous avons fait 4 hôtels au Sri Lanka et celui c'est pour nous le meilleur.
title: Très bel hôtel dans la verdure et au calme

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Boek een kamer met uitzicht op het zwembad.
text: Apart hotel. Het zijn 3 verschillende gebouwen. Wij zaten wel ver weg van het zwembad en restaurant af. Kamer is schoon en netjes. Niet heel modern maar ook niet slecht. 1x een kakkerlak binnen gehad. Douche is erg fijn. Hotel is dichtbij de leeuwenrots. Ongeveer 10 minuten rijden. Personeel is erg vriendelijk.
title: Verbleven voor 2 nachten

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: The staff, especially HM Pramadya Herath are exceptional. A lovely relaxing stay. Thank you for such a lovely stay. We really enjoyed ourselves and the view was absolutely amazing! Straight out to Lions 🦁 Rock. Highly recommend for a relaxing time.
title: Relaxing

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Fabuleux hôtel 
Un hôtel très bien tenu avec du personnel attentionné.
Des chambres très propres et spacieuse, une très bonne literie.
Quant à la cuisine, c'est un ravissement pour les yeux et les papilles.
Une cuisine locale qui allie parfaitement le choix entre les épices et les plats plus doux.
Pour les desserts, les fruits locaux mais aussi les mousses et gâteaux sont vraiment un régal.
Mes félicitations à tout le staff de cet hôtel.
title: Une cuisine digne d'un grand chef

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Superbe hôtel très bien situé près de Sigirya.
Accueil charmant. Confort de haut niveau.
Service très professionnel.
Excellente cuisine.
Personnel remarquable et très attentionné.
Jean-Edouard GUILLAUME 
Belgium
title: Luxe et charme!

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: Prachtig gelegen resort met uitstekende faciliteiten. Personeel en staf is buitengewoon vriendelijk. Het eten is van uitstekende kwaliteit en meer dan voldoende. Voor gastvrijheid geven wij 6 sterren!!!! Geweldig.  De weg naar het resort is op zich al een hele belevenis.
title: Cassandra resort speciaal

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
All major hotels in Sigiriya are on the main rodes. A little off the beaten track is Cassandra Culture Resort. However, the extra mile is absolutely worth it.

The very friendly and welcoming staff is led by Ms. Herath, all service-related experiences are amazing and fullfilled. In addition, the delicious kitchen led by Mr. Nilantha is great and leaves nothing desired. 

Highly recommend this friendly and warm as well as open-minded place with great service and food!
title: Hidden Gem

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Excellent établissement avec beaucoup de cachet et d'authenticité. Le personnel est très serviable et sérieux. Les chambres sont spacieuses et bien agencées. Piscine magnifique. 
Les chambres donnant toutes sur la piscine, cela peut aussi être pénible quand des touristes indélicats sont bruyants le soir.
title: Hôtel paradisiaque de charme

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
We have just left the hotel after 4 wonderful nights at Taru. 
From arrival, we were blown away with the attentive and kind nature from the staff.
Rivandra, the hotel manager, could not do enough for us throughout our stay. He organised yoga with a yoga guru one morning and surf lessons with a tuk tuk to collect us. All were excellent and would highly recommend (They also have body boards at the hotel which were so much fun to use at the beach on the hotel doorstep) 
The staff are AMAZING. Pasindu was with us most days and he always had a smile on his face whilst looking after us any way he could. 
The head chef, Dileep and his team were fantastic. The food is delicious! Breakfast each morning is beautiful and lots of selection from the menu. We were lucky enough to experience a chef cooking class with Taru, and Dileep took us through every step of the Sri Lankan dishes - we ate them that evening on the beach (magical!!!)
Everything was super positive from the hotel and we were very happy with our stay. 
Our only negative would be the cost of drinks at the hotel … a small lion beer is 5USD and most other places are max 2USD. 
A place next door to Taru called sea dragon has a lovely lady selling coconuts etc for a very good price, and she’s always busy. 
A few extra steps was a place called Halycon which was also lovely for lunch and a drink. 
Overall, I would strongly recommend this hotel due to the staff and their hospitality. They really do make this hotel.
Thank you again,
Hayley & David
title: Excellent staff!!!

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
From the moment we arrived, to the moment we left, our experience at Tanu Villas was one of the best we’ve ever experienced in all of our travels around the world. Truly exceptional on all levels.

We liked it so much we went back at the end of our holiday for two more nights.

Gihan and his manager run a great team. The food was always fresh and delicious, the staff were polite, professional and kept the grounds spotless. The decor and atmosphere were world class.

When we had a flat tire, Gihan and his team immediately jumped into action to help us on our way.

Thank you to the Tanu team for an experience of a lifetime.
title: We loved it so much we went back for 2 more nights.

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text: A truly lovely hotel.  From the dramatic arrival through a single door into an immaculate garden and then the amazing hotel building itself and the view to the beech and ocean, it’s all breathtaking. We had the Master Room which we would strongly recommend, large with a great bathroom and it’s own plunge pool. The property is immaculate and the staff friendly and professional. The food was good but the Sri Lankan curry feast, eleven different dishes and all amazing. Oh, and then there are the breakfasts - just don’t go calorie counting!
title: A truly lovely hotel

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights with our 4 yr old. We spent the first 3 nights in one of the garden rooms which albeit small had everything we needed (except a king sized bed ;)) and was beautifully appointed. We were lucky enough to spend the last two nights in the master bedroom which was waaay larger and so lovely.
The food was delicious and the entire dining experience was great. Even though they were short staffed during our stay, Donald who waited on us did everything he could to make us comfortable.
We were happy with the housekeeping standards as well. 

Even though the property is essentially a house with other guests staying in the other rooms we felt it afforded us plenty of privacy. 
The best part of all was the beach right outside! It was practically desolate, so clean and safe to swim in. We swam every day and can’t wait to go back.
title: Loved it!

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Travelled with a group of friends and had the most amazing holiday. As you enter you feel a sense of immediate relaxation and wellness. The overall ambience couldn't be better. The perfectly crafted menus provided us with unparalleled cuisine. The service was impeccable and unobtrusive. One often refers to pristine beaches but never really finds one ..this one was undoubtedly pristine. We enjoyed our morning and evening walks and the hours spent in the sea. Dusk was spent relaxing on deck chairs sipping a cocktail and watching the stars come out on cloudless nights. Could not have asked for more.

Thank you to the entire team for making our stay so special.
title: BEST BEACH HOLIDAY

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text: We spent 3 nights in a private villa with pool and service ! Son fantastic ! Thanks for the kindness and the great food ! Thanks to our agency voyageurs du monde ! Try the crab curry and the arrack cocktail
title: Like heaven

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The villa facing the beach with a big private garden and pool behind the villa . Other rooms are very pleasant and confortable as well .
text:
A fabulous "boutique " hotel facing a totally rpivate and expensive beach but still  alive with fishermen and their traditional boats.
Our villa was luxurious but elegant and tasteful.
The personnel dedicated to the villa was extremely kind and attentive and served us excellent arrak coctails and the food was superb especially a very unsual black pork so tender and tasty...still dreming about it,the very best in Sri Lanka! and we tried many top restaurants.
The room was simple but  colorful and very confortable, we slept like babies in spite of the heavy rainfall.
Nothing else to say just that is was a highlight in our two week journey in Sri Lanka and our  best recommendation is that we would like to go back as soon as possible though so far away for us ( France). Not to be missed.
The manager has been very generous with us and many thanks again.
title: Superb too short stay A must.

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
We arrived to a warm welcome, dinner already prepared for us and a sumptuous room.

The staff were fantastic.  Very capable and friendly.

Special mention for Ravindra who helped organise my meal (I have a lot of food intolerances) and the lady who served our evening meal who was lovely.

We will be back to stay longer next trip
title: Possibly the best food on the south coast!

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
My husband and I spent the last 3 nights of our honeymoon here and oh did we wish we could have spent longer! The first two nights they put us in Kurumba house. This house used to be owned by a British lady who then sold it to Taru Villas. A woman worked at that house and now is hired by Taru Villas to take care of it with the villa guests. She is very kind and attentive and made sure my husband and I felt very comfortable. The Kurumba house is nice because it has a full kitchen, a huge lawn space with lounge chairs and tables, a private pool in the back, and private beach access. This was a perfect spot for anyone who is looking for an all-inclusive place to stay. 

Our third night we stayed in the Master bedroom. This room was honestly better than the room in the Kurumba house. If you're looking for more privacy, the Kurumba house is for you. But if you're looking for a nicer room that also has a plunge pool, the Master bedroom was definitely the best. All around, this villa has everything you need for a luxurious stay at a beachfront.

While we were there the ocean was a bit too rough to swim in but it was still beautiful to look at. We also explored down the coastline and found a hidden inlet around the corner.

My husband and I definitely have no regrets staying here for part of our honeymoon. It was beautiful and the staff even gave us a small cake congratulating us for our marriage at the end of our stay! We highly recommend this to anyone looking for a peaceful and relaxing place to get away!
title: The Perfect Honeymoon Spot!

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Visited this place over the weekend with the girls. Their service was amazing! The team there attended to our every need. The food! They had a variety of Sri Lankan and Western dishes! The food was so good and full of flavour! Can’t wait to go back!

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Everything about our stay at Taru Villas Kurumba House was perfect. We have travelled much of the world and this is now one of my favorite stays ever, anywhere. 

The villa is lovely and very comfortable. The outdoor living was such a treat, particularly in the evenings. The private pool was an added bonus. The beach access was ideal and there were only a few bicycles passing now and then and very few people passing through. The food was fantastic - everything we were served was delicious. The staff are so attentive, professional and discrete, considering there is always someone within an earshot to be of assistance. Special shoutout to Rupa who was so attentive and Oshan the property manager - they really made our stay perfect. Also, thanks to Sewwandi who very patiently coordinated my stay via Whatsapp. 
We will most certainly be back soon!
title: Little piece of heaven at Taru Villas Kurumba

text: Taru Villas in Mawella Beach was beautiful idyll amidst the hustle and bustle of Sri Lanka’s South Coast. A tastefully designed hotel with amazing rooms and a lovely garden, just a short walk from a virtually deserted beach. The highlight though were the staff who were absolutely amazing and epitomised the best and friendliest hospitality that Sri Lanka has to offer. Genuinely went the extra mile to ensure we had everything that we needed. A lovely place to stay, with great food and an amazing setting. Highly recommend it and wouldn’t hesitate going back when we next return to Sri Lanka.
title: Oasis of calm! Blissful relaxation off the beaten path.

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed in the Beach house for 3 nights with another couple.  This was our second Taru Villas property that we had chosen for our trip to Sri Lanka and again we were not disappointed in anyway.  The beach house was beautifully situated seconds away from mawalla beach which is empty and no tourists at all.  The sea was rough but we managed to swim and enjoyed the waves.  We were very well looked after and cared for by the lovely lady who works at the beach house.  We enjoyed lazy breakfasts outside and delicious lunch too on several of the days.  On our last night we had dinner outside in the cabana in the garden which was beautiful listening to the waves under the night sky.  We chose our dinner from a very varied menu and they allowed for changes to this too.  I would definitely highly recommend staying here if you want a peaceful escape and an empty beach on which to relax for a few days and be looked after as though you are staying in somebody private house.  Both bedrooms are the same, well appointed, clean and comfortable with a good shower.  The only thing I would say  is that the bed is not very large, its more of a double/king than a superking.  The bedding is very soft and luxurious as they were in both Taru Villas properties we stayed in.
title: Another Blissful few days in a Taru Villas property

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights and it was very stress-free and relaxing! The room had a mosquito netting and all the other amenities that you need.  We had a problem with the AC but it was promptly fixed. This is a boutique property so you won't won't ever get that "crowded resort" feel as there are various places for guests to hang out. The food was excellent especially the prawn salad and the Sri Lankan curries that we've had. The beach was very tranquil and we took many walks (there were only 1-2 touts that you had to watch out for). 

There are some improvements that could be made to the service. For example, when I was at the beach chairs, noone came to check if I needed any drinks.  It is unclear if purified water was complimentary outside of the meal hours. You can only pick one main item for breakfast but it wasn't stated on the menu (leading to a slightly awkward conversation).  During the first afternoon, we were offered complimentary afternoon tea/coffee with cake. However it wasn't offered during any of the other afternoons so a bit inconsistent.
title: Pleasant Beach Getaway!

placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Like nearly all the other properties under their wing, Taru Villas - Mawella respects nature, celebrates privacy, and nurtures luxury in equal measure. Situated along the southern coast of the island and the blue green shades of Mawella Bay, this charming boutique hotel has all the makings of an ideal holiday escape. The Resident Manager, Heshan was friendly and took me on a mini tour of the entire property. 

All the rooms within the Taru Villas chain emanate a contemporary yet luxurious vibe. Looming artistic canvas in both colourful and bright, as well as rustic grey tones fill the walls and spaces, along with unique decorative pieces and furnishings. Every item seems to have a purpose and complements one another. They add not just a touch of comfort but also an air of modern tropical charm. 

The food does not disappoint, in terms of presentation, flavour or quantity. There was a generous amount of tiger prawns on the first dish although I wasn’t onboard about the crusted bread. On the second dish, the curry sauce and coconut sambol was served in tiny bowls and I didn’t under the reason for this as the main was a wrap. Regardless, I occasionally dipped into the two condiments between each mouthful and it was delicious. I’d skipped dessert at lunch time so I was adamant to try some at dinner - again opting for two; a chocolate mousse with cashew nuts and salted caramel as well as a serving of espresso ice cream with peanut praline. Both were absolutely divine!

Overall, I had a wonderful stay!
title: Beachy tropical charm

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your thoughtful and heartfelt review. We are honored to hear that you had such memorable experiences during your visits to The Hill Club. It’s wonderful that you could revisit the Club with your family, reliving cherished memories from your time here in the 1950s. We are especially pleased that Hissim could enhance your experience with a personalized tour, showing you the rooms and areas that hold such special significance for you.
We’re also delighted to hear that you enjoyed the High Tea in our lounge, accompanied by the warmth of the fireplace on a rainy afternoon. We truly appreciate your kind words and are grateful for your continued patronage.
We look forward to welcoming you and your family back for another memorable visit in the future.

Best regards,
The Hill Club Team
placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
I've been to the Hill Club twice in the past 2 weeks and both experiences were stellar. 
Today we had High Tea in the lounge with a lit fireplace warming us on a rainy afternoon. The tea was excellent, many different varieties were offered. There was an abundance of delectable goodies. 
The exceptional experience was the tour by Hashem, one of the major domos of Hill Club.  My family and I vacationed at the Hill Club for a weeks respite from the Colombo heat each year for 4 yrs in the 1950s. Knowing this, Hashem showed me all the rooms that were present at that time period and how changes have been made. He took me to the hallway where I stayed as a child and to the back of the hotel where there had been family escapades with a monkey that got loose. It was a wonderful trip down memory lane.
I returned this week with my family so they could experience a real High Tea in Sri Lanka and they basked in the lovely hotel and the days of yesteryear.
title: A historic hotel to enjoy

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
The Hill Club is wonderfully old fashioned and gracious. We were very comfortable in a large room with a large bathroom. The dress code in certain areas is a good idea, as in far too many places standards slip. If you don't wish to dress appropriately there is a casual dining area beyond the billard room. 
The food we had was delicious with a good selection of English to Sri Lankan curries. 
It's the staff that make this place so special. We were told about the vegetable,  fruit and herb garden behind the Club, and its very impressive.  Ninety percent of the produce needed is produced in these gardens. Hashi was a Champ, he looked after us superbly...with a tour of the Club building, to refreshing tea on arrival and just making sure everything was fine.  Ravi and his team in the Dining room were also very attentive as was were the barmen, who are very keen to keep your drink well topped up. Rosanne in reception was incredibly helpful. It's the Sri Lankan kindness that wins. Thank you to all. We loved our stay.
title: Fabulously gracious,  and fantastic staff.

roomTip:
- go to breskfast 7.30 or later    iif you are not in a group 
- for dessert, try the cinnamon mousse with pineapple compote. Just dissolves in your mouth. Heavenly delicious
text:
I last reviewed this club in march 2024, when we dropped in for high tea
I ended by saying, "next time we like to stay here".
And here we are, staying for a week

Being resident, my first impressions were confirmed. This place is truly magical and utterly relaxing.

I noticed two things special:
In the night you find a hot water bottle under your duvet. How cosy;
At 9 am sharp, they have a flag raising ceremony. Everyting stops, national anthem is sung.

Every one is highly trained in customer service.

F &B manager mr maluddeniya and his team look after all your culinary needs, however wierd, as ours are. 
Whilst everyone is helpful, servers kasun and vigneshwaran need special mention - they have a 'memory'.

We will book our next stay before we leave.

Dr asoka weerakkody
Ward place
Colombo
title: Truly magical, utterly relaxing

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Founded in 1876 by British coffee planters, The Hill Club in Nuwara Eliya, Sri Lanka, is definitely worth a visit. As soon as you walk through the front door you immediately step back in time to those by-gone colonial days. Friendly staff will give you a whistle-stop tour of this members-only club for a small fee (approx. £1). The club doubles up as a hotel, but be warned there's a strict dinner dress code - you may be asked to change or be refused dinner! The grounds are beautiful, including a distinctive red telephone box! Holiday time well spent from a historical perspective.
title: The Hill Club, Nuwara Eliya, Sri Lanka - step back in time to those by-gone colonial days

It’s great to know that you appreciated the food, the excellent service from our staff, and the warmth of the open fire in the Formal restaurant. Your kind words mean a lot to us, and we look forward to welcoming you back for another memorable experience.

Best regards,
The Hill Club Team
placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Excellent experience in an old fashioned way as a former British Colonial Hotel/Club. Food was good and staff and service were without exception, excellent. Cool weather made the open fire in the dining room welcome.
Room was fine with a relatively modern bathroom.
title: Great stay in a former 'Colonial' Club/Hotel......not a modern hotel but charming

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Place feels like home (and what an amazing one); ambiance is just perfect and intimate, service is fantastic , food is great, there is even an evening ‘service’ in the rooms...very nice pool and lounge area with cozy garden to relax. Great ocean view...we want to go back!
title: Paradise Place and FANTASTIC service

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: King Coco is the best room of the 5.
text: We have visited Sri Lanka for 3 years running having rediscovered its beauty after 20 years! and each time we just have to stay at Coco Tangalla for a few nights. Its somewhere very special with fabulous staff, food and location.
title: Cannot keep away

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Coco Tangalle is a very special boutique hotel. An old colonial bungalow, it has been lovingly converted into a wonderful small hotel. The room we had (in an extension) was very comfortable with all mod cons and a large bathroom. 

Meals are taken in a lovely open (but covered) dining area and they are quite simply divine. We ordered lobster for dinner and it was simply wonderful. 

Overall, a great place to stay for a few days.
title: Superb

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: A really delightful intimate small establishment, where service by the all male young staff, was totally unobtrusive but absolutely faultless. The rooms were on the small side but then this is a converted house not a custom-built hotel, however a clever little trolley sits under each side of the bed to bring out your suitcases! The pool is almost exclusive with such small room numbers and dining is similarly an intimate affair in an idyllic situation. Although part of a group, this hotel retains a charming intimacy and will repay anyone who wants to feel that they have seen this lovely island without feeling that they might as well be in any holiday destination around the world. I would like to tell you about the charming preparation of the bedroom while you are in dinner but that would spoil the delight of the surprise for you!
title: Delightful boutique hotel

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed for two nights and enjoyed an upgrade to perhaps the best room, large and with a balcony. The 5* relates to this second room and more generally the excellent sevice and food. The hotel's situation is at the edge of the village, not on the main beach and tourist area. But as  the photos show the hotel offers a delightful view with a pleasant pool and surround. Very relaxing.
title: A room with a view

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Coco Tangalle was the perfect place to unwind after our tour of Sri Lanka. Lovely old colonial house, beautifully brought up to date. The food was the best we ate and the lovely staff were absolutely fantastic, looking after us so well. Beautiful swimming pool looking out to sea, and just a short walk into Tangalle to explore the local market and bustling harbour. Loved it.
title: Fantastic few days in Tangalle

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: This hotel was in a good location at the edge of Tangalle. The service was 1st class and the food excellent. We had a room with a balcony which had a lovely view over the pool and sea. The bathroom had a palm tree growing through it which made it authentic. 6 lovely relaxating days!
title: Luxury stay

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: We just spent 2 nights at coco tangalla, we both echo the reviews about how lovely the staff were. Always so smiley which we love! The pool was lovely and warm, the food was good and the general setting was good too. I must admit when we first arrived we were disappointed as our room was tiny and there wasn’t really any room for us to put our bags (we kept having to swap putting them on the bed to get clothes out). We had a tiny window looking on to the walkway so had to shut the blind for privacy so no lovely views but then again our booking was for a standard room so not too much of a problem. To be honest the service was so lovely you can’t help but enjoy your stay there! We loved the turn down service in particular and the fresh fruit in the mornings!
title: Warm and quaint place to stay

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Myself and a friend stayed at coco tangalle for 4 nights. The hotel has only 6 rooms and the first night there was only one other couple. It felt like our own private villa being looked after by 6 boys who were all absolutely wonderful. Nothing was too much trouble and always served with their Sri Lankan smile. The food every night was delicious ....the best being the Sri Lankan dishes and also the lobster.  Divine. The poolside was very comfortable with wonderful views of the sea and rocks. The pool was like a bath in temperature so spent lots of time swimming and cooling down. A fantastic little hotel and would not hesitate to return
title: Coco tangalle

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: We has the best room . Four poster bed , large bathroom with a great palm tree growing through the roof  ! No phone , no night staff .
text: Lovely quiet boutique hotel .Fine accommodation with balcony overlooking pool and gardens .Excellent food , The fish currey , made to  order , was the best that we have had .The beach was very narrow and the sea rough and rocky .
title: Serene Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: This location which has only 6 rooms and has direct access to the sea, excels by the brilliant service of its staff. whatever we needed, the staff made it possible; everything is very private. The pool area is really nice, the beach beautiful, but was not suited for swimming due to strong waves and rocks when we were there. Restaurant service for lunch and dinner as well as beverages in between. So we did not leave for three days... The food is excellent!! This all justifies the price and the high rating. There is one larger room with sea view (highly recommended), the other rooms are rather small without view or sitting area which is no issue if you don’t plan to stay a lot in your room. The facility is close to a road which was no problem as the road is quiet at night and the noise of the sea anyway louder. Please also note that the facility is not really suited for children.
title: Boutique hotel with amazing 5* service!

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: We had six nights here. We found that the staff were incredible, predicting our requirements before we even asked - bringing us the menu for a refreshing drink, or topping up water/wine glasses. The food was really high quality; both traditional sri lankan and western food, and often the staff simply asked what we wanted to eat and prepared that for us. The staff arranged a day trip bird watching with no markup - and the bird watching was a great experience in itself. The hotel is well located; we got a tuk tuk for 1000 to Hirikaya beach (20 mins away) for surfing; and the same price/distance to a Buddhist temple set in the hills.
title: Three star boutique hotel with service like a five star

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed 3 nights and absolutely adored this place. Staff were kind and helpful. Breakfast was about the best we’d had in Sri Lanka, and evening meals were delicious. Pool was clean and inviting. Rooms and bathrooms clean, well maintained and had fierce aircon if required. Only minor downside is traffic noise in rear bedrooms but really not an issue at night. Thanks to the staff for making us all feel so welcome.
title: The friendliest hotel known

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: You may have a wonderful dream ... or simply stay some nights at this amazing small hotel. Just a few rooms, a really family like atmosphere. The 8 people staff are so lovely and absolutely engaged. They know only one word and say with a smile always SURE. You can ask what ever you like and you get a smiling SURE. Everything is possible. We have had a really phantastic New Year Dinner with best selections of wine and a private firework. We could dance together and have had a lot of fun. If you look for a perfect, silent and wonderful hotel with an amazing and lovely ambiente... simply stay here. If possible I would give six points. Maaaaany thanks for the relaxing days.
title: They know only one word and say with a smile always SURE

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Our family of 5 (2 adults and 3 children) stayed for 3 nights at Coco Tangalla in Dec. The staff were absolutely wonderful and were always ready to help. The hotel manager Dinuka was excellent, arranging our whale watching trip to Mirissa and even packed a box of sandwiches, fruit and bottled water for us to take on our early morning trip. 

The chef at the property was amazing too, serving up delicious dishes that our family polished off at every meal. 

The bedrooms were tastefully furnished, with a nightly turn down service which my delighted daughter exclaimed was likely getting a new room every day! 

Big thanks to the wonderful staff who made our stay at Coco Tangalle so memorable. We’ll be back for sure!!
title: A slice of paradise in Tangalle

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Very charming small hotel where we had 2 perfect Nights. The view from your own personal balcony is amazing. Great rooms, great location, great food. ​The staff was very kind, helpful. They covered every single detail.
we warmly recommend this hotel. Will definitely come back again, even if it's just to say hello to the staff..!
title: Definitely come back again

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Small boutique well situated hotel with wonderful staff,the hotel I believe has just 6 rooms extremely well managed by Dinuka, assisted by Isuru & D.Ishan breakfast was included in our package & cooked fresh to order as was the Ala Carte menu in the evening with excellent fresh seafood platters if requested prior to service all at competitive prices, The hotel was clean & situated on the beach with a good pool & close to the markets in Tangalla.We had been recommended by my brother who has stayed at the hotel a number of times.NB having paid my bill by credit card I did notice a conversion had been done from rupees to GB pounds at 10% less than the exchange rate at the time with no recourse in very small print, Dinuka said he wasn't aware of this & offered a refund so I could pay cash stipulating this was their bank policy it was time to leave & I wasn't carrying enough cash, the difference was £20-00 but did leave a sour taste & could have been considerably more on a large bill. But all in all a great stay.
title: "A TRULY GREAT RECOMMENDATION & NOTE THE NB "

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The sea breaking over the rocks is fantastic but can be quite loud. Light sleepers may prefer a room without a sea view.
text: We stayed at Co Co Tangalla for a week at the beginning of November. The hotel is quite small, 6 rooms, with a pool and access to the beach. We ate in the hotel and out at the many restaurants in Tangalle - the food at the hotel was the best. They gave a complementary bottle of wine with the evening meal - I guess because they don't have a alcohol license. The staff were fantastic, spoke English ok, couldn't be more helpful or friendly as everyone seems to be in Sri Lanka.
title: Lovely hotel and staff

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Coco Tangalle is sensational in every way The accomodation and staff are exceptional and it is a true escape We loved the food and The Seafood Banquet to celebrate a very special 83 birthday was superb Thank you Dinuka and ALL the staff for giving us such a wonderful escape
title: We Found Paradise

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: King coco is the largest room and has a beautiful balcony and seating area.
text:
We stayed here for three nights in late summer 2018 and it was one of the best hotels we stayed in during our tour of Sri Lanka.

The hotel itself is quite small and feels like a Tropical boutique country house hotel with beautiful furnishings, lovely pool, games and cosy atmosphere. 

The beach beyond the garden is breathtaking but you cannot swim unless you walk 10 -15 minutes  to the right, away from town. If you do this take decent shoes, our romantic stroll turned into a rock scramble.

 We were in the 'King coco' room which has its own private balcony and palm tree in the bathroom.  Very romantic and perfect for a honeymoon although you really need to keep the bathroom door shut if you want to avoid mosquitoes at night. 

The food was exceptionally good and the service was attentive and professional. Like many places in Sri Lanka this hotel does not have an alcohol licence but you are given a complimentary bottle of wine with each evening meal.
title: Beautiful boutique hotel, lovely views and excellent food & service

text:
We stayed here for the first 2 nights of our Sri Lankan holiday. In hindsight, we did not appreciate this hotel enough whilst there. 

It is a brilliantly located hotel, slightly out of the centre, but hogs a lovely beachfront location. The room was spaciously modern, the staff were really friendly and  attentive (seems to be a trait with Heritance staff- see also review about The Tea Factory in Nuwara Eliya!) and the food was really nice as well, with a good mix of western/eastern food. 

For us, who like to have a wander around in the evenings, it was equally well located. The road up past the hotel, was littered with bars restaurant/cafes and shops, which meant that not only can you admire the glorious sunsets over the Indian Ocean, you can go out for a nice little stroll as well.
title: Superbly situated beachside hotel and slightly away from the centre

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
Generally has the high standards expected of a Heritance group hotel.  Huge spread for breakfast. Staff are very welcoming and helpful from the second you step into their lobby. Shout out to the brilliant security guards on the property too. Rooms are a bit small but comfortable and beds are comfy. The rooms are a little bit run down and could perhaps use a new coat of paint. The pool is lovely and so is the pool bar. The sea is unfortunately not suitable for swimming, the currents are too strong and the beach is quite a busy one, but definitely nice for a walk and watching the sunrise/sunset. 

Room for improvement - Keep hairdryers in the room it is a strange choice to have guests have to call room service to obtain a hair dryer, inform guests which restaurants are closed/open/currently not operating.
title: Relaxing weekend getaway

Greetings from Jetwing St. Andrews!

Thank you so much for your wonderful and detailed review of your stay at Jetwing St. Andrew’s. We’re absolutely delighted to hear that you loved the old-world charm, peaceful gardens, spacious room, and cozy fireplaces — it’s truly our pleasure to create a warm, relaxing atmosphere for all our guests.

Your kind words about our team, especially our young barman and his endless bowls of sweet potato chips, brought a big smile to everyone’s face!

We’re so glad you enjoyed the location, food, and all the little touches that make this hotel so special. Two nights may not have been enough, so we’d love to welcome you back for a longer stay whenever you need another restful getaway in Nuwara Eliya.

Ayubowan ! (May you live long)

General Manager
Jetwing St.Andrew’s
placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Just stay here!
text:
Two nights at Jetwing St Andrews was simply not long enough.

This hotel is glorious - old world charm with its colonial past still echoing through the rooms, in a good way.  We loved our two nights here.

Our room was very spacious and super clean, with a lovely balcony overlooking the back gardens.  It was quiet and so peaceful, getting out of bed in the mornings was difficult.

The staff were just wonderful - especially the lovely young man in the bar area who kept my friend very happy with a endless bowls of sweet potato chips with our drinks.

The location is fantastic - walking distance into the two, yet so peaceful.  The buffet for dinner and breakfast was fantastic with a huge variety of food on offer. Also plenty of seating with two dining rooms and an outside area if weather permits.

There are also lots of lovely lounge areas - many with fireplaces - to sit and while away some time.  And the fires are needed in the evenings as it can get quite cool.

Our biggest disappointment was having to leave after just two nights - I could have stayed for a month.
title: Two nights was not enough

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Many thanks for choosing to stay at Ubuntu Beach Villa and for the valuable time taken in sharing your feedback on TripAdvisor.

We are pleased to note that the facilities and services offered have all met with your expectations and glad that you have enjoyed your short stay with us.

We greatly appreciate your patronage and sincerely look forward to welcoming you back at Reveal during your next trip.

Yours sincerely,
Team Reveal
placeInfo/address: 53A Galle Road, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81740 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Take a close look at the seaward side of the shore berm for hatching turtles!
text:
Top-notch. In addition to the beautiful rooms, excellent food, and clean facilities, the staff at Ubuntu earn the highest praise. Hasitha ensures smooth operations and seems to appear precisely when hoped for with an answer, a solution or simply a friendly conversation. G. G. Didula’s smiling service is unmatched. I cannot say enough about these two accommodating gentlemen. 

The beach is gorgeous, but the surf is too rough for swimming in front of the hotel. It’s a fair trade for iconic turtle hatches directly in front of the hotel; we magically happened upon a hatch in the middle of the day! There are some small protected bathing areas further down the beach in either direction. Head to Mirissa Beach if you’d like to really swim, surf, shop, and stroll. There are two pools directly in front of the dining and lounging areas which are well maintained and inviting.

The rooms are ample, with high ceilings, sliding glass doors to the sea, twice-daily turn-down service, hot/cold showers, A/C, fridge, comfy seats and lots of open space. The hotel is very quiet and the resident beach dogs common to all such vacation spots are uncommonly sweet. 

Ubuntu has several associated boutique hotels along the beach, and the food service (except for breakfast) comes from down the road. The food is fantastic, and of course the service is great.

This part of Sri Lanka is special because it relatively quiet, clean, and extremely beautiful. Ubuntu is the perfect place to stay on the southern coast.
title: Perfect spot for the south coast

placeInfo/address: 53A Galle Road, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81740 Sri Lanka
text:
We have just returned back from our stay in Sri Lanka. The last part of our trip was to Mirissa where we spent 4 nights at this hotel. The hotel were very professional from the start with our requests prior to arrival.

We were happy to be given sea view rooms, which were amazing! The rooms were in the adjacent Beach Hut rather than in the main hotel which made it more intimate. The views from the room were amazing and the sound of the sea was so calming.

The rooms were of a great size and definitely the most luxurious out of the hotels we stayed in whilst we were in Sri Lanka. We were greeted with fresh juice and pleasant staff. We were happy with our rooms and everything seemed to be nicely cleaned. We had no major gripes with anything with regards to the rooms or cleanliness. The beds were also really comfy. Wifi was really good and available in the rooms.

The hotel is a bit further away from the main Mirissa beach but you can drive/get a tuk tuk and it does not take too long. You can also walk along the sandy beach which was clean - however beware the waves, the sea is not safe to swim in! The beach was deserted and this made it nice and peaceful. We were a bit disappointed that the hotel could not offer driver accommodation but they only have a small number of rooms. If they could provide this facility in future, it would be very useful for travellers.

The layout of the hotel is nice - be aware there is no lift but the porters help with taking the luggage up. The staff were great, including the cleaner, who was amazing with his towel art!! It was always a surprise to see what new design he had created - absolutely wonderful. We loved the crocodile the best!!!

We had great fun in the pool and the outside lounge area! There were some bugs in the pool but when we asked the staff to clean, they did so promptly. 

As someone who is prone to insect bites, I should just advise that I did receive a fair few mosquito bites in Mirissa and did spot some in the seating area/lobby. 

The restaurant is nice and again has beautiful views, especially in the morning. The breakfast itself was not bad - it is a la carte but is a bit samey for vegetarians, only offering mainly egg options or the Sri Lankan breakfast. We also had dinner one night which was not too bad but again not a lot of options for vegetarians. They have two restaurants offering the same fare - they organise a tuk tuk for you to travel between the two or it is about 10 minutes to walk. 

We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and recommend it for anyone coming to Mirissa that is looking for a luxurious, relaxing stay! We felt at home!
title: Beautiful hotel, with amazing sea views and lovely stay in Mirissa!

placeInfo/address: 53A Galle Road, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81740 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Basically all their rooms are good. Two singles OR 1 double bed rooms available. Upstairs 2 rooms have beach view others don't.
text: We booked 4 rooms 3 nights on BB. First impression was no welcome. No staff to help with unloading. Rooms were nice, big, and the washrooms were extra large with indoor and outdoor showers. Non of the rooms had floor mats. With sea breeze and sand anyone can understand what a lot of dirt comes in. Finally we asked for some and got few. The sitting and dining areas did not have glass window panels to block rain shower. The first day it was heavy rain and we really couldn't stay in the sitting area and enjoy dinner either. Luckily second day rain was not so heavy we did manage to stay in the restaurant and sitting areas. The other part was the villa did not have a kitchen. Every time we order something they had to bring them from their sister villa which is 50 to 100 meters away. Just imagine if you order a fresh juice the staff had to call and order and the sister hotel staff deliver to the villa. It was time killing. We did order lots of extra food, soups, desserts, beer and many others during our stay but delivery time and system was bit messy. Some times we were feeling odd to order because we were feeling not relaxed because we saw and knew the struggle. An upmarket Villa like this charging higher rates not to have inhouse kitchen is not good. Just imagine even to bring a fruit juice someone must bring it in a vehicle from their sister hotel traveling 50 to 100 meters. The two staff at the villa was just amazing. They tried very hard to provide the services to the best at all times. Those two guys were just superb. They were extra so many miles to do their best services. Even during rainy days both of them tried their best to clean the place many times to provide food for us. Hats-off to both of them. With all that and busy services the two staff even organized a small Aurudu Utsawaya with few games. That was really nice of them. We never requested but it was planned by them. The Manager was very caring and attentive and even offered us 8 pizzas free. Very nice of him. I also noticed even the room cleaning boys were very good. Every single day they cleaned and mopped all rooms. Those services at the villa were excellent. All in all it was a nice stay. Nice Villa. Nice Beach front. Nice two pools. Nice cosy comfy rooms. My only advice is the management to look in to my few concerns and upgrade them soon. Once again my loving regards to both the in-house staff for their excellent-superb-attentive-never say no service.
title: Very Nice Villa with amazing staff care

The staff are very helpful and polite. Special thanks to Saranaga for coordinating and assisting us in every way possible to arrange a relaxing and enjoyable stay. Especially for organising the floating breakfast last minute, was perfect! 

We can definitely recommend the hotel, especially the bathroom and outdoor shower in our room was amazing.

One critic point is that you have to go to the main hotel for dinner, but the hotel will arrange a Tuk Tuk to take you to the main hotel free.

If you want to go to Mirissa city center you need a Tuk Tuk which is about 400 rupees each way.

This hotel and staff were just amazing and we would love to return one day!
title: Best place in Mirissa

text: Would highly recommend Cassandra Culture Resort to anyone visiting Sri Lanka or Sigiriya. placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Book your room in time. They do not have many rooms so it would be a shame to mis out on this hotel. 

Do the local village experience !
text:
We had a wonderfull stay at this resort. A warm welcome and all friendly staff. Room are huge with good aircon and spacious bathroom. Great to sit on your large balcony. 

From the resort you can see the Lion Rock also.

The food at the restaurant is delicious with good portions and reasonable prices. 

An other highlight was the new to start eco village experience. Our guide Pramodya and her team did a wonderfull job in hosting us. It was a short walk tot the local temple where we offered some flower. After this we walked to the lake with a beautiful view. Some local people where raking a bath also. 

Than the local pick up truck was waiting to bring us to aunties home. 
Aunties cocked us as delicious meal with the famous hopper and some curries. The whole team did a great job.
title: Amazing stay and experience

roomTip: Ask for a room overlooking the pool.
text: The Cassandra Culture Hotel was a wonderful place to stay.  We always felt like honoured guests and were very well looked after.  Peres and Komudu (sorry if spelt wrong) were amazing and were very available any time we needed anything.  Thank you Peres for preparing a special Devilled Beef for this Australian.  It had me sweating but was so tasty.  Thank you also for the opportunity to plant trees at the venue with the kids - what a great way to give back to your wonderful land.  This hotel is very well situated to visit Sigiriya and the near-by ancient capital Anuradhapura.  The kids rated the pool and ability to play whilst we ate next to the pool very highly.  Thoroughly recommend this hotel.  Thank you.
